description: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee conducted hearings last week on a bill requiring the Central Intelligence Agency to provide the appropriate Congressional committees with the same intelligence analyses it regularly furnishes the White House. This legislation, introduced last year by Senator Cooper, ought to be expedited in the interests of strengthening the machinery of foreign policy.

title: Physicians Stress Safety In Exhibit at Auto Show
description: While other exhibits at this week's International Automobile Show feature sleek new cars and hostesses in lowcut gowns, one exhibit is trying to attract customers with a film about car collisions and a monograph on improving school buses,

title: Richey and Orantes Gain South African Semifinals
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, April 4 (Reuters)Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., the topseeded player, was forced to produce his best tennis today against Marty Mulligan, an unranked Australian, to advance to the semifinals of the South African open tennis championships.

title: Embassy in Mexico City Is a Last Vestige of Republican Spain
description: MEXICO CITY, April 4He looked more like an aging Italian actor than a Spanish diplomat without a government. He was tall and erect, elegant in the powdergray jacket with gold buttons, and he wore the brown turtleneck easily.

title: Improved Campanella Is Put on a Bland Diet
description: VALHALLA, N. Y., April 4 (AP) Roy Campanella, the 50yearold former Brooklyn Dodgers catcher who has been hospitalized since last Thursday with a blood clot on his lung, was reported improved today.

title: Spare the Rod
description: Spare the rod and spoil the child is a wrongheaded adage that continues to get approving nods from selfappointed upholders of the old virtues. It is difficult to fathom why the administration of premeditated, painful punishment by a bigger and stronger person could instill anything other than the belief that force triumphs.

title: A Correction
description: A work in the art exhibition at Georg Jensen was incorrectly attributed to Paul Rand in Monday's New York Times. The work, two nudes and globe, is the creation of Henry Wolf.

title: Man In the News
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 4 In this white, Protestant, Republican, quietly conservative and Germanic city, Federal District Judge R. Dixon Herman is regarded as a paragon of middleclass virtue and solidity.

title: Baseball Owners Vote To Make No New Offer
description: CHICAGO, April 4Despite some sentiment to make some sort of counter offer, baseball's club owners voted tonight to stick by their no new offer position and urged the players to end their strike while negotiations continued.

title: Butz to Confer in Moscow On the Sale of Feed Grains
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz will lead a delegation to the Soviet Union this weekend for talks that the Administration hopes will lead to a multimillion dollar, longrange sale of American grain and feeds to the Russians.

title: South Africa Convicts 13 Blacks Of Plotting to Oust Government
description: CAPETOWN, April 4Thirteen black South Africans were found guilty today of conspiring to raise money and recruits for political indoctrination and guerrilla training and of plotting to overthrow the Government with foreign assistance.

title: Tennessee Is 10th to Ratify Equal Rights Amendment
description: NASHVILLE, April 4 (AP)Tennessee has become the 10th state to ratify the women's equal rights amendments to the Constitution, despite a late move to delay action.

title: LIBERALS BACK RYAN, BINGHAM
description: The Liberal party has endorsed Representative William F. Ryan of Manhattan and Representative Jonathan B. Bingham of the Bronx for reelection in their newly reapportioned Congressional Districts.

title: Pest Sterilization Planned
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (UPI) The Agriculture Department has decided to increase by 50 per , cent its sterilization of screwworm flies in an effort to do away with the cattle pest along the border between the United States and Mexico, Senator John G. Tower, Republican of Texas, said today. The program involves the radioactive sterilization of the male fly, which then mates with the fel male and stops the life cycle.

title: Advertising:
description: A clue to the direction in which the advertising business may be headingmay be found in the announcement that copywriters ire being offered a oneday seminar on advertising and the law.

title: DARTMOUTH OFFERS EQUALHIRING PLAN
description: HANOVER, N. H., April 4Dartmouth College yesterday made public a plan to appoint women to at least 25 per cent and members of minority groups to at least 10 per cent of the faculty positions being recruited over the next decade.

title: STEFAN WOLPE, 69, COMPOSER, IS DEAD
description: Stefan Wolpe, the composer, died yesterday afternoon in his apartment at Westbeth Village, 473 West Street. He was 69 years old and had suffered from Parkinson's disease for nine years.

title: Fiddling Unites Counterculture and Folks
description: UNION GROVE, N. C.The tents were folded, the last trailers dragged out of the mud and sent off down Highway. 901, and there was nab his much left to do in Union Grove yesterday except count the gate receipts.

title: Amex to Lift Its Standards for Listings
description: The American Stock Exchange announced plans yesterday for a substantial increase in the requirements for corporations to obtain listings for their shares.

title: To the Fans, It Was Bravo, Charlie
description: Everyone, it seemed, was there, including a few who weren't expected at all.

title: Moscow Refuses Swede a Visa To Give Award to Solzhenitsyn
description: STOCKHOLM, April 4The Soviet Embassy said today that it had refused to issue a visa to the secretary of the Swedish Academy to travel to Moscow to present the Nobel Prize for Literature to Aleksandr I, Solzhenitsyn.

title: Rome's Police Act to Protect Women Tourists From Romeos
description: ROME, April 4Police patrols were reinforced today at the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Navona and other landmarks to protect women sightseers from wouldbe Latin lovers.

title: 3 Democrats Back U.S. Right to Renew Raids in the North
description: Three Democratic Presidential candidates, appearing together on a television program as the polls opened in the Wisconsin primary, agreed yesterday that President Nikon would be justified in ordering a new bombing assault on North Vietnam to protect the remaining ,American forces in the South.

title: Gen. Westmoreland Cancels Yale Talk As Melee Erupts
description: NEW HAVEN, April 4.Gen. William Westmoreland canceled a planned address to the Yale Political Union last night as 600 loud and occasionally violent demonstrators swarmed into the Yale Law School, where the speech was scheduled.

title: $1.6BILLION SOUGHT DUE TO DOLLAR CUT
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP) President Nixon sent Congress for urgent consideration today a request for $1.6billion supplemental appropriation to increase United States contributions to various international financial institutions to offset the impact of devaluation of the American dollar.

title: Writer Is Not Available
description: MOSCOW, April 4Mr. Solzhenitsyn was reported tonight to have heard that permission was refused for Dr. Gierow to come here to deliver the 1070 Nobel Prize for Literature. But the Soviet novelist was not available for comment.

title: SHOUP IS CHANGING MARKETING SYSTEM
description: The Shoup Voting Machine Corporation, a subsidiary of the MacrodyneChatillon Corporation that makes about 40 per cent of the voting machines used in the United States, announced yesterday that it would stop marketing election equipment and would instead distribute its products through Computer Election Systems, Inc.

title: Fischer Announces He Is Ready to Play For the World Title
description: Bobby Fischer has notified the International Chess Federationin a cablegram received moments before the deadline set for his disqualificationthat he is ready to play for the world championship chess title on the terms already set by the federation.

title: CONTROLS URGED ON PROSECUTORS
description: ALBANY, April 4Tight controls on pica bargaining, in which the prosecutor would have to submit in writing his consent to a negotiated deal with a defendant, were proposed today by the chairman of the Joint Legislative Committee on crime.

title: NIXON DISPATCHING ADDITIONAL B52'S
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The United States tonight ordered the deployment of 10 to 20 more B52 bombers to Indochina to strengthen, the American ability to respond to the new North Vietnamese offensive.

title: Alert Reported by North
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, April 4 (Agence FrancePresse) Quangbinh, the North Vietnamese province bordering on the demilitarized zone, has been placed in a state of alert, the North Vietnamese press agency reported today.

title: ROY W. M'DONALD, LAWYER HERE, 66
description: Roy W. McDonald, a senior partner in the law firm of Donovan, Leisure, Newton & Irvine, died Monday at his home,.3 Tory Lane, Scarsdale, N. Y. He was 66 years old.

title: Dr. Gustav Bychowski Is Dead; Psychoanalyst, Student of Freud
description: Dr. Gustav Bychowski, a psychoanalyst who had studied with Freud, died of a heart attack on Monday while vacationing in Morocco. He was 76 years old and lived at 1148 Fifth Avenue and in Weston, Conn.

title: BANGLADESH GETS U.S. RECOGNITION, PROMISE OF HELP
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 The United States extended formal diplomatic recognition today to Bangladesh, the nation of 70 million Bengalis that declared independence from Pakistan in December. Some 60 other countries had already recognized the new nation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: An air of hysteria surrounds the topic of welfare payments these days and it is sad that The Times accepts the conclusions of a study conducted by Nicholas Kisburg and Assemblyman Andrew Stein without at least checking with serious scholars in the field. [Editorial March 14.] Readers who are led to believe that Messrs. Kisburg and Stein are possessed of special wisdom that can lead to salvation are warned of the following pitfalls:

title: VIRUSES ISOLATED IN WATER SUPPLY
description: Scientists at Michigan State University have isolated viruses from drinking water, apparently for the first time in the United States. Because of the circumstances of the finding, the scientists say that it points to a potentially serious health hazard that may exist in many water supplies.

title: A REPUBLICAN WINS ILLINOIS HOUSE RACE
description: AURORA, III., April 4 (UPI) Cliffard D. Carlson, Republican industrialist, was elected today to an eightmonth term in Congress, filling the vacancy created when President Nixon named former Representative Charlotte T. Reid to the Federal Communications Commission,

title: Productivity Gauge Unveiled By Commerce Department
description: WASHINGTON, April 4A new measure of the production of the nation's nonfinancial corporations showed today an annual growth of output of 4 per cent a year from 1948 to 1971.

title: Baptists Ask Restitution For Acquitted Chaplain
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 4 (AP)The American Baptist Convention said today that it would not provide new chaplains for the Navy until full restitution was granted to Comdr. Andrew Jensen, the chaplain who was acquitted last week of conduct unbecoming an officer.

title: REV. LUTHER D. REED, EDUCATOR, 99, DEAD
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 4 The Rev. Dr. Lther Dotterer Reed, president emeritus of Lutheran Theological Seminary and author of The Lutheran Liturgy, died here yesterday. He was 99 years old.

title: 2 Die in Yugoslav Epidemic
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, April 4 (AP)The toll in the Yugoslav smallpox epidemic rose by two today making a total of 25, federal health authorities reported. The number of patients was up one from yesterday to 148 cases.

title: Hanoi Says Threat Won't Deter Forces
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, April 5Hanoi has declared that threats to bomb North Vietnam could not blunt the Communist forces determination to fight and to win the war in Vietnam.

title: PENNSY BACKS SALE OF COLUMBUS SITE
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, April 4 (AP)  The Convention Center Building Commission announced today that the management and trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company approved last month an agreement to sell the Union Station site here for $5.7million.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In evaluating the jolt received by the Administration's economic stabilization program with the walkout of labor representatives from the Pay Board, one should compare its basic criteria with the program's performance. Let's recall the basic guidelines laid down for Phase Two: the rate of inflation measured by the customer price index (C.P.I.) was to be reduced to 2.5 per cent per annum and wage increases were to be restricted to 5.5 per centa 3 per. cent productivity factor plus the 2.5 per cent increase in the C.P.I.

title: Allstate Insurers Elect Chairman
description: Archie R. Boe, 51yearold vice chairman of the Allstate Insurance Companies, became board chairman and chief executive officer of the insurer yesterday following the retirement of Judson B. Branch, who had held the posts. Mr. Branch was 65 in December.

title: EXIMBANK PLANS LOANS TO TAIWAN
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, April 4Henry Kearns, president and chairman of the ExportImport Bank of the United States, said today that his institution is prepared to extend an unlimited amount of longterm credits for public and private projects in Taiwan.

title: Yankees Put Off Opener, Paying Homage to Hodges
description: The New York Yankees, in respect for the memory of Gil Hodges, will not open their season tomorrow even if the players strike is settled, Michael Burke, Yankees president, announced yesterday.

title: PEACETALK MOVE REPORTED BY INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, April 4Prime Minister Indira Gandhi said today that India was in direct touch with Pakistan and offered friendship to India's oldest enemythe strongest signs yet of progress toward peace talks on the subcontinent.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: ECONOMIC AND

title: Women to Boycott Beef
description: KEENE, N.H., April 4 (UPI)A group of 60 women, unhappy with current meat prices, announced today that they were organizing a 'beef boycott here. Mrs. Mary Gregory said the boycott would affect all eight supermarkets in the Keene area.

title: Brazil Begins Modernizing Beef Industry
description: PORTO ALEGRE, BrazilThe news of soaring meat prices in the United States, the continuing European tourism boom and the rapid urbanization of this country are stirring the longdormant Brazilian beef industry.

title: Flat bush Faithful Pay Last Respects to Gil Hodges
description: Frederick Gentile, a 12yearold Little Leaguer, stood in the long line on Flatbush Avenue, his head covered by a baseball cap with the letters GH.

title: Singer Wins Navy Award
description: The United States. Navy Training Device Center, Orlando, Fla., awarded the Singer Company an $8million contract yesterday to design and build seven jettraining systems.

title: Maine Faces Contests
description: AUGUSTA, Me., April 4There will be contests in Maine's Republican and Democratic primaries on June 19 for nominations to all Federal offices that fall vacant this year. The filing deadline was yesterday.

title: A Big Place for Winter
description: BOONVILLE, N. Y., April (UPI)This Adirondack village has recorded 293 inches of snow during the 197172 wintery season  and it was snowing again today. Livingston Lansing, the official weather observer, said Boonville had a record snowfall of 303 inches during 197071. Today's forecast was for three inches.

title: Advertising:Selling With Charlie Chaplin
description: How would you like to make a telephone call to ask some questions about Tarzan and while you're at it pick up some news about Charles Chaplin?

title: FRANK X. RAGAN
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 4Frank X. Ragan, a retired vice president of Standard Brands and former officer of the American Institute of Baking, died yesterday in Lankenau Hospital. He was 74 years old.

title: Fund Membership Is Being Studied By Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, April (AP)Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, chairman of the Senate securities subcommittee, announced today he has sent questionnaires to securitiesindustry leaders seeking information on institutional membership in stock exchanges.

title: CONSERVATIVES BACK 3 COURT DESIGNEES
description: The Conservative party's State Committee last night unanimously endorsed one one Democratic and two Republican candidates previously designated by their parties to run for seats on the State Court of Appeals.

title: 2,500 Are Inconvenienced By Safeway Bus Strikes
description: Strikes by bus drivers, mechanics and ticket agents against Safeway Trails, a division of Continental Trailways, entered their fourth day, forcing about 2,500 wouldbe passengers to find other transportation.

title: MarketPlace:Analyst Looks At Northwest
description: For those few who have looked at the decision that allows Northwest Industries to sell its railroad for cash to the road's employes there is considerable wonder.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your March 14 editorial in which you question the entrance of Terry Sanford into the U.S. Presidential race was surprising and disappointing.

title: 40 in New Mexico Seek Anderson's Senate Seat
Parking to Be Eased 2 Days
description: The regulation requiring alternatesideofthestreet parking for the convenience of street cleaners will be suspended today and tomorrow, the last two days of Passover. All other parking restrictions remain in effect, and parking meters are to be in their usual penalty operation on both days.

title: 2 DOCTORS STUDY ROLE OF TONSILS
description: Tonsils and adenoids can play key, previously unrecognized, roles in helping some children and adults talk and swallow, according to two British Xray specialists.

title: 1st Concert In a Series Of Mozart
description: To those discriminating people who regard Mozart as art incarnate, as music made flesh and sent to dwell amongst us, any topgrade performance of his String Quintet in G minor (K.516) is automatically an event. It is going only a little too far to say that this work both sums up what the 18th century knew about music and forecasts the romantic angst of the century to follow.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Every published mention of the baseball strike includes a statement that the owners have been contributing $5,450,000 annually to the players benefit plan and have offered to increase their contribution to $5,940,000. Nobody ever questions this terminology or asks where the money comes from and who owns it. Maybe it's time somebody did.

title: ALBATROSS SALE SETTLES DISPUTE
description: PHILADELPHIA, April (AP)Louis Silverstein bought a 48th wedding anniversary gift today for himself and his wife, Hildaa $1,750,000 interest in the champion pacer, Albatross.

title: City IncomeTax Rise Suggested By Merola as Best in Long Run
description: The possibility of increasing the city income tax to avert some of the more onerous nuisance taxes the city could levy was offered yesterday by the City Council's Finance Committee chairman.

title: Cape Kennedy Bomb Scare
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 4 (Reuters)A bomb scare interrupted tourist traffic for an hour at the John F. Kennedy Space Center today. An anonymous telephone caller said there was a bomb in the visitor's information center. More than 1,000 people were evacuated. No bomb was found.

title: Washington's ProblemSolvers'Where They Went Wrong
description: The Pentagon Papersa richly documented record of the American role in Indochina from World War to May 1968tell different stories, teach different lessons to different readers. Some claim they have only now understood that Vietnam was the logical outcome of the cold war or the antiCommunist ideology, others that this is a unique opportunity to learn about decisionmaking processes in government, but most readers have by now agreed that the basic issue raised is deception.

title: Ecological Is Refinanced
description: About $14million in debts owed by the Ecological Science Corporation to the Union Bank of Los Angeles has been refinanced on a longterm basis. the two announced yesterday. They added that the bank provided Ecological an additional $1million to settle litigation of the Miamibased company with American Standard, Inc.

title: Rabbis Assail Orthodox Stand Against EqualRights Measure
description: Spokesmen for American Reform and Conservative Judaism yesterday criticized charges by some Orthodox rabbinical groups ghat Jewish Orthodoxy was threatened by the proposed Constitutional amendment, guaranteed equal rights for women.

title: Court Curbs F.T.C. Authority On Deceptive Trade Practices
description: WASHINGTON, April 4A Federal district judge dealt heavy blow today to the Federal Trade Commission's consumer protection program by holding that the commission lacked authority to make rules defining unfair and deceptive trade practices.

title: UNION HEADS REJECT OFFER IN BUS STRIKE
description: TRENTON, April 4  Gov. William T. Cahill announced late tonight that union leaders had rejected an offer by Transport of New Jersey to end the sevenweekold bus strike in the state.

title: A Few U.S. Businessmen To Get China Invitations
description: A spokesman for the Chinese Embassy in Ottawa said yesterday that a number of American businessmen would be invited to the Canton Trade Fair, which opens April 15.

title: American Officials Detected Offensive in the Making, but Missed on Time and Place
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 4As the latest North Vietnamese drive in South Vietnam unfolds, American intelligence experts are being proved correct in their predictions that big offensive was in the making.

title: SALES ARE MIXED AT RETAIL STORES
description: Easter retail business wound up last Saturday on a mixed note at major New York department stores with apparel lines reflecting less consumer interest than home furnishings.

title: Sputtering Strike Fuse
description: President Nixon has used the creaky provisions of the Railway Labor Act to purchase sixty days of graCe in two major strike threats on the nation's railroads. Unfortunately, the recent history of that anachronistic law provides little basis for hope that its peacemaking processes will bring settlement of either disputeone involving freight crews on the Penn Central and the other sheet metal workers employed in repair shops all railroads.

title: Phone Company Plans to Spend Billion a Year for Improvements
description: ALBANY, April 4  A New York Telephone Company spokesman told a Public Service Commission hearing today that the utility had spent $937million last year for construction and modernization of plants and equipment. He projected similar expenditures of more than 61billion a year for the next 10 years.

title: Ballet Director: No to Guest Stars
description: The last thing Barbara Weisberger, founder and artistic director of the nineyearold Pennsylvania Ballet, would want is an appearance by Dame Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev as guest artists with her company.

title: Brazil Decides to Delay State Elections Set for 74
description: BRASILIA, April 4The military Government has decided to postpone state gubernatorial elections, which had been scheduled for 1974.

title: DECORATING WITH PLANTS
description: They babysit palms, make emergency house calls to revive rubber plants, manicure indoor jungles and outdoor terraces, rake leaves from office landscapes or rent out prize orchids at the peak of their bloom.

title: Public Affairs Center and Capital's WETA to Join
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 The National Public Affairs Center for Television will be Merged into WETA, Washington's educational television station, It was reported today.

title: COLLEGES SCORED ON SEGREGATION
description: Dr. Kenneth B. Clark, the psychologist, accused administrators at major colleges yesterday of promoting racial segregation, of insincerity and of hindering the academic and psychological growth of black students.

title: 3 Russian Movie Officials Begin a Visit Here Sunday
description: Three Soviet film officials will arrive here Sunday from Moscow on an 18day visit to foster closer ties with leaders of the American film industry. A threeman American film delegation is slated to visit the Soviet Union at a later date.

title: Executive Changes
description: Elgin National Industries, Inc., has elected R. G. Miller Jr. as president and chief executive officer. He formerly was vice president.

title: G. M.'s 3Month Sales Rise Slowed by Slump in March
description: DETROIT, April 4 (AP)The General Motors Corporation, hit by a sales slump in March, reported today that its passenger car sales in the first quarter of 1972 were 2.3 per cent above the yearearlier level.

title: Books of The Times
description: I'm finding it very difficult to choke back hostility to Siegfried Lenz's The German Lesson, to resist complaining that certain ponderousness weighs it down, certain unwillingness to come to the point, a certain metaphysical elusiveness. I want to indulge my prejudice against the Teutonic imagination, to agree with a not unperceptive student I once knew, who in a fit of exasperation with Johann Fichte (I believe it was) scrawled at the bottom of a term paper the message that GERMANS CAN'T WRITE, or to quoteNietzsche in a moment of extreme lucidity, when he observed, Everything ponderous, viscous, and solemnly clumsy, all longwinded and bbring types of style are develSiegfried Lenz oped in profuse variety among Germans.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am not associated with the automobile industry, not even as a shareholder, but I feel compelled to reply to Tom Wicker's assertion that the costs of emission controls can be absorbed by the manufacturer.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: WASHINGTON  The new U. S. Pacific strategy, readjusting this country's own defenses and its military relations with Asian allies, is now perceptibly taking shape. The strategy became inevitable after the Nixon Doctrine was announced and following subsequent force reductions in South Vietnam, reversion of Okinawa to Japan and the altered status of Taiwan.

title: Milwaukee Mayor Wins Election to His 4th Term
New MillionDollar Lottery
description: BOSTON, April 4 (AP)The first $1million drawing in the Massachusetts lottery will be held May R, state lottery officials announced today.

title: Mar y Sol: Unhappy and Unsuccessful
description: The musical proceedings of the Mar y Sol pop festival in Vega Baja, P.R., wound to a close early yesterday morning. For the 30,000 or so listeners who had attended various portions of the threeday affair, there were powerful doubts about whether the rewards of the music had offset the predictable, but still aggravating, physical and emotional discomforts.

title: News Analysis
description: MILWAUKEE, April 4Even before they counted the votes here tonight, the Democrats were agreed that Phase Two of their search for a candidate starts tomorrow and promises a far better test of the caliber of their candidates than the trial heats run so far. This is that pivotal moment in the campaign when major candidacies are defined and minor ones start to fade. Senator Edmund S. Muskie has been effectively stopped from any conceivable runaway. Senator George McGovern has survived to be taken seriously. Senator Hubert H. Humphrey has refused to be buried with the past. And the specter of Gov. George C. Wallace hovers over all.

title: Ticket Scalping at Garden Is Big Business
description: Big money will be made this week at Madison Square Garden, where the Knicks and Rangers are in the playoffs and where a circus and Pinocchio puppet show are drawing crowds.

title: Chaplin's Movies, Like His Return, Are Triumphs
description: The time: early morning. The place: a back alley in a city slum. The Tramp appears in a longshot, picking his serene way through the piles of litter, always moving a fraction of a second before someone on an upper floor lets loose with a load of wellmixed refuse. The film is silent except for the music, but we can actually hear the clump as the garbage narrowly misses The Tramp, who remains oblivious, his mind on other things.

title: Hodding Carter Jr. Dies at 65; Outspoken Mississippi Editor
description: GREENVILLE, Miss., April  Hodding Carter, Jr., the outspoken publisher and editor who won the Pulitzer Prize in 1946 for his editorials against racial segregation in the South, died tonight at his some here. He was 65 years old.

title: Chaplin Salute Fills Philharmonic Hall
description: A capacity audience of 2,836 filled Philharmonic Hall in Lincoln Center last night for a Salute to Charlie Chaplin in which the legendary mime of silent films appeared in his two serveson the screen and in person.

title: Bridge  Safe Lead Against Slam Can Give Declarer Clues
description: A player who has to lead against a slam contract will usually search for a safe lead. This policy may give a valuable clue to the declarer, and did on the diagramed deal.

title: Quangtri: Not a Real City
description: Quangtri is a small and somewhat Scruffy town, city in name only, with no Strategic value. It has considerable psychological importance because it is the capital of South Vietnam's northernmost province.

title: Brazil and Bolivia Sign Pacts Making Aid Formal
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 4The Presidents of Brazil and Bolivia met today on the border between their two countries and signed agreements that gave formal shape to Brazil's sevenmonthold program to aid her small neighbor, The meeting at Corumba, a steamy river town 600 miles northwest of here, emphasized a new, unpublicized role adopted by Brazil since the middle of 1971. The country, largest in Latin America, has begun providing financial and technical aid in fields in which the United States once was the principal source of foreign assistance.

title: FANNY MAY AUCTION HAS YIELD OF 7.552%
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (Reuters)  The Federal National Mortgage Association has issued $178.5million in fourmonth commitments on Governmentbacked Federal Housing and Veterans Administration home mortgages at an average yield of 7.552.

title: Chase's Quarter Profit Is Behind 71 Pace
description: Two of New York's largest banking concerns disclosed yesterday that their earnings in the first quarter ran behind last year's pace. Neither, however, published the actual results.

title: Democratic Designees for Court Are Challenged!
description: Three state legislators from Brooklyn declared yesterday that they would challenge in State Supreme Court the Democratic State Committee's designation Monday of three candidates for the State Court of Appeals.

title: Mrs. Beard Scores Reports in Media; Charges Slander
description: DENVER, April 4 (UPI)Dita D. Beard, Washington lobbyist for International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, attacked the news media today for reports that she said were responsible for the utter destruction of her integrity.

title: Price Panel's Guidelines On Rents Scored by Dow
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP) Representative John G. Dow, Democrat of upstate New York, denounced today as a complete farce the rent guidelines of the Federal Price Commission.

title: WOMEN INMATES HEARD AT RIKERS
description: There are filtertip cigarettes for sale in the commissary of the Correctional Institution for Women on Rikers Island now, but there is no gynecological clinic yet and the cost of serving fresh instead of dried milk has been found to be prohibitive.

title: THOMAS F. BRADY, TIMES REPORTER
description: TUNIS, April 4Thomas F. Brady, a former newspaperman who was director of information for the United Nations mission for Tunisia and Libya, died of a heart attack here today. He was 56 years old.

title: Juror QuitsBook Panel Over Whole Earth Catalog
description: A dispute over whether The Last Whole Earth Catalog constitutes a book has rocked the jury on contemporary affairs of the National Book Awards, one of the panels selecting the 10 annual literary prizes to be announced next Tuesday.

title: RUSSIANS PRESS ANTARCTIC STUDY
description: LENINGRAD, March 29More than 100 Soviet scientists and technicians have begun long winter vigil at six stations in Antarctica, one of which includes a new laboratory for research in polar medicine.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED IN THE WEEK
L. I. Detective's Charge Offers Glimpse Into the Politics of Law Enforcement
description: MINEOLA, L. I. April 4A feud between a veteran district attorney and a longtime detective, and a web of political attachments are raising questions about the politics of law enforcement in Nassau County.

title: The Talk of Kearney, Mo.
description: KEARNEY, Mo., April 4Jesse and Frank might get a kick out of it. A mcve is under way here to convert the old James homestead into a historical park, a monument of sorts to bank holdups and train robbery and the notorious brothers whose names have become synonymous with such capers. At last, Kearney (pronounced CARknee is ready to forgiveand to cash in on the curiosity of the 5,000 or so tourists who come here every year to peek into the crumbling cabin where Jesse was born and where he and Frank hid out in between adVentures in crime.

title: Reid to Fight Rate Rises
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 Representative Ogden R. Reid of Westchester County and nounced today that he would file suit next week to try to block rate increases approved last week by the Federal Price Commission for the New York Telephone Company.

title: Airborne Group Returning
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (UPI) Vice President Agnew will go to Fort Campbell, Ky., Thursday to attend a welcome home ceremony for the 101st Airborne Division, which has served in Vietnam since 1965. Mr. Agnew will be filling in for President Nixon who was unable to attend. The White House said the President's decision had nothing to do with the current Communist offensive in South Vietnam.

title: MANDELS PERFORM 3 SONATAS, ONE NEW
description: Charles Ives built his musical world on Americana; Bela Bartok built his on the folk music of Eastern Europe. Music so rooted acquires a definite character, and this was again apparent in the program given by Nancy and Alan Mandel in Carnegie Recital Hall Monday night. They played three 20thcentury sonatas for violin and piano, Ives's Second, Bartok's Second and Elie Siegmeister's Fourth.

title: School Board Plans To Begin Parleys With Shanker Soon
description: The chairman of the Board of Education's committee on collective bargaining said yesterday that contract negotiations with the United Federation of Teachers would probably begin later this month.

title: 130,000 Vegas Recalled By G.M. for Fire Hazard.
description: DETROIT, Mich., April 4 (AP) The General Motors Corporation's Chevrolet Division announced today that it was recalling about 130,000 Vegas of the 1972 model, equipped with an optional 90horsepower engine, because of a possible fire hazard involving the fuel and exhaust systems.

title: GRAIN IS BOUGHT ON EXPORT NEWS
description: Two Government announcements that provided a prospect of increased soybean and grain exports influenced heavy buying and shortcovering of soybean and grain futures yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: D'Amboise Improvises Fire Dance as Alarm Sounds
description: Jacques d'Amboise was explaining to an audience in Hackensack, N. J., just what it takes to do such things as a graceful pas de deux when the fire alarm went off, seven bongs in all.

title: Goodrich to Halt Making And Marketing Footwear
description: The B. F. Goodrich Company announced yesterday that it would stop manufacturing and marketing footwearan estimated $100millionayear businessand sell the assets of its footwear division.

title: TOKHEIM AND PAMIDA PLAN 2FOR1 SPLITS
description: Directors of the Tokheim Corporation and Pamida, Inc., declared 100 per cent stock dividends yesterday.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The Wisconsin primary has dramatized once more the disarray and suicidal tendencies of the Democratic party, but the Republicans are not quite as jubilant as they sound. Rising food prices, the unemployment index, the continued weakness of the dollar and the latest Crisis in Vietnam are all keeping them from getting too chesty,

title: Talks Held in Helsinki
description: HELSINKI, April 4 (Reuters) United States and Soviet ne! gotiators met for an hour and 45 minutes at the 115th session of the talks on limiting strategic arms at the Soviet Embassy today.

title: Hassan Designates Premier
description: RABAT, Morocco, April 4 After five months of fruitless negotiations with the major political parties, King Hassan II today asked Premier Mohammed Karim Lamrani to form government that is to hold parliamentary elections this summer.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Imagine running the United States Grand Prix, the sixhour manufacturers race or the CanAm at Watkins Glen with mufflers on those Cosworths, Ferraris and 8liter Chevies. Imagine mufflering stock cars at Syracuse, AA/ fuel dragsters at Center Moriches and sprint cars at Oswego. Farfetched as these speculations appear, they are within the realm of possibilities

title: Cambodian ExPrince Hurt
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, April 4 (AP)A member of Cambodia's former royal family was gravely wounded today when his car was blown up by a bomb. Former Prince Sisowath Savanareth, a cousin of the ousted chief of state, Prince Norodom Sihanouk, lost both legs and an arm in the blast, witnesses said. They said he had just driven his small car through traffic lights on a busy boulevard when a bomb planted under the car exploded.

title: Salvador, in Wake of Rising, Sets Month's State of Siege
description: SAN SALVADOR, April 4 (UPI)  Congress declared monthlong state of siege last night to enable President Fidel Sanchez Hernandez to bring the nation under control in the wake of the abortive leftist coup d'etat of March 25.

title: Hartford Giving Some Relief Clients Tickets Home
description: HARTFORD, April 4  For those welfare recipients from out of state who are willing, the State of Connecticut has been handing out oneway tickets home.

title: Capital Gathers to Toast Departing Lucets
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Champagne glasses were lifted jovially at the French Embassy tonight, but the occasion was also a bit melancholly. Ambassador Charles Lucet and his wife, Jacqueline, after 20 years in this capital, are packing their bags for a new assignment in Rome.

title: British and Guerrillas Exchange Fire in Londonberry and Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 4 (AP)British soldiers traded gunfire with guerrillas today at an army post on Londonderry's city walls and in Belfast's Andersonstown district, which is predominantly Roman Catholic.

title: Court Upsets Award To Parents of Girl Slain at Project
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn has overruled in a 41 decision a judge who awarded $135,000 to a couple whose 9yearold daughter was thrown to her death from the roof of a 14story housing project building.

title: Jackson Exhorts 1,600 at a Memorial for Dr. King
description: Black selfreliance and direct action toward achieving economic goals were urged here yesterday by the Rev. Jesse L. Jackson in a special program observing the fourth anniversary of the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: VICTOR DISCERNS VOTE OF PROTEST
description: MILWAUKEE, April 4After a lonely, 14month campaign, during which few professionals took his candidacy seriously, Senator George McGovern of South Dakota established himself in Wisconsin tonight as a serious contender for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: BRIDGE COLUMNIST WEDS MRS. HAYDEN
description: Alan Truscott, bridge columnist for The New York Times, and Mrs. Dorothy Hayden, one of the foremost women bridge players, were married yesterday at a simple ceremony at the Municipal Building.

title: A Man of Many Roles
description: The Rev. Adam Clayton Powell Jr. played many roles during a lengthy and controversial public career and he seemed, to play each with his own special exuberance.

title: Dr. Ronan's Withdrawal
description: William J. Ronan's open letter withdrawing himself from consideration as executive director of the New York Port Authority, a post for which he was eminently qualified, stressed a vital point: whoever takes over the fiscally powerful bistate agency must turn it completely around. If the mass transit needs of either New York New Jersey are ever to be met, it is the Port Authority that must begin trying to meet them.

title: Notes on People
description: After three years as Secretary of the Navy, John H. Chafee resigned. He cited no reason, but he was expected to return to Rhode Island to run for the. Senate.

title: Plainclothes Police Getting Headbands For Identification
description: As a result of the mistaken identity fatal shooting of detective by a patrolman in Queens on Monday, the Police Department yesterday ordered plainclothes policemen on street patrol to wear colorcoded headbands, so they will be identifiable to other policemen.

title: Cornell Picks PublicHealth Chief
description: The appointment of Dr. George G. Reader as Livingston Farrand Professor and chairman of the department of public health at Cornell University Medical College was announced yesterday.

title: U.S. Tobacco Plans Split
description: Stockholders of the United States Tobacco Company at yesterday's annual meeting in Flemington, N.J., approved twoforone stock split and an increase in the authorized common to 20 million shares from 8 million.

title: Miller Charges Baltimore Executive With Falsifying the Issues in Baseball Strike
description: Jerold Hoffberger, board chairman of the Baltimore Orioles, is the most active club owner trying to break the baseball players strike and has the other owners acting as puppets on his string, Marvin Miller charged yesterday.

title: Fund Is Started for Bus Victims As Bills Are Put at a Million
description: A physician who treated many of the children injured in the school bustrain collision near Nyack on March 24 said yesterday that their total medical expenses could exceed $1million,

title: U.S. Panel Urges a Drive to Control V.D.
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Federal health officials recommended today a massive drive against venereal disease combining increased testing, stricter reporting, better education and more money.

title: Adam Clayton Powell, 63, Dies in Miami
description: MIAMI, April 4Adam Clayton Powell, a Baptist minister who became a prominent spokesman and symbol for blacks during 11 successive terms he served in the House of Representatives, died in Jackson Memorial Hospital here tonight from complications that followed prostate surgery. He was 63 years old.

title: Enemy Asks New Paris Talks; Allies Reply With Indignant No
description: PARIS, April 4  North Vietnam and the Vietcong sought today to reopen the suspended peace talks but were indignantly turned down by the United States and South Vietnam.

title: Drinking at 18 Approved
description: BOSTON, April 4 (AP) TheMassachusetts Senate approved today and sent to Gov. Francis W. Sargent legislation that would lower the state's legal thinking age to 18 years. If signed by the Governor, the measure would become effective March 1, 1973. The bill also provides for nonbinding referendum in November to determine popular opinion on the measure.

title: Buckley Aides Study H.U.D. Stand in Hempstead
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., April 4 An aide to Senator James L. Buckley said today that the ConservativeRepublican junior Senator from New York was very concerned about the feud between the town of Hempstead and the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development over the building of lowcost housing in the town.

title: MAYOR RUNS SIXTH
description: MILWAUKEE, April 4 After suffering his second decisive primary defeat, Mayor Lindsay withdrew tonight from the race for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Clampdown in Turkey
description: It will be a cause for deep regret, especially in NATO countries, that Turkey has resorted to government by decree and suspended all political activities. In his letter seeking assent from party leaders, President Sunay insisted that democratic and parliamentary principles would remain in force; but if the Grand National Assembly is stripped of all power this cannot be true.

title: FOE DRIVING ON QUANGTRI AND FOR HUE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, April 5  South Vietnamese troops abandoned one of their remaining defense points on the north bank of the Cua Viet last night and North Vietnamese tanks were reported moving south toward the embattled city of Quangtri, capital of South Vietnam's northernmost province.

title: MRS. J. C. CUSHMAN
description: Mrs. Helen Goodrich Cushman, the widow of J. Clydesdale Cushman, the founder and former president of Cushman & Wakefield, Inc., New York realestate concern, died yesterday in Portland, Ore. She was 86 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two Department of Sanitation employes helped rescue 28 children and four adults from a smoky tenement fire 91 Henry Street, near Pike Street, in lower Manhattan shortly after noon yesterday.

title: BULLETS DEFEAT KNICKS, 104103, TO GAIN 21 LEAD
War Foes Call Meeting
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP) The National Peace Action Coalition today called its national steering committee into emergency session in New York next Sunday to act on what it called President Nixon's move to escalate the war in Vietnam. The coalition said the Tout of South Vietnamese troops has thrown the Nixon Administration into state of panic.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: How ironic, and perhaps symbolic, Is the disappearance of the eagle from the editorial page of The Times.

title: Reds Opener Today Postponed by Strike
description: CINCINNATI, April 4 (AP) The Cincinnati Reds, seeing no sign of a break in the major league baseball player strike, postponed today their National League opening game against the Houston Astros.

title: Masters: It's Tough and It's Easy
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 4Jack Nicklaus, the favorite, said today the Masters golf tournament, which starts here Thursday, was tougher to win than most pro tournaments and in some ways it is easier.

title: Cox Upsets Drysdale
description: HOUSTON, April 4 (AP)Rod Laver of Australia won with ease, but Cliff Drysdale of South Africa was upset by Mark Cox of England in today's opening round matches of the $50,000 River Oaks tennis tournament.

title: Mills Views Wisconsin as a Step to Miami Via Massachusetts
Refugees Flocking Into the Hue Area
description: HUE, South Vietnam, April 4 South Vietnamese Boy and Girl Scouts and college students joined with social workers today in an effort to aid the masses of refugees who have fled here to avoid the intensive North Vietnamese attacks around their homes in Quangtri Province.

title: They Came to Look at Designs  and Designers
description: Chester Weinberg and his beard were sitting in the front row, quietly watching his designs parading down the runway, when he heard a woman's voice behind him saying: I love Chester Weinberg.

title: The Agony of Ulster: Woman Blinded, an Infant Slain
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 31The agony of Northern Ireland is borne every, day by Mr. and Mrs. William Groves and Mr. and Mrs. Jackie Nicholl.

title: REPORT FINDS LAG IN NAVY MISSILES
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (Reuters)After spending hundreds of millions of dollars over nearly a decade of development work, the Navy still does not have a missile capable of effectively defending its ships from hostile aircraft, according to report to Congress.

title: 3d MintoffChou Meeting
description: HONG KONG, April 4 (UPI) Prime, Minister Dom Mintoff of Malta and Premier Chou Enlai of China conferred for the third time since Mr. Mintoff's, arrival in Peking to seek economic aid, the Chinese press agency Hsinhua said today.

title: AntiUnion Protest in Dublin.
description: DUBLIN, April 4Members of a Belfastbased organization opposed to the reunification of Ireland occupied the offices of the Foreign Ministry here today.

title: 8,000 Macy's Employes Call Strike Today
description: A union representing 8,000 of Macy's sales clerical and miscellaneous employes announced last night that it would strike at 8 A.M. at six stores in the city and Westchester County.

title: ExSS Man Goes on Trial In Austria for War Crimes
description: LINZ, Austria, April 4 (AP) Johann Gogl, a former corporal in the Nazi SS, or elite guard, accused of beating prisoners to death, setting dogs on them or forcing them beyond wire fences so they would be shot, went on trial today.

title: Sunset Park Learns Why It Went Downhill
description: For a long time the people of the Sunset Park section of Brooklyn did not know what had hit them.

title: CrossOver a Key Factor
description: Senator George McGovern and Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama appeared to have benefited strongly from a heavy Republican crossover vote in the Wisconsin Democratic primary, according to preliminary findings of a crosssection survey of voters by The New York Times and Daniel Yankelovich, Inc.

title: Economic Analysis
description: President Nixon faces a nasty dilemma on farm prices. On the one horn, as agricultural economists say, he does not want to alienate the farm voteand climbing farm prices, spurred on by Earl L. Butz, Secretary of Agriculture, have been making the farmers feel more Republican day by day.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An offering of 89,965 shares of Brown Group, Inc., at $38.00 a share was announced yesterday by Goldman Sachs & Co. and associates. The stock closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 38, down .

title: BROADCAST SYSTEM OF WARNING ALTERED
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The Emergency Broadcast System, which was set up primarily to warn the nation in the event of enemy attack, is being changed into two separate systems, the White House office of telecommunications policy. disclosed today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: UNION SPRINGS, Ala., April 4 (AP)  Mrs. George Andrews, running unopposed in a special election, was elected to Congress today to serve the remaining nine months of her late husband's term.

title: MUSKIE IS FOURTH
description: MILWAUKEE, April 4  Sen ator George McGovern of South Dakota won the Wisconsin Democratic Presidential primary today.

title: Action Aides Say 7 Regional Offices Will Lose 30 Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP) A shakeup in Action, the Nixon Administration's volunteer agency, will strip seven regional offices of at least 30 staff personnel, most of them toplevel program planners, sources in the agency said today.

title: CELANESE ARRANGES $100MILLION CREDIT
description: The Celanese Corporation disclosed yesterday that it had recently completed arrangements for a $100million credit agreement with a group of major banks.

title: Dr. Goldmark Is Designated Yale's New Poynter Fellow
description: Dr. Peter C. Goldmark, president of Goldmark Communications Corporation and former head of the Columbia Broadcasting System Laboratories, has been named a Poynter Fellow of Yale University for outstanding achievements in the electronics media. The fellowship was created four years ago to honor distinguished newsmen and others for significant contributions to the dissemination of news.

title: FOURTH TRIAL SET FOR THE HARLEM 4
description: The fourth murder trial for the socalled Harlem 4 was tentatively scheduled yesterday by Supreme Court Judge Irwin D. Davidson to begin on May 8.

title: NINA VAN PALLANDT SINGS WITH STYLE
description: Nina Van Pallandt, the blond Danish baroness who became a news figure when she said she did not see Howard Hughes in Mexico with Clifford Irving, is showing the more customary side of her public self at the Maisonette of the St. RegisSheraton. She is a singer who has performed for more than a decade in Europe although this is her first appearance in an American nightclub.

title: Ball Park. Crews Ratify a New 2Year Agreement
description: Maintenance workers at Shea Stadium and Yankee Stadium ratified a new twoyear agreement yesterday afternoon.

title: Secrets Case in Japan Raises Dispute Over Freedom of the Press
description: TOKYO, April 5The arrest of a Tokyo newspaperman and a secretary in the Foreign Ministry in connection with the leaking of secret documents has stirred a controversy over press freedom.

title: Brydges and Duryea Start Inquiries on Strike
description: ALBANY, April 5Legislative leaders asked separate committees today to investigate last weekend's strike by state employes and to ascertain the cost and budget implications of the raise and bonus agreement that ended it.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Perjury Laid to Police Captain In Denial of Serpico Testimony
description: A police, captain here has been accused of perjury in connection with his alleged denials that Detective Frank Serpico ever, told him about being offered a $300 bribe from a gambler.

title: 8 File Suit Against Boston U. Over Fee Collection Method
description: BOSTON, April 5  Eight Boston University students, including five elected members of the school's student government, filed a class action suit against the school administration today in Federal District Court on behalf of the undergraduate population.

title: Successor to Hodges: Berra Name Prominent
description: The New York Mets were expected to act quickly, perhaps today or tomorrow, to name a successor to Manager Gil Hodges, whose funeral will be held today in Brooklyn.

title: Personal Finance
description: Prices seem to be rising on lots of things these days but the cost of automobile insurance may be coming down a bit for millions of drivers.

title: Union Dispute Halts Deliveries by United Parcel
description: United Parcel Service suspended all package pickups and deliveries in the metropolitan area yesteray in a dispute with a union over the reassignment of 36 employes.

title: 2 Are Seized in Paris
description: PARIS, April 5 (Reuters) The French police announced today that they had seized 22 pounds of heroin here and arrested two members of an international drug trafficking ring operating in at least five countries.

title: 2 Senate Leaders Urge Action On the Kleindienst Nomination
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP) Senate leaders of both parties said today that no case had been made against confirmation of Richard G. Kleindienst as Attorney General and urged early action on his nomination.

title: Mansfield Fears Difficulty At Nomination Convention
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP) The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield of Montana, said today that the way his party's Presidential aspirants are going after each other at this time creates the possibility of a difficult situation at the nominating convention in Miami Beach in July.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rule by Reason Wins And Survives Inquiry
description: Rule by Reason experienced a rather rough trip but managed to prevail in the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday. Under steady lefthanded whipping by Jorge Velasquez, the favored Rule by Reason moved between horses in the stretch in the 1mile event to beat Helio Rise by a neck.

title: Marine Officer Killed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 6 (AP)The United States Command reported today that a Marine lieutenant had been killed in the North Vietnamese offensive below the demilitarized zone and a Marine corporal was missing. The command said that the two men were members of a naval gunfire spotter team based at Outpost Alpha 2 when it was attacked by the North Vietnamese April 1.

title: 4 Policemen and 3 Others Are Injured in a MinorityGroup Job Protest
description: Four patrolmen and three demonstrators were injured yesterday when a group demanding more jobs for minoritygroup workers tried to storm a construction site at First Avenue and 107th Street.

title: THOMAS PETTUS, 39, W.E.HUTTON OFFICIAL
description: Thomas Wright Pettus, a general partner of W. E. Hutton & Co., in the corporate finance department, died of a cerebral hemorrhage Tuesday in Palm Beach, Fla., where he was vacationing. He was 39 years old and lived at 129 East 69th Street.

title: He Wears a Badge but to City Gangs He's NoFoe
description: What is there about a ramshackle clubhouse in a shabby storefront that draws teenagers like birds to a roost?

title: Inquiry on Food Prices
description: LOS ANGELES, April 5 The Internal Revenue Service is conducting a massive investigation into food prices to determine if retailers and middle men have exceeded allowable profit margins, C. Jackson Grayson Jr., chairman of the Price Commission, said here today.

title: COLONELS DOWN NETS, 105 TO 99; 14,069 SEE GAME
N.C.A.A. Files $285,763 Suit Over McDaniels Turning Pro
description: KANSAS CITY, April 5 (AP)  The National Collegiate Athletic Association said today it had filed a damage suit of $285,763 against the American Basketball Association, Jim McDaniels, the Carolina Cougars and others in United States District Court at Louisville, Ky.

title: Advertising:
description: S. Heagan Bayles, chairman and a founder of S.S.C. & B., was named chairman of the Advertising Research Foundation yesterday.

title: SOMETHING FOR ALL AT CLARION CONCERT
description: It was somethingforeveryone night at Alice Tully Hall Tuesday, as the Clarion Concerts Orchestra closed out its 15th season with a premiere, a commission, a concerto, a symphony, a Wagnerian birthday present and an annivermiry performance by Kenneth Cooper, who marked his 10 years of service as the Clarion harpsichordist by switching to the piano.

title: Four Americans Upset
description: HOUSTON, April 5  Thd three topseeded players advanced to the quarterfinals of the $50,000 River Oaks tennis tournament today but four seeded Americans were upset.

title: DAVIS JURY HEARS OF EVENTS IN VAN
description: SAN JOSE, Calif, April 5In a few hushed minutes here this afternoon in the tiny courtroom where Angela Davis is on trial for murder, a key witness for the state gave his version of the shooting that took place on Aug. 7, 1970, outside the Marin County Civic Center.

title: HUE ALSO PRESSED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 6North Vietnamese troops reportedly opened a new drive in South Vietnam yesterday, striking in Binhlong Province, 75 miles north of Saigon.

title: French Connection Patrolman Wins a Suit to Regain Pension
description: The Police Department's dismissal of Patrolmen Edward (Popeye) Egan, the reallife hero of The French Connection, was quashed by a state Supreme Court justice in Manhattan yesterday.

title: A Big New Phase of. War Is Opening
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 5  With the use of artillery, tanks and mobile antiaircraft defenses in their current drive across the demilitarized zone, the North Vietnamese, it is clear, have opened a large new phase of the war centering on conventional combat.

title: Florida Rail Issue Opposed
description: John Vanneck, president of the Equitable Holding Corporation, owner of 5,000 shares of stock of the Florida East Coast Railway, yesterday asked the Interstate Commerce Commission to deny the railway's application to issue 752,384 additional common shares in exchange for $18.8million of 5 per cent first mortgage bonds. Mr. Vanneck charged that the exchange of securities would benefit insiders, as creditors of the railroad, by more than $11million.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BILBAO, Spain, April 4 (Reuters)Three women students have been arrested and charged with aiding workers in an illegal strike at a tire factory near here, it was reported today.

title: F.D.A. Moves to Toughen Its Ban on Firecrackers
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration moved today to ban the public sale of all large firecrackers.

title: AIRPORT TIGHTENS SECURITY SYSTEMS
description: An armed guard climbed out of a small red and black helicopter near Cargo Building 68 at Kennedy International Airport yesterday and dashed 100 feet across the street into the building to deliver a large blue envelope.

title: Gilmore Named Top Player
description: Artis Gilmore, 7foot2inch center who led the Kentucky Colonels to a record 68 victories and the Eastern Division championship, was named yesterday as the American Basketball Association's most valuable player.

title: Architect Selected by Jury For City Convention Center
description: New York City's projected convention center moved toward design and construction yesterday with the announcement that Skidmore, Owings & Merrill had been selected as the architect for the $100million structure.

title: Colorado Bus Crash Finding
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI) The Transportation Department today attributed the crash of a Colorado school bus in which nine persons were killed to driver inexperience and lack of proper emergency training.

title: Call the Umpire
description: The owners of the major league baseball clubs seem determined to enshrine the ghosts of Tom Girdler and Ernest T. Weir alongside those of Babe Ruth and Ty Cobb in baseball's hall of fame. The management intransigence that is primarily responsible for the cancellation of today's opening games in both the National and American Leagues represents a throwback to the unionbusting tactics in vogue in much of basic industry nearly four decades ago.

title: He's No Huey Long
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  Although Huey Long has been dead for over three decades, he remains and probably always will remain the yardstick against which all later disruptors of the settled pattern of American politics will have to face being measured. George Wallace is no exception.

title: Notes on People
description: New billing on the dollar: Romana Acosta Banuelos, 34th Treasurer of the United States, whose signature appears on $1 bills that began rolling off the presses of the Bureau of Engraving and Printing yesterday in Washington. Mrs. Banlielos, a Los Angeles banker and coowner of a food company, succeeded the late Dorothy Andrews Kabis last December.

title: Mayor Finds Pile Up of Ptoblerns on His Return
description: Mayor Lindsay returne to the city yesterday to face a crowded agenda. Among the major items awaiting Mr. Lindsay's attention were a multimilliondollar budget gap, an unresolved labor dispute with the city's pollee, a package of legislative problems In the city and Albany, and the need to cope with the customary summer youth problems, including the emergence of youth gangs.

title: Problems of the Opening Chess: Sometimes Include Its Name
Mormons Operating a Special Meeting Unit for Blacks
description: SALT LAKE CITYThe Mormons have been operating a special meeting for their black members since October, as the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints shows signs of responding to criticism of its antiNegro theology.

title: Tax Evasion Indictment
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 5 (AP)A Federal grand jury indicted today a man identified in a Senate hearing as a close associate of organized crime figures, on charges of evading $763,186 in income taxes from 1965 through 1969, the Justice Department announced. A 10count indictment naming Michael J. Yanni of Philadelphia was returned in United States District Court here.

title: Youth Shot In Legs
description: BELFAST, April 5 (UPI)A Protestant youth was shot in the legs, and abandoned houses owned by Roman Catholics were set on fire tonight in sectarian clashes.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MILWAUKEE, April 5Following are the delegate votes committed to the Democratic Presidential candidates, as compiled by The New York Times:

title: ALVIN CROWDER DIES; PITCHED IN 3 SERIES
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., April 5 (AP)Alvin Floyd (General) Crowder, who pitched in three World Series, died Monday. He was 73 years old and lived here.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WOOSTER, Ohio, April 5"McGovern Established as Major Contender says the headline in The Columbus Evening Dispatch. That's one legitimate way to look at the results of the Wisconsin primary.

title: Punjab Bans 3 Publications
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, April 5 The martiallaw administrator of Punjab Province today banned the publication of three Lahore periodicals, charging that they had been persistently indulging in objectionable writing calculated to harm the national interest. Arrest orders were issued for the editors of the puhlications as well as the publishers and printers.

title: Watson Says U.S. and France Are Winning Fight on Drugs
description: Arthur K. Watson, United States Ambassador to France, said here yesterday the combined United StatesFrench war on the international drug traffic had reached a point at which he could say: We are winning.

title: Brustein's Season atYale at High Point
description: Before Robert Brustein became dean of the Yale School of Drama and artistic director of the Yale Repertory Theater six years ago, he was an embattled drama critic, devastating the meretricious, cudgeling the spurious and savaging the commercial.

title: State Dernocratic Leaders Feel Lindsay Can Still Play Key Role
description: Democratic leaders here and upstate who were queried yesterday agreed in general that Mayor Lindsay could play a major role In the state party if he desired despite his poor showing in the Presidential race.

title: Mrs. King Is Easy Victor In Tennis at Jacksonville
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., April 5 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King breezed to victory in the opening round of the $18,000 Virginia Slims tennis tournament today by shutting out Pam Austin of Rolling Hills, Calif., 60, 60.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Ex. change yesterday issued its latest report on changes in stockownership by major stockholders, officers and directors of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange did not issue such a report this week.

title: LINDSAY TO PRESS POLITICAL CAREER
description: Despite the dashing of his Presidential hopes, Mayor Lindsay indicated yesterday that he would continue his political career and might even run for President again in 1976.

title: Pompidou,Explaining Vote,Sees Market as a Great New Force
description: PARIS, April 5 President Pompidou called on the European Economic Comunity today to assert its independence as a great new economic, monetary and political power willing to cooperate but capable of resisting and determined not to yield.

title: Tests for Principals Biased, Appeals Court Holds
description: A decision barring the traditional examinations for choosing publicschool principals and supervisors here was affirmed yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Don Carlo at Met Marked by Beauty
description: Montserrat Caballa was supposed to sing in Don Carlo last September when it opened the Metropolitan Opera season, but impending motherhood kept her home in Barcelona. On Tuesday night, the Spanish soprano made her first appearance here this season, and it was in the same Verdi work.

title: ROLE ABROAD VITAL, WESTINGHOUSE SAYS
description: PITTSBURGH, April 5The shareholders of the Westinghouse Electric Corporation were told today that 1972 has the potential of being another record year for the diversified electricalequipment manufacturer. But its chairman, Donald C. Burnham, and other executives stressed that a multinational approach was vital to the future growth and profitability of the company, which last year earned a record $175.2million, or $2.08 a share, on $4.6billion in sales.

title: S.E.C. URGES CARE ON COMPANY NEWS
description: WASHINGTON, April 5The Securities and Exchange Commission warned corporations today to take more care, when preparing their news releases, to highlight and explain unusual or nonrecurring transactions that have affected their earnings.

title: Gifts to Colleges Set a Record, Over $1.8Billion, in 197071
description: Voluntary financial support for colleges and universities reached a record high for the academic year ending June, 1971, despite uncertain economic conditions and widespread dissatisfaction with campus unrest.

title: M'GOVERN GAINS 54 OF DELEGATES IN WISCONSIN RACE
description: MILWAUKEE, April 5Senator George McGovern of South Dakota, in winning a solid victory yesterday in the Wisconsin Democratic Presidential primary, captured 54 of the state's 67 delegates to the party's national convention.

title: 9 Superagencies Fail to Reply To Beanie on Time Off Granted
description: The city's nine superagencies have failed so far to respond to Controller Abraham D. Beame's request for information regarding compensatory time off and vacations granted Managerial and executive employes since last Jan. 1.

title: Bureau of Standards Loses Chief to I.B.M.
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (UPI)Dr. Lewis M. Branscomb resigned as director of the National Bureau of Standdards today to become chief scientist and vice president in charge of research for International Business Machines.

title: 8 KILLED IN DALLAS IN CHEMICAL BLAST
description: DALLAS, April 5 (AP)Eight persons were killed today when a series of explosions blasted a chemical plant.

title: Major Parties on Staten Island Near a CrossEndorsement Ban
description: Leaders of the Democratic and Republican parties on Staten Island have reached an agreement that their candidates for public office cannot accept endorsements from the minor political parties, the Conservative and the Liberal.

title: News of Dogs
description: St. Thomas rectory at Owings Mills provides a haven for bloodhounds as well as, its Maryland parishioners. The dogs, who all appropriately carry the prefix The Rectory's, are owned by the rector, the Rev. George E. Sinkinson Jr., and his wife and have amassed more victories than any other bloodhound kennel in America. Dogs bred at the rec tory have been best of breed at Westminster five years in a row, starting in 1968. This year they swept the board, taking, winners dog, winners bitch, best of breed and best of opposite sex.

title: Solzhenitsyn May Get Nobel Prize in Embassy
description: STOCKHOLM, April (UPI)The Swedish Government said today that it. was prepared to present the Nobel prize for literature to the Russian writer Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn at the Swedisth Embassy in Moscow in spite of Soviet displeasure.

title: Professor Warns of Quake Peril at Montana Dam
description: LIBBY, Mont., April 5  Dr. Richard L. Konizeski, a hydrology professor at the University of Montana, has accused the Army Corps of Engineers of designing and building the $428million Libby Darn in an area subject to earthquakes without the detailed seismic studies recommended by the Seismology Division of the National Oceanographic Survey.

title: Bridge: Lack of an Obligation to Rebid Can Exert a Subtle Influence
description: The fact that a player has opened In third or fourth seat, and therefore has no obligation to rebid, can often have a subtle influence on the later development of the auction.

title: Arnold Bernhard ArtsHumanities Center Opens in Bridgeport
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., April 5  The University of Bridgeport today made a bid to become a cultural focal point between New York and New Haven with the opening of its $5million Arnold Bernhard ArtsHumanities Center.

title: Ruling on Odd Lots Is Won by Investor
description: Judge Harold R. Tyler Jr. of the Federal District Court here ruled yesterday that the New YorkStock Exchange and two member firms must pay 90 per cent of the costs of public notices inviting investors to join a class action that charges the exchange violated antitrust laws in. its 196266 oddlot extra charges.

title: $600,000 for Health Study
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., April 5 (AP)A program in health sciences and technology, a joint effort by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Harvard University, has won a oneyear, $600,000 grant from the Commonwealth Fund of New York. M.I.T. announced the grant yesterday. The program includes education and research involving doctors, biomedical engineers and health scientists.

title: Consumer Attitude Found Improved
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., April 5 (AP)Consumers attitudes about the economy have improved markedly in the last few months and many people believe now is a good time to make major purchases, the University of Michigan Quarterly Survey of Consumer Attitudes reports.

title: MACY'S OPERATES, BUT STRIKE HURTS
description: Sales counters, telephones and elevators at six Macy stores in the city and White Plains were manned by executives and nonunion workers yesterday as 8,000 employes went on strike

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Here is a Chance to test your political I.Q. First, read all the political news printed since January, 1971, when the 1972 Presidential campaign officially began. Then lift your pencil and start to answer the following questions. No more than two days (48 hours) may be spent on any one question. Add the value of each correct answer to find your score. A score higher than 300 points means that you are a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination:

title: RISE IN WELFARE FOR THE ELDERLY GAINS IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, April 5The Senate Finance Committee voted today to increase Federal welfare payments for the elderly, the blind and the disabled.

title: BLACK UNIT FINDS IMPACT IS BROAD
description: NASHVILLE, April 5 When leaders of the National Association of Black Social Workers talk about the impact of their group upon social work schools and agencies and upon clients, they use the word "tremendous.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHICAGO, April 5A group of major political figures backing Senator Edmund S. Muskie's bid for the Democratic Presidential nomination is urging that he limit his active campaigning to three of the 16 remaining primaries.

title: Solar Salute's Next Race
description: SANTA ANITA, Calif., April 5 (UPI)Solar Salute, winner of last Saturday's Santa Anita Derby, will run Saturday in the California Derby at Golden Gate Fields, his trainer, Lou Glauburg, announced today. If the horse performs well, he will go on to the Kentucky Derby, Glauburg said.

title: VIETNAM OFFENSIVE ACCLAIMED BY CHINA
description: HONG KONG, Thursday, April 6China asserted today that any counterattack by the United States against the new Communist offensive in South Vietnam would bring more disastrous failure upon the Americans and the Saigon Government forces.

title: His Fellow Parishioners Pay Respects to Gil Hodges
description: When the news of Gil Hodges's death was being discussed at Our Lady Help of Christians, a parishioner of that Roman Catholic church in Brooklyn recalled Hodges not as a ballplayer and manager but as a man he saw at mass every Sunday.

title: Berrigan Case a Mistrial On Main Plotting Charges
description: HARRISBURG, Pa. April 5The conspiracy case against the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and six other antiwar activists ended in mistrial late today.

title: Soviet Sub Towed Home
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, April 5 (AP)A Soviet atomic submarine that broke down in the North Atlantic has been towed to home waters, the West German Navy reported today. A navy spokesman said the 3,500ton submarine, armed with intercontinental ballistic missiles, reached the White Sea after a fiveweek journey from a point 600 miles northeast of Newfoundland.

title: Hijacker Killed in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, April 5 (UPI)The pilot of an Indonesian airliner today shot and killed a hijacker who threatened to blow up the plane with two hand grenades unless he got $50,000 and two parachutes. The Communications Ministry said the pilot, Capt. Hendiarta Sugondo, shot the hijacker at Jogjkarta airport with a pistol slipped to him by an army officer.

title: Estimate by Quangtri General
description: QUANGTRI, South Vietnam, April 5 (AP)The commander of South Vietnamese forces battling below the demilitarized zone said today that he could defend Quangtri unless the enemy brought in more troops.

title: 3 JAILED IN RHODESIA AS ARMSIMPORTERS
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 5 (Agence FrancePresse) The Salisbury high court today sentenced two young black Rhodesians to 10 years jail at hard labor, and a third, age 31, to 12 years, for bringing, arms and ammunition into the country.

title: WEEK CONDUCTS LISZT PRELUDES
description: Most young conductors wait around until someone, asks them to lead an existing orchestra. Jan Jozef. Wnek is not one of them. The 23yearold New Yorker and graduate of Queens College came to Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night with the Greater New York Symphony Orchestra, of which he is the founder and music director.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: The American public favors by a 4to1 margin a proposal to choose Presidential candidates in a nationwide primary election instead of at political party conventions, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: Bombing Decision Is Near; U.S. Aides Weigh Targets
description: WASHINGTON, April 5High officials said the Nixon Administration was weighing three potential target areas in North Vietnam today as a decision neared on whether to expand the air war there.

title: Council Marks 9th Year Of Aid to Black Business
description: Real economic development is not going to come through ownership of a few Chicken Delights and Dunkin Donuts franchises. Any organization like this has to keep ahead of the growth and development of the clients it serves.

title: STARS DOWN CHAPS FOR 30 SERIES LEAD
85 in Masters Golf Today, With Nicklaus as Choice
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 5Every one of the 85 golfers scheduled to begin play in the Masters tournament tomorrow wants to win, but Lee Trevino says he'd give $100,000 if I could have a threeshot lead coming up the 18th fairway in the last round.

title: Investinators Seek Records In West Virginia Disaster
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) A Senate Labor subcommittee spokesman said today that investigators were in West Virginia attempting to retrieve records from the sludgefilled basement of the Buffalo Mining Company in Lorado.

title: Price Changes
description: Price changesgenerally upwardwere announced yesterday in a variety of metals and fibers. The Reynolds Metals Company said in Richmond that it planned to raise list prices of aluminum extruded shapes and drawn and extruded tubing by a minimum of 1.5 cents a pound over present prices. A spokesman stated that the new prices would become effective May 1.
