The company added that it mould raise actual selling prices for certain types of tubing used in refrigeration and air conditioning by 1.5 cents a pound effective with July 1 shipments. An additional rise of 0,5 cent a pound will go into effect Oct. 1.

title: Lockheed Chief in London For Talks With Airlines
description: LONDON, April 5 (AP)Daniel Haughton, Chairman of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, arrived here today for further talks with the heads of British airlines he hopes to persuade to buy the Lockheed TriStar airliner.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: McGrawHill, Inc., announced. yesterday that its Canadian bookpublishing subsidiary, Mc, GrawHill Ryerson, Ltd., had filed a preliminary prospectus relating to an offering of 600,000 common shares, representing 30 per cent of the outstanding common shares of the Canadian company. Wood Gundy, Ltd., has been named as the manager of the proposed offering. McGrawHill closed yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange at 18, up

title: Girl, 17, Wins $1Million
description: NEW. BRUNSWICK, N. J., April 5 (AP)  A 17yearold high school girl who bought a lottery ticket for the first time won $1million today in the New Jersey lottery.

title: Quaker Commune Is Seeking Nonviolent Social Change
description: PHILADELPHIA  George Fox founded the Society of Friends in the 17th century out of convictions that God lives in every man and that the best way to find Him is through a life of utter simplicity.

title: Rebel Band in Bolivia Suffers Setback
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, April 5Bolivia's military Government has dealt the leftwing subversive movement here some crippling blows and sharply curtailed the Soviet Union's dipplomatic presence.

title: Spanish Police Again Repel A Basque Separatist Attack
description: MADRID, April 5 (UPI)Spanish police have repelled a Basque separatist attackthe second in three dayson a mountaintop radio transmitter near San Sebastian, the newsTaper A.B.C. reported today.

title: JOHN CARTER, LAWYER WAS A RACING AIDE
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 5John B. H. Carter, a senior partner in the law firm of Pepper, Hamilton & Scheetz and chairman of the Pennsylvania State Harness Racing Commission from 1963 to 1969, died yesterday in Lankeriau Hospital. He was 64 years old.

title: Carson Sues for Divorce
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., April 5 (UPI)Johnny Carson, the television star, filed suit yesterday in Superior Court to dissolve his eightyear marriage to his wife, Joanne. The suit cited irreconcilable differences.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Australia's New Ties
description: CANBERRA, Australia, April 5 (UPI)The Foreign Affairs Minister, Nigel Bowen, said today that Australia would establish diplomatic relations at ambassadorial level with Hungary and Bulgaria immeliately.

title: 47 Indictments for Fraud Filed Against Bronx Welfare Clients
description: District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx announced yesterday the filing of 47 indictments charging welfare clients with fraudulently receiving relief grants totaling more than $150,000.

title: Kosygin Is Due in Baghdad To Begin State Visit Today
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 5Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union is to arrive in Baghdad tomorrow on a state visit to Iraq.

title: Dole Urges Resignation Of Johnson From F.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)Senator Robert J. Dole, Republican of Kansas, called today for the resignation of Nicholas Johnson as a member of the Federal Communications Commission.

title: Japanese Revaluation Loss
description: TOKYO, April 5 (Reuters)The Japanese Government and the Bank of. Japan suffered losses totaling 862.5 billion yen ($2.8 billion) as a result of the revaluation of the yen last December, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: KNICKS SEEK TIE; BARNETT IS AILING
Insko Registers 3,000th Triumph
description: YONKERS, April 5  Del Insko, the talented 41yearold South Beloit, Ill., reinsman, became only the fourth driver in harness racing history to record 3,000 career victories when he piloted Paul J. Straub's favored Actor Melody to victory tonight in the fourth contest at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Hanover Buys Albatross; Dancer Remains as Trainer
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 5 (UPI) Hanover Shoe Farm of Hanover, Pa., obtained a 50 per cent controlling interest in the champion pacer, Albatross, as part of a deal in which the horse was sold for $2.5million.

title: Round 4: McGovern...
description: With characteristic modesty and candor, Senator George McGovern refuses to exaggerate the implications of his first victory in the Democratic primaries. Yet the relatively wide margin by which he led the field Wisconsin was impressive. There is plausibility in his interpretation of the results as a vote of protest and hope"protest against conventional politics and hope for a bolder attack on the nation's problems.

title: Littler Is Satisfactory
description: SAN DIEGO, April 5 (UPI)Gene Littler, the pro golfer, was reported in satisfactory condition at Mercy Hospital today after a twohour operation yesterday for removal of lymph nodes under his left arm. He had undergone surgery March 15 for removal of a malignant tumor under the arm.

title: SOLDIER DETAINED ON DRUGS IN ERROR
description: WASHINGTON, April 5  S. Sgt. Donald L. Fryer told a Senate subcommittee today that he was put into a detoxification unit in Vietnam and held behind barbed wire for 10 days after an Army urinalysis machine mistakenly identified him as a drug user.

title: Off on a Gastronomic Voyage of Discovery
description: PARISIt takes only a few hours to fly from Kennedy Airport to Orly, but the soul limps in a day or two later, like a beagle, wideeyed at the realization that the city of light is not at all suffering from the same malaise as New York.

title: ... and Lindsay
description: If the primaries cannot, by themselves, make a Presidential candidate, they can certainly break one. Wisconsin's broke the candidacy of Mayor John V. Lindsay, just as earlier primaries broke those of Mayor Yorty of Los Angeles and Senator Hartke of Indiana  a winnowing process that has something to be said for it in this year's overcrowded field of Democrats.

title: Times Study Finds Voters Liked McGovern on Taxes
description: Senator George McGovern clearly appears to have won the Wisconsin Democratic primary because he far surpassed his rivals in articulating the dominant concerns of liberal and conservative voters alike tax loopholes, high property taxes, inflation, and other economic problems.

title: RYAN SUPPORTERS SCORE MRS. ABZUG
description: A committee of close to 100 people, including influential political and labor leaders, state legislators and other public officials, endorsed Representative William F. Ryan yesterday in his primary fight for the Democratic nomination in the new 20th Congressional District.

title: Head of Federation of Teachers Urges a National School Board
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 The president of the American Federation of Teachers called today for the creation of a national board of education to stop the use of education as a political football.

title: Governor Appears in Private Before McKay Panel on Attica Riot
description: ALBANY, April 5The McKay Commission, charged with producing a full and impartial account of the causes, events and aftermath of last September's riot at Attica prison, interviewed Governor Rockefeller today in private.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Oil Company Stops LeadFree Ads

title: King vs. Powell
description: It was a strange coincidence that brought death to Adam Clayton Powell Jr. on the fourth anniversary of the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. In strikingly different ways both men played their roles in the emergence of blacks from the abuses of a whitedominated society. Both brought enormous personal gifts to the struggle for racial equality, and both attracted devoted followings. Yet one was an inspiring leader whose name adds luster to the American tradition; the other, lost a sea of cynicigm and selfindulgence, leaves no lasting heritage.

title: Educators Hear Johnson
description: AUSTIN, Tex., April 5 (UPI) Former President Lyndon B. Johnson urged black educators today to implement special programs to aid black veterans returning to college.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CHUB CAY, The Bahamas Standing kneedeep in a tidal stream, I first saw the bonefish when they slipped out of the bluegreen water in the channel and came across a litecolored bar 100 yards away.

title: Man, 74, Is Top Miler
description: ASHEVILLE, N. C. (UPI)Virgin Sturgill, 74 years old, holds the world record in the mile run for the 70yearoldandover set with a time of 6 minutes 55 seconds. The former teacher runs three miles every day to stay in shape. He says the running has cured his arthritis.

title: ECONOMIC GROWTH IN EUROPE SLOWS
description: GENEVA, April 5Western Europe's rate of economic growth this year may fall short of the 3.7 per cent aggregate given by national forecasts, the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe said today.

title: General Foods President Taking Early Retirement
description: Arthur E. Larkin Jr., 55 years old, president and chief operating officer of the General Foods Corporation since 1966, has taken early retirement, effective immediately.

title: Who's Got the Power?
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.  The Javits warpowers bill confirms Oliver Wendell Holmes quip that great cases like hard cases make bad law more vividly than any proposal since that of the Bricker Amendment. Responding to Vietnam, the Javits bill would radically change the constitutional relationship between Congress and the Presidency in making foreign policy. Ignoring their own repeated votes, for Vietnam, the sponsors contend that the cause of the Vietnam tragedy is a modem usurpation or the war power by the President. As Senator. Cooper points out, this claim rewrites history.

title: Woolworth Donahue, 59, Heir To Chain Store Fortune, Dies
description: Woolworth Donahue, heir to the rich Woolworth chain store fortune, collapsed and died of a heart attack yesterday at his home at 780 South Ocean Boulevard in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 59 years old and lived in Palm Beach and Southhampton, L. I.

title: Stage: Elizabeth I'Machinations of Royal Power
Alabama Golfers Take Lead In College Play in Scotland
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, April 5 (AP)The University of Alabama took the lead in an intercollegiate golf tournament today after the second round of play over the St. Andrews and Carnoustie courses.

title: Burundi Seizes ExKing After Luring Him Back With a Pledge of Safe Conduct
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, April 5A young former king of the tiny East African nation of Burundi is under arrest there, the victim and star of a plot that resembles an Eric Ambler thriller.

title: Brian Donlevy, Film Tough Guy, Dies
description: HOLLYWOOD, April 5 (AP) Brian Donlevy, who played tough guy roles in motion, pictures during most of his career, died of cancer tonight in the Motion Picture Hospital here. He was 69 years old.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 Although they have yet to say so in public, the Administration's top policymakers view the current North Vietnamese offensive as an allout effort by Hanoi to discredit the Vietnamization program and shatter South Vietnam's political and military morale. The Administration's spokesmen have avoided any definitivepublic characterization of the attacks, but privately officials here indicate that they are struck by the degree to which the North Vietnamese have committed themselves.

title: Canada Expresses Regret At Bombing of Cuban Office
description: OTTAWA, April 5  The Canadian Government today expressed the hope that the regrettable bomb explosion in the Cuban Trade Commission in Montreal yesterday would not prejudice the good relations between Canada and Cuba.

title: Bomb Blast Rips Belfast Office Building
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 5 (AP)  A bomb explosion ripped through a youth employment office in downtown Belfast today, setting the building on fire, but there were no casualties.

title: TIMES DRIVER HURT ESCAPING ROBBER
description: A New York Times delivery truck crashed into a store on the Upper West Side early today after the driver jumped from it to escape from an armed robber.

title: MRS. SOL A. JACOBSON
description: Mrs. Barbara Scott Jacobson, the wife of Sol A. Jacobson, a New York theatrical public relations man, died Tuesday of cancer in the Doylestown (Pa.) Hospital. She was 57 years old and lived at 67 Horatio Street in New York and in New Hope, Pa.

title: Strike Silences Bats And Balls in 8 Cities
description: Eight baseball games had been scheduled for today, but all have been postponed because of the players strike.

title: Companies Fined Heavily By Germany in Cartel Case
description: BONN, April 5West Germany's federal cartel office in West Berlin today announced record fines totaling more than 48 million marks (about $15million) against nine West German and foreign controlled companies found guilty of having operated illegal cartels in domestic and foreign markets for unprocessed synthetic fibers.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Prices of soybeans, soybean oil, soybean meal and grain futures rose yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, still reflecting trading response to Tuesday's announcement of the scheduled trip next week of Earl L. Butz, Secretary of Agriculture, to the Soviet Union to discuss the possible increase of United States imports of those commodities to that country.

title: Police in Newark and Boston Seize 5 as Robbers
description: NEWARK, April 5  Five young men who, the police say, traveled by airplane between Boston and Newark to commit a seris of armed robberies have been arrested in a twocity police operation.

title: 2 Auto Makers Seek Delay In 1975 Clean Air Deadline
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP) The Chrysler Corporation and,the General Motors Corporation filed formal requests today for a oneyear extension of the 1975 deadline for reducing auto emissions.

title: A Robber in Nevada Picks on Wrong Truck
description: RENO, Nev. (UPI)Charles W. Sheppard, 32 years old, was trying to get into a parked truck when Lonnie Jackson, a patrolman, arrived.

title: PETITION BY PENNSY STUDIED BY JUDGE
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 5 (UPI) A Federal judge took under advisement today a Penn Central Railroad petition seeking approval of a 1972 road capital budget covering 188 projects in states with expenditures of $44.6million.

title: Sports of The Times
description: This is the day when the baseball season was to have opened in full force, only to be victimized by a strikeout. Yet even if the players had come to swift agreement with the owners in their dispute over the pension fund and even if there had been no delay in the regular schedule, neither the New York Mets nor the New York Yankees would have taken part in the proceedings.

title: PLAYERS RETURN DEPENDS ON PACT
description: If baseball's club owners are waiting for the Players Association to make the next move in the strike or for the players to return obediently to their teams while negotiations continue, they may as well wait for Godot.

title: Pay Board Lists 74 Increases That Have Been Challenged and Face Review
Hanoi Hopes for Mutiny And Uprisings in South
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, April 5 (Agence FrancePresse)The focus in the Hanoi press today appeared to be the potential for mutiny in the South Vietnamese Army and insurrection in the cities.

title: G.E. PROFIT ROSE BY 13% IN QUARTER
Planners Vote to Ease Zoning Rules For Community Institutions in the City
description: A proposal that would allow large community institutions, such as hospitals and colleges, to circumvent city zoning regulations in cases of minor variations was adopted yesterday by the City Planning Commission.

title: EXCHANGE FILES SUIT ON GOODBODY
description: The New York Stock Exchange began legal action yesterday to recover $2,861,899.25 from Goodbody & Co., a former member organization of the exchange, and 70 of its partners.

title: Betting Time Extended
description: Offtrack bettors will get 35 minutes more on weekdays and 45 minutes more on Saturdays and holidays to make Aqueduct daily double wagers beginning today. The closing time on all days has been extended to noon.

title: Ecology Suit Halts Capital Area Highway
description: WASHINGTON, April 5A Federal appeals court has ordered construction halted on a short stretch of superhighway leading to Washington until the Department of Transportation and the State of Virginia comply with Federal laws designed to protect the environment.

title: Uganda Judge Halts Inquiry On Two Missing Americans
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, April 5 A judicial inquiry into the disappearance of two Americans, feared killed by Ugandan troops last year, was adjourned indefinitely today after the presiding justice said that senior army officers were obstructing the investigation.

title: Philharmonic Elects Two To Its Board of Directors
description: Mrs. Charles A. Dana and Philip R. Kiendl have been elected to the New York Philharmonic board of directors. Mrs. Dana is chairman of the Dana Foundation and a trustee of the American Health Foundation, the National Society for the Prevention of Blindness, Cancer Care, Inc., and Queens College in Charlotte, N. C.

title: Transplant Patient Dies
description: AUSTIN, Tex., April 5 (AP)Paula Holt, whose plight elicited more than $30,000 in donations from American soldiers in Vietnam, died today in San Francisco, one month after receiving a kidney transplant. Miss Holt, 18 years old, was the third child in her family to die as a result of an inherited kidney disease, acute familial nephritis.

title: THOMAS GARVEY JR., HEART SURGEON, 69
description: Dr. Thomas Garvey Jr., a heart surgeon, died yesterday of a heart failure at Doctors Hospital after a long illness. He was 69 years old and lived at 430 East 86th Street.

title: Wilkins Returns From South Africa
description: Roy Wilkins, the executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, said yesterday that he had been encouraged and depressed by his oneweek visit to South Africa.

title: Mrs. Beard Said To Have Admitted Writing the Memo
description: BALTIMORE, April 5 (AP)Dita D. Beard told Representative Bob Wilson that she had written a memo linking the financing of the Republican National Cnovention with the settlemen of an antitrust suit against I.T.T., The Baltimore Sun quotes the California Congressman as saying.

title: Oil Interest Is Sold
description: The Phillips Petroleum Company said yesterday that it had sold part of its interest in concessions in the Western Desert of Egypt to Hispanoil, the Spanish national oil company.

title: Books of The Times
description: CFIRISTO. Text by David Bourdon. 322 pages. 320 illustrations, 84 in color. Abrams. $35.

title: Rebel Leader in Salvador Leaves Refuge to Surrender
description: SAN SALVADOR, April 5 (UPI)The army colonel who personally captured President Fidel Sanchez Hernandez March 25 at the outset of a revolt here that failed announced today that he had surrendered his right to diplomatic asylum and was turning himself over to the Government to face trial.

title: Dr. David Perlman, 62, Dies; Chemistry Professor Here
description: Dr. David Perlman, a professor of chemistry at City College, with which he had been associated since his graduation in 1930, died today in Doctors Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 290 Collins Avenue in Mount Vernbn, N.Y.

title: Britain's Reserves Up by $83Million In March to Record
description: LONDON, April 5Britain's official reserves hit another peak last month, rising by $83million to $7,074,000,000, the Treasury said today.

title: SovietFrench Satellite
description: MOSCOW, April 5 (UPI)The Soviet Union has launched an experimental French satellite and a Soviet communications satellite into earth orbit aboard one rocket, the Soviet press agency, Tass, said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Defense Order for Raythbon
description: The Raytheon Company announced yesterday the receipt of a contract totaling approximately $558million to begin engineering development of the SAMD air defense system. The fiscal 1972 increment awarded the company amounted to.$84million with the balance to, be funded over the next five years.

title: 6 Die as Winds Hit Vancouver, Wash.
description: VANCOUVER, Wash., April 5 (AP)A violent wind ripped a quartermile path of destruction through Vancouver today, killing at least six persons. Two area hospitals reported treating 300 persons for injuries.

title: Chinese Is Appointed to a Top U.N. Post
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 5Tang Mingchao, an Americaneducated Chinese diplomat who once headed a Chinatown daily in New York, was appointed today as Under Secretary General for Political Affairs and Decolonization.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (UPI) Julian Bond endorsed today the Presidential candidacy of Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota. Mr. Bond, a civil rights leader, is a member of the Georgia House of Representatives.

title: Merger News
description: Botany Industries, Inc., the large men's wear producer that is currently closing its Weber & Heilbroner and Broadstreet's stores, and Chelsea Industries, Inc., a diversified textiles and consumer manufacturer, are discussing a merger or other form of affiliation. We are holding conversations relative to a merger, Michael Daroff, chairman and president of Botany, said last night. George A. Tunick, president of Chelsea, could not be reached for comment,

title: Still No Nobel
description: Whatever Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's original intention may have been, he has successfully provoked the Soviet Government into a political blunder. Against the background of Soviet history, it is understandable that the rulers of Russia are not accustomed to being defied by one of their own citizens living within their borders. This is what Solzhenitsyn did last week in holding his fascinating press conference and in describing the pressures the regime. Soviet leaders reacted, as Solzhenitsyn may have calculated they would, by denying the Secretary the Swedish Academy a visa to Moscow where he planned this Sunday to present Solzhenitsyn's Nobel gold medallion and diploma originally awarded him in 1970.

title: Yolande Bavan in Heathen'
description: Yolanda Bavan will star in Heathen, the new Polynesian rock musical with a book by Sir Robert Helpmann and music by Eaton Magoon Jr., which opens on Broadway May 11. Lucia Victor will direct the musical, which is set in primitive and modern Hawaii. Leonard J. Goldberg and Ken Gaston are the producers.

title: Savings Bond Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (UPI)  The Government sold more savings bonds in March than in any month since January, 1946, the Treasury said today.

title: Campaign by Soviet Wins Bengali Friends
description: DACCA, Bangladesh Not only have the Russians come, but they have a twomonth head start on the Americans, who have only now recognized Bangladesh.

title: News Analysis
description: MILWAUKEE, April 5In fact if not yet in form, the contest for the Democratic Presidential nomination seems to have come down to three men: Senators George McGovern, Hubert H. Humphrey and Edmund S. Muskie. And one of the three, Mr. Muskie, cannot long continue unless he can speedily improve his performance in the major primaries. That was the way political professionals today eval uated the results of yesterday's Wisconsin Democratic primary, in which Mr. McGovern won with a strong run in the cities, the suburbs and the country, in rich wards and poor.

title: A Vote Tomorrow on Jersey Bus Pact
description: Striking bus drivers in New Jersey are scheduled to vote on a new set of proposals tomorrow as pressures for a settlement of the fiveweek walkout appeared to be mounting.

title: Nixon Is Cautioned
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (UPI)  A dozen House Democrats warned today against any United States retaliation against North Vietnam.

title: Hanoi Claims Another B52
description: HONG KONG, April 5 (Reuters)  North Vietnam said today that it had shot down a second B52 bomber in an air raid over North Vietnamese territory. A broadcast said the craft was downed at Vinhlinh, just north of the demilitarized zone.

title: Alaska Backs Equal Rights
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, April 5 (AP)  became the 11th state in the nation to ratify the proposed constitutional amendment guaranteeing equal rights to women. The Senate approved the amendment by a 16to2 vote today. It was passed by the House, 38 to 2, earlier in the session.

title: John W. McGrath Is Dead at 69; Led Stevedoring Firm Since 39
description: HARRISON, N. Y. April 5John. W. McGrath, chairman of the John W. McGrath Corporation, a stevedoring concern, died apparently of a heart attack at his home on Bellevue Avenue last evening. He was 69 Years old.

title: U.S. Aides Set to Take Mask Oxen to Peking
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (Reuters)The White House announced today that United States officials would leave for Peking tomorrow with two musk oxen as a gift to China and would return with two giant pandas that China has given the United States.

title: Shoppers at Macy's Have Mixed Feelings on Walkout
description: Daniel Diffily, whitehaired and bespectacled, looked distinctly uncomfortable as he stood on the outskirts of Macy's cosmetics department in Herald Square yesterday, waiting for his wife.

title: RICHEY REACHES FINAL IN TENNIS
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, April 5 (Reuters)Topseeded Cliff Richey of San Antonio, Tex., reached the final in the $50,000 South African open tennis championships today after he recovered to beat fifthseeded Andres Gimeno of Spain, 36, 61, 57, 63, 63,

title: U.S. Move Is Welcomed
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, April 5 (UPI) ;Sheik Mujibur Rahman today welcomed United States recognition of Bangladesh, announced yesterday, and expressed the hope that it would lead to friendly cooperation between the two countries.

title: Man In the News
description: MILWAUKEE, April 5Like his hero George McGovern, Gene Pokorny, who managed the Senator's winning campaign in Wisconsin, takes a dry delight in surprising the people who underestimate him. Mr. Pokorny, a taciturn 25yearold bachelor with the dust of the Great Plains on his shoes and in his soul, is a pale fellow with a reedy voice and a small chin. But there is a sinewy Nebraska farmboy inside that deceptive frame, and a passion for organizing is hidden behind his scholarly glasses. Today some political lessons and perhaps a new kind of campaign folk hero seemed to be. unfolding from his kind of quiet strength.

title: 800 Hungry Nepalese Walk For 40 Miles to Katmandu
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, April 5 (UPI)About 800 hungry men, women and children from droughtaffected areas arrived on foot in the Nepalese capital yesterday in search of food. The authorities pressed mules and porters into service to send food to the stricken area.

title: Conformations
description: BALLINRalli. Congratulation an your confirmation April 9.

title: Edwab, Reiner Advance
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N.Y., April 5 Neil Edwab, Gary Reiner and Jimmy Landes, ranking Eastern players, scored opening victories today at the start of the Concord Hotel's annual junior invitation indoor tennis tournament.

title: 9 Major Coffee Producers Seeking Accord in Geneva
description: GENEVA, April 5Major coffeeproducing countries began discussions here today aimed at reaching an agreement to control exports with a view to getting better prices.

title: A.E.C. UNIT ORDERS INDIAN PT. INQUIRY
description: CROTONONHUDSON, N.Y., April 5An Atomic Energy Commission hearing board ordered a full examination today into charges by a subcontractor that there were serious problems of plant safety at Consolidated Edison's new Indian Point nuclear generating plant.

title: Evening for New Music Is Distinguished by Skill
description: It would he hard to invent a less singing title for a group of young artists than: Center of the Creative and Performing Arts, State University of New York at Buffalo, Music Department. So, to devise a relatively snappy acronym, let us note that COTCAPA/ SUNYAB gave another of its Evenings for New Music at Carnegie Recital Hall Tuesday night. As usual, the musicians played everything with phenomenal ease and skill.

title: BIG UTILITY PLANS 3 NUCLEAR PLANTS
description: The Detroit Edison Company announced yesterday plans for building three nuclear power plants in Michigan at a potential total cost in excess of $1billion. The big utility said that thus far it has committed the projects only to preliminary engineering and licensing.

title: Order Denying Food Stamps To Communes Is Enjoined
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)  A Federal judge issued a temporary restraining order today against enforcement of a regulation designed to prevent persons living in communes from receiving food stamps.

title: Six $50,000 Lottery Winners Hiding in the Wings
description: ALBANY, April 5Have you checked your state lottery tickets lately?

title: 3Day Week Stirs Dispute in Jersey
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J., April 5For just over three weeks, the Thomas J. Lipton manufacturing and packing plant here, which makes instant soup in packets, has had a fourth of its 300 employes working 12 hours a day, three days a week.

title: Blacks Laud Powell for His Leadership
description: Adam Clayton Powell, who died Tuesday night in a Miami hospital, was praised yesterday by many black leaders eager that he be remembered for his effectiveness as a black leader and not just for the controversies that marked his career.

title: Victims of Arteriosclerosis Are Cautioned on Smoking
description: Cigarette smokers who have arteriosclerosis should stop smoking to save their legs from possible amputations, according, to the British Medical Journal.

title: Big Board Allows Firms To Deal in Life Insurance
description: The New York Stock Exchange approved yesterday the sale of life insurance by member brokerage firms, thus opening the way for what many believe may be a major new source of revenue for Wall Street. The longawaited move came after approval by the exchange's board of governors and clearance by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Delmarva Hearing Ordered
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission today ordered hearing to determine whether the Delmarva Power and Light Company Holding Company system of Wilmington, Del., must sell its gas utility business.

title: Robberies in City Declined by 36.1% During February
description: The Police Department announced yesterday that there were 36.1 per cent fewer robberies reported in February than in the same month last year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sanford Planning to Enter New Jersey June Primary
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Terry Sanford, the president of Duke University and former Governor of North Carolina, broadened his campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination today by announcing he would probably enter the New Jersey Presidential primary.

title: IMPROVEMENTS SEEN BY AMEX PRESIDENT
description: Paul Kolton, the president of the American Stock Exchange, said yesterday that the extensive improvements that had been built into the systems of member firms, the exchanges, transfer agents and others were enabling the industry to handle the expanded share turnover of recerit months without operational difficulties.

title: A.M.C. Gets LongTerm Loan
description: DETROIT, April 5 (AP)American Motors has completed arrangements for $38million in longterm financing, allowing the company to eliminate nearly completely its shortterm debt, Roy D. Chapin Jr., the chairman, announced today.

title: It Remains the Masters; Not Bob Jones Masters
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 5The tournament the late Bob Jones founded will continue to be known as the Masters. Clifford Roberts, tourney chairman, said today it would not be renamed the Bob Jones Masters, because Jones would not have wanted the tourney to be named after him.

title: Advertising:
description: V. Edward Dent, former executive vice president of L. W. Frohlich/Intercon, a major agency in the health field, has joined Benton & Bowles. He will be president of the newlyformed subsidiary, Medicus Communications, which will serve the marketing, advertising and communications needs of the healthcare industries.

title: Morton Orders SpeedUp In Alaska Land Transfers
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP) Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton said today that he had ordered a speedup in the processing of the transfer of Federal land to the state of Alaska.

title: MESSIAEN AND WIFE PERFORM AT HUNTER
description: Olivier Messiaen's music has been very much in evidence over the last week in the city's concert halls. As a pendant to the major event (the oratorio La Transfiguration de Notre Seigneur JesusChrist, performed by the National Symphony last Sunday), Mr. Messiaen and his wife, Yvonne Loriod, appeared at Hunter College Tuesday night playing a selection from the composer's extensive keyboard literature.

title: Black Groups Open a Campaign Against Racism in Media Here
description: A coalition calling itself Black Citizens for a Fair Media announced yesterday that it was starting a campaign against the hiring and programming practices of television stations here, which members of the group called the most pervasive and harmful racism in America.

title: Avon to List Ingredients To Curb Cosmetic Injuries
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP) Avon, the nation's biggest cosmetics producer, is breaking the industry's tradition of secrecy by providing users with listings of ingredients in its products.

title: Bus Strike Talks Put Off
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (UPI)  A Federal mediator said today that contract talks between Continental Trailways and 310 striking bus drivers, mechanics and ticket agents on the New YorktoWashington run had been postponed until Monday. Nicholas Fidandis of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service said the negotiations, which had been scheduled to shift to Washington from New York, were postponed until Monday after the company said its representatives would not be available.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The love beads and the multicolor leather patches have vanished as fashion tries to secure a more solid footing for fall.

title: Denial by Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, April 5The Defense Department categorically denied today that the North Vietnamese had shot down a B52 bomber.

title: Ford Foundation Bestows $6.84Million on Public TV
description: The Ford Foundation yesterday announced grants totaling $6,840,000 for continued support of national public television programing for one year beginning July 1. The funds will supplement an expected $12.8million in support from the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, the major funding agency for public television.

title: Market Swings Upward; Dow Pierces 950 Barrier
Siberia Science Center: In Theory, No Problems
description: NOVOSIBIRSK, U.S.S.R.As a special question, a teacher asked his students to propose substitutes for the internalcombustion engine to cut down on air pollution. In five minutes, one 14yearold came up with three promising ideas, two of them so practical that, in fact, adult scientists in Soviet research institutes were already at work on them.

title: J. T. CHATTERTON
description: James T. Chatterton, vice president for West Coast operations of I.T.T. World Communications until his retirement in December, died in Sah Francisco Tuesday night. He was 65 years old and lived in Lafayette, Calif.

title: CATHOLIC SCHOOLS CONTINUE DECLINE
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 5Rising tuition costs and the middleclass flight to the suburbs have pulled parochial school enrollment down by another 6 per cent this year, according to the National Catholic Educational Association.

title: GIANT SOUND WAVES FROM SUN REPORTED
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., April 5 (UPI)A California Institute of Technology graduate student has discovered giant highspeed waves, thought to be vast outbursts of sound, in expanding rings from sunspots, a scientist from the institute reported today.

title: AUTO RACE COURSE SUED BY LEFKOWITZ
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., April 1 State Attorney General Louis Lefkowitz has brought suit against Bridgehampton Race Circuit, the road racing course in Eastern Long Island, to compel race cars to run with mufflers or other noiseabatement devices.

title: Vietnam Options
description: The spreading Communist offensive in South Vietnam finally brings to a head the inherent contradictions the Indochina policy followed by the Nixon Administration for the last three years.

title: Baseball Owners Are Believed Ready to Compromise
description: John Gaherin, representing major league baseball's club owners, has a date today with Marvin Miller, representing the players, and the gist of what he will say is:

title: United Aircraft Sets Ties
description: The United Aircraft Corporation and the ASEA Group of Sweden announced yesterday the signing of agreements covering joint development of industrial gas turbines and providing licenses to United Aircraft for the manufacture and sale of electric generators here and in Canada. This made formal previously announced negotiations between the two companies.

title: Market Place: Traders Ignore Some of Advice
description: What happens when a prestigious investment advisory service says the shards of a popular stock may be running out of gas?

title: M.I.T. Honors ProfessorInventor
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., April 5Prof. Jay W. Forrester has been appointed Germehausen Professor at Massachusetts Institute of Technology for three years beginning next fall.

title: MARCH 2131 SALES OF NEW CARS ROSE
description: Newcar sales picked up in the final 10 days of March, allowing the industry to report a higher volume of autos sold by dealers for the month as well as the latest selling period.

title: George E. Duckworth, Classicist Who Taught at Princeton, Dies
description: PRINCETON, N.J., April 5 George E. Duckworth, Giger Professor of Classics emeritus at Princeton University, died today in Merwick. He was 69 years old and lived at 25 Haslet Avenue here.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MADISON, Wis., April 5Gov. Patrick J. Lucey today called the State Legislature into a special session starting April 19 in an attempt to break a deadlock over legislative reapportionment.

title: Wild Horse Ranch to Open
description: NEWCASTLE, Utah, April 5 (UPI)A 44,000acre ranch devoted to the preservation of one of the West's last herds of wild horses opens April 15 in southern Nevada's Clover Valley, C. Tom Holland, president of the National Mustang Association, announced today.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Humble Oil & Refining Company has nominated three officers as directors and as vice presidents of the company. They are: R. H. Herman Jr., executive vice president and a director of Esso International, Inc., a Humble affiliate; J. L Loftis Jr., general manager of Humble's minerals department, and L. G. Rawl, vice president of marketing.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Commission on Human Rights  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: SQUATTERS SCORE PUERTO RICAN LAW
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., April 5The Puerto Rican Independence party is challenging a recent law that makes it a felony to incite people to invade public and private lands.

title: Eastland Is Challenged
description: JACKSON, Miss., April 5 (UPI)Taylor Webb of Leland, a lawyer who called for an end to boss politics, announced today his candidacy for the Senate seat held by James O. Eastland, a Democrat.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Representative John M. Ashbrook of Ohio has filed suit to have his name placed on the Republican primary ballot in Indiana May 2.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: EGYPT BREAKS OFF TIES WITH JORDAN OVER HUSSEIN PLAN
description: CAIRO, April 6Egypt broke diplomatic relations with Jordan today, charging that King Hussein's proposal for a federation of Jordanians and Palestinians would open a gate for Israel into the Arab world.

title: Hanoi Assails U.S. Renewal Of Bombing
description: HONG KONG, Friday, April 7Hanoi today denounced the United States decision, to resume bombing North Vietnam and ordered North Vietnamese armed forces to deal thunder blows at the enemy by shooting down many aircraft, capturing many pilots and sinking many U. S. warships.

title: Port Notes
description: An alliance of the New York Civil Liberties Union and the International Longshoremen's Association, cemented by the cooperation of neighborhood groups in the Chelsea area, is the primary reason why the Metropolitan Transportation Authority is being denied access to the cityowned Pier 57 for use as a bus garage. The M.T.A. has been casting covetous eyes on the pier, which is at the foot of 15th Street on the North River, for almost two years now.

title: Solzhenitsyn Still Hopes to Receive His Nobel Prize in Ceremony
description: MOSCOW, April 6  The SoViet Union's refusal to grant a visa to a representative of the Swedish Academy has reportedly not killed Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's hope for a ceremony here to receive his 1970 Nobel Prize for Literature.

title: TANK PROGRAM BACK AT STARTING POINT
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (UPI) After spending 10 years and $100million on a nowscrapped program to build a new tank, the Army astounded some Congressmen by declaring that it would take another 10 years and unknown millions to develop a substitute.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: WASHINGTON Richard Nixon is not the only American statesman awaited next month by Leonid Brezhnev, the Soviet boss, for, after eight years absence, Fidel Castro, still sputtering visions of Latin revolution, also intends to visit Moscow in May.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Relations with the United States as the host country11 A.M.

title: Yugoslavia Asks for $35,000 To Insure Fischer's Appearance
description: The international Chess Federation has asked the United States Chess Federation to post a $35,000 guarantee that Bobby Fischer will appear in Belgrade to compete with Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union for the world championship.

title: C.B.S.TV's Vote Projection System is Analyzed
description: In Tuesday's primary in Wisconsin, the polls closed at 9 P.M. New York time. Over at the news studios of the Columbia Broadcasting System, telephones started ringing and a computer started whirring. At 9:43, interrupting Cannon, Walter Cronkite appeared on the screen briefly to announce estimated results of the vote: McGovern 33 per cent, Humphrey and Wallace, about 20 per cent each, Muskie 9 per cent, Lindsay and Jackson about 8 per cent each.

title: Counterfeit Paperback Covers Plaguing Publishers
description: The American book industry has become the victim of an adroit counterfeit racket  the forgery of paperback book covers.

title: F.P.C. Will Permit Rises In Prices of Natural Gas
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The Federal Power Commission disclosed today that it planned to let naturalgas producers raise their prices on new supplies, and Perhaps on some existing contracts as well, in hopes that the prospect of bigger profits would lead to more exploration and discoveries.

title: Executive Changes
description: James L. Shanahan has been appointed vice president of the New York City ConventionExhibition Center Corporation, which plans to erect the nation's largest convention center on the West Side of Manhattan. He has been associated with the hotel, travel and communications industries for 25 years.

title: Todd Gets 2 Texas Papers
description: AUSTIN, Tex., April 6 (UPI) Todd Publications, Inc., has completed acquisition of two Texas newspapers, The Cuero Record, a daily, and The Smithville Times, a weekly. The acquisition was announced Tuesday by William F. Todd, president and sole stockholder of Todd Publications. Mr. Todd is the former president and publisher of The Rockford, III. Star and The RegisterRepublic, now owned by the Gannett group.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Sizable numbers of Wisconsin Republicans appear unhappy with the Nixon Administration, particularly over its performance in the economic sphere, according to detailed analysis of The New York Times/Yankelovich crosssection survey conducted after the state's primary on Tuesday.

title: Free Press at the U.N.
description: Secretary General Waldheim undoubtedly wishes that the questions raised by the arbitrary expulsion of Chinese Nationalist correspondents from the United Nations last December would fade away. In the interests of the U.N. itself and the principles of freedom of information it has embraced, however, this cannot be allowed to happen.

title: Hodges Funeral Marked By Quiet, Simple Rites
description: Gil Hodges was buried yesterday. The baseball idol was laid to rest after a simple Roman Catholic service in keeping with his modesty and with his devotion to his parish church in Brooklyn, Our Lady Help of Christians.

title: Public TV Planning A Program to Fight Venereal Disease
description: A onehour dramatic program to combat venereal disease, with material by such writers as Jules Feiffer, Arnold Schulman, Eleanor Perry, Walter Jones and Israel Horovitz, will be televised nationally on public television, including Channel 13 beret next October.

title: WelfareDoubleStandard
description: The parsimonious, punitive spirit that is the hallmark of the Senate Finance Committee's approach to the needs of mothers and children on public welfare always turns to openhandedness when the committee addresses itself to grants for the elderly.

title: DUPONT FIRM GETS NEW NET CAPITAL
description: DuPont Glore Forgan, Inc., one of the nation's largest brokerage and investment banking concerns, announced yesterday that it had sucessfully completed a recapitalization program, with the receipt of an additional $24million in net capital.

title: NIXON VOWS TO AID CATHOLIC SCHOOLS, BUT ASKS CAUTION
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 6 President Nixon strengthened his commitment today to extending Federal help to Roman Catholic schools but cautioned that executing that policy would take time.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The politicians and the reporters were interviewing each other here today like handicappers in search of a track, not to men tion a winning horse. They were not only bewildered by what had already happened in the Democratic Presidential derby but also despairingly confused about where to look for clarification. Lawrence F. O'Brien, the hardpressed chairman of the party, said that the only fair conclusion so far was that no leader was yet in sight. Indeed, he said that he had heard more tickets rhetorically nominated in the last 24 hours than there were party members, with candidates, noncandidates and even virtual unknowns being freely tossed, up for discussion. He was confident only that the Democrats faced a truly open convention at Miami Beach in July.

title: Yevtushenko Is Planning Big Novel
description: Yevgeny Yevtushenko, the peripatetic Soviet writer and declaimer of poetry, said yesterday that he was going to give up his travels and his poems to spend the next five years in Moscow writing plays, short stories and a big confessional novel.

title: INVESTMENT ADVISER SUSPENDED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, April (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended Martin D. Weiss, a Brooklyn investment adviser, from association with any brokerdealer, investment adviser or investment company for four months beginning Monday.

title: STATE CONFISCATES BANNED PESTICIDES
description: MINEOLA, L.I., April 6Henry L. Diamond, Commissioner of the State Department of Environmental Conservation, led a posse of armed conservation officers on a raid of gardensupply stores today to seize banned pesticides.

title: IRVING GITLIN
description: Irving Gitlin, a violinist, who had played with Lester Lanin's orchestra, died Monday at his home in Rego Park, Queens. His age was 69.

title: Mrs. Knauer Says Grocers Help Little on Unit Pricing
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) President. Nixon's consumer adviser said today that the nation's grocery stores were apparently doing a shoddy job on unit pricing.

title: Washington Supreme Court Voids Injunction on Busing
description: OLYMPIA, Wash., April 6 (AP)The Washington Supreme Court overturned today an injunction that had blocked mandatory busing to achieve racial balance in Seattle public schools.

title: Candidacy of Lindsay Goes On in 7 States
description: Even though Mayor Lindsay has quit the race for the Democratic Presidential nomination, his candidacy will linger in seven states where his name is on the ballot or delegates are running pledged to his candidacy. The states are Massachusetts, Nebraska, Rhode Island, Maryland, Virginia, Oregon and California.

title: U.S.China Table Tennis On L.I. Is Set for April 20
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., April 6  Calling the tabletennis matches a coup for the new Nassau Coliseum, Ralph G. Caso, the Nassau County Executive, announced today that tickets for the United StatesChina exhibition at the arena would be priced at $3, $2 and $1.

title: Mrs. Binh Describes Drive
description: PARIS, April 6Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, the chief Vietcong delegate to the peace talks here, said today that Popular Liberation forces were fighting to free all of South Vietnam and establish a government of national concord in Saigon.

title: Yorty Says McGovern Is Used by Radicals
description: LOS ANGELES, April 6 (UPI)Mayor Sam Yorty, insisting he is still in the race for the Democratic Presidential nomination, said yesterday that Senator George McGovern's victory in the Wisconsin primary aided a movement to radicalize the party and the nation.

title: Market Place:Making a Profit In Block Trades
description: Let's say Wall Street has soured on X.Y.Z., a major packager of food products. First one negative report, then another, come out until half a dozen or so are making the rounds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: RUSSELL F. RILEY
description: BOSTON,. April 6Russell F. Riley, president of the wool company of his name here, died today at his home in Wellesley Hills. His age was 74.

title: Defendant Shot Dead in Queens; Mackell Sees Gangland Motive,
description: A young man with a long record of arrests for postoffice and bank robberies was found shot to death yesterday morning near his home in the Queens Village section of Queens.

title: THE 1972 CHAMPAIGN
description: KIEL, Wis., April 6Kiel did its thing again on Tuesdayor almost.

title: Nixon to Visit Iran May 30 After Talks in Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) President Nixon will visit the Shah of Iran in Teheran May 30.31 after his eightday stay in the Soviet Union.

title: FuelOil Plant Planned
description: The New England Petroleum Corporation plans to build a $70million plant at Oswego, N.Y., to Make industrial fuel oil and synthetic pipelinequality gas to be sold to the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation. The utility said it would build its sixth 850,000kilowatt generating plant at its Oswego complex for more than $175million. All six power units will use fuel oil from the New England Petroleum plant.

title: Mayor Broadens Tribute To Powell After Protest
description: Mayor Lindsay ordered some flags on city buildings in Manhattan lowered yesterday to half staff in tribute to the memory of Adam Clayton

title: THE I972 CAMPAIGN
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 6The focus in the protracted Presidential primary season shifted today to Pennsylvania.

title: March Volume Rises
description: Retail business boomed last month in thousands of stores operated by a large segment of the country's leading retail merchandisers, who reported yesterday substantial gains in March sales over the yearearlier levels.

title: Harry Chapin Shows His Style In Program at the Bitter End
description: Singersong writer fix Harry Chapin came into the Bitter End Wednesday night preceded by a rising hit song called Taxi and a virtual cloud of public anonymity. After hearing his first set, with its range of moods and songs that reached far beyond the limits of Taxi, I don't expect Chapin to remain anonymous for very long.

title: Retail Sales Rose in Week
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The Commerce Department today estimated last week's department store sales at $848million, up 19 per cent from the yearearlier $712million. Last week's total retail store sales were about $8,760,000,000, up 13 per cent from $7,735,000,000.

title: DR. COSMO PASSALACQUA
description: Dr Cosmo Passalacqua,a retired ophthalmologist, who had been on the staffs of the Brooklyn Eye and Ear Hospital and St. Mary's Hospital in Brooklyn, died Tuesday in Hollandale, Fla. His age was 66.

title: Justice in Harrisburg
description: The hung jury that refused to convict the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and six other antiwar activists of conspiring to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger and to bomb tunnels under the capital has helped strengthen faith in the common sense of Americans and in the reputation American justice.

title: Principals Here Rush to Retire In Massive Schools Turnover
description: New York City principals, especially at the high school level, are retiring in unusually large numbers, fulfilling predictions that an attractive pension plan and changing conditions in the schools would cause a massive turnover in the top posts.

title: In Mexico...
description: ANGOSTURA, MexicoAn archeologist looked ruefully at a thousandyearold pyramid covered with earth and grass.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SAVAGE GOD. A Study of Suicide. By A. Alvarez. 299 pages. Random House. $7.95.

title: Black Study Project, Open to All Races, Is Approved at Penn
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 6The University of Pennsylvania rejected today a facultyendorsed proposal for a blackonly living and counseling project on the campus by ruling that all students must be admitted to the project.

title: THE I972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The first reforms in nearly half a century in the Federal law to curb corruption in election financing go into effect tomorrow, and a top Government official, charged with enforcing them pledged today that they would be strongly enforced.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Report on C5A Airplane Finds Continued Failures
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The Air Force's costly C5A cargo airplane came under renewed criticism today with the disclosure of a Government study detailing a series of continued technical failures and additional costs.

title: Books of The Times
description: FREE SCHOOLS. By Jonathan Kozol 146 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $4.95.

title: Mutilations to Bow May 14
description: Mutilations, by Walter Hadler, will open May 14 at Theater Genesis in St. Mark's ChurchintheBowery, Second Avenue and 10th Street. The play, directed by Gaby Rodgers, features Richard Bright, Georgia Lee, Joe Hardy and Ann Hennessey. It will run Thursdays through Sundays until May 28 at 8:30 P.M,

title: 10 FOR ACQUITTAL ON BERRIGAN JURY
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 6The deadlocked jury in the trial the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan was split 10 to 2 for acquittal on the main charge of conspiracy when Federal District Judge R. Dixon Herman dismissed it yesterday, some of the jurors said today.

title: Steinberg, Leading Bostonians, Offers a Romeo With Reserve
description: Few important composers offer a performer more tempting opportunities to wallow in vulgarity than does Berlioz. There is, even his warmest partisans might admit, a streak of show business in him that must be treated warily.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It was opening day of the baseball season, gray at 11 A.M. and as chilly as usual on opening day, though the skies would brighten and temperatures climb later in the day. The New York Mets had expected to be in Pittsburgh playing the world champions with Toni Seaver, naturally, starting against the Pirates. Instead, Seaver and most the others were in the simple brick church of Our Lady Help of Christians, each in his own way mourning the quiet giant, as the Rev. Charles E. Curley described Gil Hodges, the manager and friend they lost last Sunday.

title: Tornado in West a Rarity
description: VANCOUVER, Wash., April 6 (UPI)Weather Bureau officials said today that the storm that cut through Vancouver 24 hours earlier was a rare tornado for the region. Six persons were killed and more than 300 injured.

title: Demonstrations Planned Against New Bombings
description: WASHINGTON, April 6Antiwar leaders announced plans today for new demonstrations and said that the increased American bombing in North Vietnam could lead to a massive outpouring in the streets.

title: Ombudsman Busy in Israel
description: JERUSALEM (AP)  Israel's official ombudsman, Gershon Avner, told newsmen his public complaints office receives an average of 750 complaints a month. He said 70 per cent were justified.

title: Dining: Something For Every Taste
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and ddcor (four triangles to none).

title: Senate Panel Is Reassured On Action Agency Changes
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) A Senate Labor subcommittee was told today that a shakeup in the staff of Action, President Nixon's superagency for volunteer service programs, would not result in any diminution of strength in the regional offices.

title: Hanoi Drills for Attack
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, April 6 (Agence FrancePresse) Alarm bells rang for an air raid practice here today, sending factory workers to stations on the roofs where they took up positions behind heavy machine guns.

title: Two Wounded ht Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 6  Gunmen wounded a policeman in the Roman Catholic Ballymurphy district of Belfast today and a British soldier was wounded in Londonderry. The soldier was wounded when snipers opened fire on an eightman patrol near the Catholic Bogside district, the army said.

title: Border Clashes Reported
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, April 6  More than 70 border incidents have occurred in northern Kashmir since the IndianPakistani war ended, official sources in Indiancontrolled Kashmir said today. No casualties were reported in these incidents which involved exchanges of gunfire between Indian and Pakistani troops.

title: STOCKS RISE AGAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
Advertising:
description: New Yorkers will be told how nice they really are in the hope that they'll be even nicer.

title: BID FOR NEW TALKS BY HANOI RELAYED
description: WASHINGTON, April 6Le Duc Tho, a member of the North Vietnamese Politburo, has sent word to President Nixon through a delegation of American labor leaders that he would like to resume his secret peace negotiations with Henry A. Kissinger, Congressional sources said today.

title: Foe, in Paris, Lists Claims
description: PARIS, April 6North Vietnam issued a statement here claiming 10 American planes downed in its territory today. The delegation joined the Vietcong delegation in denouncing the American air attacks on the North as a new military venture of extreme gravity.

title: F.C.C. BACKS DATRAN FOR DATA NETWORK
description: The Data Transmission Company announced yesterday at Vienna, Va., that it had received initial construction permits from the Federal Communications Commission for its proposed national data communications network.

title: 4 Pickets Are Arrested In Clash at The Telegraph
description: Four persons were arrested and one injured last night as mounted policemen clashed with picketing members of Typographical Union No. 6 who were preventing other workers from entering the midtown offices of The Morning Telegraph, the police reported.

title: Needed Now: Jobs Now
description: MINNEAPOLISGiven the continued intolerably high unemployment and slack in the economy under Mr. Nixon's policies, the need for the Jobs Now programCongressman Reuss's proposal for 500,000 public service jobsbecomes more urgent with each passing day. That need has at least five facets.

title: Aurelio Says He Doesn't Plan to Return to a City Job
description: Former Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelib, who managed Mayor Lindsay's unsuccessful Presidential campaign, said yesterday that he had no plans to return to city government and absolutely no idea which, if any, of the remaining Democratic candidates he would work for.

title: Iraqis Welcome Kosygin
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 6Premier Kosygin arrived in Baghdad today on a fiveday state visit amid speculation that Iraq and the Soviet Union would conclude a treaty of friendship and cooperation.

title: Moorer Says U.S. Will Extend Raids
description: WASHINGTON, April 6Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said today that air strikes in North Vietnam would reach farther north than 40 to 50 miles from the border, the area in which the first strikes took place today.

title: Mayor Meets Key Democratic Leaders In an Effort to Mend Political Fences
description: Mayor Lindsay, who has devoted most of his energy and time to the national Democratic scene since his conversion to the party last August, began yesterday to establish closer ties with state Democrats.

title: BLACKS ASK MEDIA FOR LARGER ROLE
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., April 6 The mass communications forum at the Black Conference on National Priorities offered a list of strong recommendations today to counteract what it called the rampant, sustained and vicious racism of the media.

title: Escape Reading in Rome: a Romance Breaks Out in Model Jail
description: ROME, April 6After weeks filled with sinister talk of plots and bombings, Italy suddenly has something to chuckle aboutromance between a woman correction officer in Rome's model prison and a convicted murderer named Vulcano.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator Hugh Scott is busily warming up for his trip to mainland China. He's brushing up on the decidedly selective smattering of Chinese phrases he picked up as a Marine in China several decades ago, using tape recordings. The Senator has been able to say things like thanks and you're welcome for years, but now his staff reports, he's tackling numbers, and he recently learned to count past 10.

title: Heinrich Lubke, 2d President Of West Germany, Dies at 77
description: BONN, April 6 Heinrich Lubke, second President of the Federal Republic, died here this afternoon at the age of 77.

title: The Mayor's Desk
description: Although Mayor Lindsay may never have been more than a telephone call away from his responsibilities the City of New York, he returned from the Democratic Presidential primary trail this week for good to a desk so cluttered with reports and papers in every program area that he could hardly find his own telephone.

title: COTTON FUTURES HIGHER AT CLOSE
description: Prices of May No. 2 cotton futures rose to 41.75 cents pou'nda 21year highon the New York Cotton Exchange yesterday, but under profit taking closed at 41.50 cents pound, up nearly 410 cent pound over Wednesday.

title: Checking Food Costs
description: If Phase Two fails to achieve its goal of slowing the rise of living costs to about 2 1/2 per cent by the end of this year, it will primarily be a result of the upsurge of uncontrolled food prices.

title: Ulster Inquiry Traces Onset of Crisis to Hooligans
description: LONDON, April 6A mammoth British inquiry concluded today that Protestant and Roman Catholic street gangs caused the violence three years ago that plunged Northern Ireland into its current crisis.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Salant Corporation announced, yesterday plans to file with the Securities and Exchange Commission a secondary offering of. about 300,000 shares of its stock currently held by Robert S. Salant, chairman; his sister, Mns. E. S. Rodgers, and various Want family trusts. According to the announcement, these stockholders, after the proposed sale through underwriters, will hold 27.4 per cent of the shares presently, outstanding. The company's stock closed yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange at 22, up 1.

title: Foster Is 7to5 Favorite To Beat Rondon for Title
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., April 6 For a flat $50,000 each from the television promoter, but no share of the live gate, Bob Foster and Vicente Rondon will settle their cldims to the world lightheavyweight title tomorrow night at the Miami Beach Convention Hall.

title: The Great Myth
description: It is fashionable these days to point to the decline of the public school, as if there were a time in some golden past when the schools really made equal opportunity available to children of every economic and social class. The truth is that our public schools have always failed the lower classesboth white and black. Current educational problems stem not from the fact that the schools have changed, but from the fact that they continue to do precisely the job they have always done.

title: Lockheed Official to Resign
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, Burbank, Calif., announced yesterday that Thomas F. Morrow, executive vice president, plans to resign for personal reasons on July 1. It added that Mr. Morrow does not plan to stand for reelection as director. There are no plans at present to assign anyone to take Mr. Morrow's place.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BRIDGE TENDERS THREATEN STRIKE
description: Bridge operators who tend 26 vehicular bridges in the city voted, 84 to 7, last night to authorize a strike because of what their leaders described as a breakdown in negotiations for a new contract with the city.

title: Canadians, Citing Memo, Cancel Business Meeting
description: OTTAWA, April 6A threeday meeting at which 50 highranking international businessmen were to be briefed by Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and Cabinet memberg was abruptly canceled here today.

title: U.S. OFFICIAL CITES TRADE OBSTACLES
description: A top Treasury official asserted yesterday that the United States has a long way to go in achieving a fair break for American industry ininternational trade.

title: Tunney Says 3 I.T.T Aides May Be Guilty of Perjury
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 Senator John V. Tunney of California said today that a newspaper interview by Representative Bob Wilson indicated that three officials of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation day have committed perjury before the Senate Judiciary Committee.

title: MISS GOOLAGONG GAINS NET FINAL
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, April 6 (UPI)Evonne Goolagong of Australia and Virginia. Wade of Britain advanced to the final of the $50,000 South Africa open tennis championships today with Miss Wade getting an assist from a bee.

title: New Student Loans Suspended by State In Budget Squeeze
description: ALBANY, April 6The state has ordered a suspension of the approval of new applications for studentloan guarantees.

title: Iraq Group Vows to Protect Oil Rights
description: The Iraq Petroleum Company, Ltd., a consortium of Western Oil companies, said yesterday it would take whatever legal steps necessary to protect its rights with regard to oil being produced and about to be shipped for the first time from the disputed North Rumaila field.

title: SCHOOL AID UPSET IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 6A Pennsylvania law compensating parents for tuition paid for pupils in nonpublic schools was declared unconstitutional here today by a threejudge Federal court.

title: Fire Kills 4 French Children
description: ARRAS, France, April 6 (Reuters)Four sisters from 6 to 11 years old were killed in a fire that swept through their home near this town in northern France last night, the police said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Taking Gifts of Moderate Cost Approved by City Ethics Board
description: City officials were cleared yesterday to accept occasional food or drink of moderate cost or free tickets to civic gathering from people doing business with the city.

title: Film: The Policeman, a Likable Lark
Curb on T.V.A. Sought
description: HAZARD, Ky., April 6 Senator Fred R. Harris said today that he would submit a bill forbidding the Tennessee Valley Authority to purchase coal from surface mines.

title: REFORMERS SPLIT IN ABZUG RACE
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug was endorsed by a Reform Democratic club last night for the party nomination in the 20th Congressional District, while her opponent Representative William F. Ryan, was being endorsed by another Reform club.

title: Cordero Wins With Handsome Kid, 3 Others
description: Angel Cordero transformed a routine racing program into a profitable day for himself and lam followers among the 21,511 fans at Aqueduct yesterday. The ebulient Jockey, from Puerto Rico registered four triumphs in a halfdozen attempts on the ninerace card.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: IF YOURE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH. DRINK DEWAR'S. William Lawson's 56.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord Ltd., Syosset. N. Y.Advt.

title: Conference on Aging Urges An Institute of Gerontology
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) The White House Conference on Aging has recommended establishment of a national institute of gerontology.

title: ISABEL JEWELL, 62, 30'S FILM ACTRESS
description: HOLLYWOOD, April 6 (UPI)  Isabel Jewell, a movie actress in the nineteenthirties, was found dead in her home yesterday. She was 62 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: AIR FORCE BACKED ON SEX BIAS CASE
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., April 6On a 2to 1 vote, a Federal court has held constitutional Air Force regulations that permit a male serviceman to presume the dependency of his wife for fringe  benefit purposes while a servicewoman must prove actual dependency of her husband to receive the same benefits.

title: 7 Newsmen Wounded In Vietnam Shelling
description: DONGHA, South Vietnam, April 6 (AP)Seven civilian newsmen were among more than a dozen persons wounded when mortar shells hit a tank battalion command post here today.

title: 7 Dynamite Sticks Bring Bomb Squad To Magazine Office
description: A package containing seven sticks of dynamite was removed yesterday from the offices of the National Lampoon, a satirical magazine, at 635 Madison Avenue by the Police Department's bomb section.

title: Paul F. Siiton, 74, ExLobbyist, Reuther Aide and Writer, Dead
description: Paul F. Sifton, who combined wilting skill and political acumen to argue for progressive economic and civil rights policies for more than 30 years until his retirement in 1962 as lobbyist for the United. Auto Workers, died Tuesday in Oxaco, Mexico, after a long illness. He was 74 years old.

title: Merger News
description: The Pennsylvania Life Company announced yesterday that its wholly owned insurancebrokerage subsidiary, Penn General Agencies, Inc., has reached a preliminary agreement to be acquired by Coleman, Kerstein & Love, Inc., a publicly owned insurance broker. Under the terms of the merger, Coleman would issue 13,644,000 shares to Pennsylvania Life Company for Penn General Agencies. Based on the price of Coleman, Kerstein & Love which is traded in the overthecounter market the transaction is valued at about $40million.

title: GOVERNMENT SEEKS WIDER PATENT USE
description: President Nixon has asked the Commerce Department to find ways to make Governmentheld patents more useful to industry, Commerce Secretary Peter G. Peterson told businessmen here last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two Harlem tenement residents died, and one was injured in a fire yesterday, the Fire Department said, possibly because the nearest fire engines had responded minutes earlier to a false alarm many blocks away.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The Communists in Vietnam are now trying to win the war in one decisive stroke, as they defeated the French in the battle of Dienbienphu in 1954. It is a bold but puzzling strategy.

title: 2 COUNCILMEN ASK RISE IN STOCK TAX
description: Increased stocktransfer taxes were urged yesterday by two City Council leaders as the latest maneuver in the threesided political squabble over the city's projected budget gap.

title: Mrs. King Triumphs
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., April 6 (UPI)Topseeded Mrs Billie Jean King easily advanced in the second round of the Jacksonville tennis tournament today, defeating Pam Teagarden of Los Angeles, 62, 64.

title: FRENCH BANK RATE CUT TO 5 FROM 6%
description: PARIS, April 6 (Reuters)Trance today cut the bank rate to 53A per cent from 6 per cent, effective immediately, the Bank of France announced. The rate, last reduced on Jan. 13, was the highest in Europe.

title: U.S. Airlines Seek Stewards to Work Aloft
description: Tired businessmen flying home after a long day have come to expect a sweet, feminine smile from a stewardess at 35,000 feet as sort of a constitutional right, as much their due as a sate landing. But soon they will look up from their newspapers to hear increasingly a masculine voice saying: Would you like a cocktail before dinner, sir?

title: E. MARRELL STURGES
description: EAST ORANGE, N. S., April 6E. Marrell Sturges, a former general manager of The Newark StarLedger, died at East Orange General Hospital yesterday. He was 74 years old.

title: Ford Drops Autolite Name From PartsDivision Title
description: LIVONIA, Mich., April 6 (AP)The Ford Motor Company announced today that its AutoliteFord Parts division has dropped the word Autolite from its title.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: STAFF BUYING STOCK OF LIMA PUBLISHER
description: LIMA, Peru, April 6 (AP)Pedro G. Beltran, the publisher, has sold his 50,504 shares stock in the Lima newspaper La Prensa to an industrial community made up of its 508 employes, the paper announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New Cincinnati Aide
description: CINCINNATI, April 6E. Robert Turner was appointed today by City Council as city manager, effective June 1. For the last four years he has been executive director of the Southeast Michigan Council of Governments, a sixcounty regional planning authority representing 350 governmental units. He succeed Richard Krabach, who resigned Jan. 15.

title: South Africa Sentences 13
description: PIETERMARITZBURG, South Africa, April 6 (Reuters)Thirteen South Africans, none of them white, received prison sentences today of five to eight years for offenses under the measure that is called the Terrorism Act.

title: J. P. Morgan Says Operating Net Fell For First Quarter
XRAY DOSE STUDY SHOWS DECREASE
description: WASHINGTON, April 6Results of a national survey released today show a drop of more than onethird over a sixyear period in the genetically significant radiation dose Americans receive from medical diagnostic Xray examinations.

title: Legislature in Ohio Votes Tough Curbs On Surface Mining
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, April 6The General Assembly ended a noisy, yearlong controversy between environmentalists and the state's aggressive coal lobby today by approving the toughest bill to control strip mining in Ohio's history.

title: 2 NAVY JETS LOST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, April 7 Hundreds of American Air Force and Navy fighterbombers struck for the second day today at North Vietnamese troop concentrations and surfacetoair missile sites as clear weather permitted heavy air attacks both above and below the demilitarized zone.

title: Gynecologist Describes Quick Method of Sterilization
Tax Deadline Extended
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 6 (AP)Revenue Secretary Robert. P. Kane said today that he would extend the April 17 deadline for filing the state's new personal income tax. He would not say how long the extension would be.

title: Two Testify About Miss Davis's Gun Purchases
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., April 6For the first time, testimony in the trial of Angela Davis centered today on the guns that have been used to link the black activist with a raid on a Marin County courtroom.

title: Jersey Legislators Leave Redistricting to the Court
description: TRENTON, April 6  A lastfinch attempt to break a legislative deadlock on Congressional redistricting in New Jersey collapsed today in the Assembly.

title: LongBuried Streets in Queens Cleaned
description: As some neighborhoods in the city began emerging this week from under mounds of accumulated garbage and debris removed in an intensive Sanitation Department spring cleaning, one crew reported uncovering several streets in the Willets Point section of Queens that had been all but lost under 1,000 tons of dumped refuse.

title: MERRILL LYNCH SET TO TRADE IN LONDON
description: LONDON, April 6 Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., has arranged to list its common stock on the London Stock Exchange. Trading probably will begin tomorrow.

title: PENN STATE TAKES N.C.A.A. GYM LEAD
description: AMES, Iowa, April 6 (UPI)Penn State was the surprise leader after the first round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association gymnastic championships today.

title: ... and in England
description: LONDON, April 6Peter Marsden, an archeologist, clearly in a hurry, climbed on a hydraulic platform and rode 100 feet into the air. As his camera focused on the remains of a 15thcentury fortress below, he explained:

title: Jordan Expresses Regret
description: AMMAN, Jordan, April 6 (UPI)Jordan expressed extreme regret today at Egypt's decision to break off relations and said the move would only help the cause of the Arabs enemies.

title: McGill Finds the City Unduly SelfCritical
description: New York City is unduly selfcritical, Dr. William J. McGill, president of Columbia University, said yesterday, He declared that it was producing its own malaise with an exaggerated rhetoric of social conflict that brought on handwringing by the communications media.

title: Mark S. Yeckes Is Dead at 75; Backed Bronx Produce Market
description: Mark S. Yeckes, a retired executive in the wholesale fruit and vegetable industry, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 1080 Fifth Avenue.

title: Court Rules Cunningham Belongs to A.B.A. Cougars
description: Off court and in court basketball made even bigger news than on court yesterday.

title: Gustave Nyselius, Founder Of Die Casting Company, 87
description: STAMFORD, Conn., April 6Gustave Nyselius, who founded the Mount Vernon Die Casting Company, largest in its field, died Tuesday at his home, 1035 Newfield Avenue. He was 87 years old.
