The event which will end May 15, is also a zonal tournament of the World Chess Federation, with the two top finishers qualifying for further competition, leading to a challenge for the world chess championship in 1975

title: Gillette
description: Vincent C. Ziegler, chairman and chief executive of the Gillette Company, told shareholders at the annual meeting in Andover, Mass., yesterday that firstquarter income totaled $17,161,000, or 59 cents a share on sales of $196,303,000.

title: Helsinki Talks Canceled
description: HELSINKI, Finland, April 20 (UPI)A United StatesSoviet negotiating session of the strategic arms limitation talks was canceled today for the second time this week when the head of the Soviet delegation did not return from Moscow, as scheduled. The meeting was postponed by the Russians. No date for the next session was announced.

title: OIL CONCERNS SUED ON INTEREST RATES
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., April 20A class action suit asking $295mlilion from six national oil companies has been filed here by three Kanawha County residents who charged the companies with assessing illegal rates of interest on revolving charge accounts.

title: U.S. Considers a Release
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The Nixon Administration had no substantive comment today on the North Vietnamese statement giving Hanoi's version of the Paris negotiations that preceded the 1968 bombing haltand the understanding between the two sides.

title: Aides of Bhutto and Mrs. Gandhi Will Confer Next Week on Talks
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, April 20  India and Pakistan will hold talks next week in preparation for a meeting of their heads of state.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISTo understand the power relationships involved in the latest Vietnam crisis it is advisable to remember a littleunderstood episode during the recent IndiaPakistan war. Last December, while the conflict was at its height, the U.S. nuclear carrier Enterprise sailed into the Bay of Bengal. The maneuver was explained by Washington as designed to help evacuate threatened American citizens; in fact it symbolized an entire policy.

title: Falcons Get Giants Punter For Future Draft Choice
description: ATLANTA, April 20 (UPI)The Atlanta Falcons acquired Bill Johnson, a punter; from the New York Giants today in exchange for a future draft choice.

title: Advertising:
description: Warwick & Legler has been selected by Lehn & Fink Products Company to do advertising for Glisade Fabric Finish, as well as an unnamed new product, but more exciting still to handle the national campaign of Body All, a spray deodorant designed for any part of the body.

title: Theater
description: Just about 300 years ago and I confess I am always shaky on history  William Wycherley wrote a marvelous comedy called The Country Wife. The point of the comedy was that its hero, a Mr. Horner, was regarded as impotent by most of the male members of the cast, and anything but impotent by the ladies. He was a hero who did protest too little.

title: Crossroad Votes
description: In a bizarre happenstance, voters in all of France and In one of West Germany's ten states will determine Sunday the shortrun political shape of Western Europe and the condition of EastWest relations. The French are being asked to pass on admitting Britain, Ireland, Denmark and Norway to the European Common Market. Voters in BadenWiirttemberg may decide the fate West Germany's nonaggression treaties with Russia and Poland as well as the survival of Chancellor Brandt's Government in Bonn.

title: MISS FRENCH MAKES DEBUT IN RIGOLETTO
description: There were several new faces in the City Opera performance of Rigoletto Wednesday night, the most prominent being that of Norma French, who made her debut as Gilda. Miss French has had considerable background in musical comedy, films and television, but this was apparently her first appearance in a major operatic role.

title: Crum & Forster Responds
description: Crum & Forster Insurance Companies, responding to the enactment of nofault auto insurance laws in several states, said yesterday that its liability policies were covered under the laws of all 50 states and in Canada.

title: Trudeau Campaign for Bilingualism Is Raising Touchy Canadian Issues
description: OTTAWA, April 20An Ottawa father of ?? who has been in government communications work for 20 years protested recently that has promotion had been blocked because the could not speak french.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4 No Title

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO the Editor:

title: Rangers Play It Serious: Too High Last Season
description: Ted Irvine noticed the difference in the Ranger dressing room before last night's key game against the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: General Telephone
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation expects to be able to maintain its firstquarter growth rate, Theodore F. Brophy, president, said yesterday. This was a clarification of a statement he made at the conclusion of the company's annual meeting in Boston on Wednesday.

title: QE 2 Weathers Hurricane During Atlantic Crossing
description: LONDON, April 20 (AP) Britain's luxury ocean liner the Queen Elizabeth 2 has weathered an Atlantic hurricane and is heading home to Southampton with bruised passengers and battered decks.

title: Swerdlow Musical Closing
description: Love Me, Love My Children, the Robert Swerdlow musical, will end its run Sunday at the Mercer Arts Center after 187 performances. Paul Aaron and Gretchen Wyler are the producers.

title: ANTIDUMPING TAX PUT ON 5 NATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 The Tariff Commission found today that the domestic industry making large power transformers was being injured by imports from five countries sold in the United States at dumping prices.

title: UPRISING UNREALI M'AY PANEL TOED
description: A slight, 35yearold convicted robber told the McKay Commission yesterday that the four days he spent in the inmateheld yard at the Attica Correctional Facility were disjointed, unreal, confused and whacked out.

title: Marines Chief on Tour
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) Gen. Robert E. Cushman Jr., the new commandant of the Marine Corps, left today on twoweek trip to visit marines stationed in Spain, Italy, Belgium and England. He will also visit marines afloat with the Sixth Fleet in the Mediteranean anad the Spanish and British Royal Marine Corps.

title: 13 ARE EXPECTED IN $100,000 WOOD
description: The likelihood exists that there will be a field of 13 for the $100,000 Wood Memorial, the 1mile test for 3yearolds that will have its 48th running tomorrow. Among those expected to compete are nine nominees to the Triple Crown of the Kentucky Derby, the Preakness and the Belmont Stakes.

title: Shift of G.O.P. Convention To Miami Beach Reported
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The Republican party has decided to shift its national convention from San Diego to Miami Beach, according to Miami Beach officials.

title: Congress Is Urged to Repeal U.S. Penalty on Marijuana Use
description: WASHINGTON, April 20Bills to repeal Federal criminal penalties for the possession and private use of marijuana were introduced today in the Senate and House of Representatives.

title: Sales for First Quarter Are Also Highest in Company's History
description: The American Home Products Corporation reported yesterday that its sales and earnings in the three months ended March 31 were the highest for any quarter in the company's history.

title: Section of Highway Seized
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia; April 20 (AP)Enemy troops reportedly seized a 50mile stretch of Route 1 in southeastern Cambodia today, posing a potential threat to Saigon, 40 miles down the road.

title: Executive Changes
description: J. T. Bailey, president of the Warner & Swasey Company, has been elected to the additional post of chief executive officer of the Clevelandbased builder of machine tools, construction equipment and textile machinery.

title: TV Loses A.B.A. Game
description: Because of the switch of the American Basketball Association playoff game between the Indiana Pacers and Utah Stars from tomorrow afternoon to tomorrow night, the Columbia Broadcasting System will be unable to televise it, C.B.S. announced yesterday.

title: Royal Ballet Will Present Local Premieres at Met
description: Britain's Royal Ballet will present six local premieres during its sixweek season at the Metropolitan Opera House from Monday through June 3.

title: Milhaud's Variety Marks A Retrospective Concert
description: Works of aphoristic brevity, monumental grandeur and every degree of complexity in between have been churned out by Darius Milhaud in his long life (he will be SO next Sept. 4). It makes possible programs of infinite variety, and this is what the Milhaud retrospective concert at the McMillin Theater Wednesday night had. It was the last of this season's excellent and valuable composer surveys presented by the Performers Committee for 20thCentury Music.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Two Democratic Presidential candidates have turned their attention in recent days to a new issue: nonpayment of corporate Federal income taxes.

title: Court Orders 2 Graffiti Vandals To Scrub Walls of IRT Station
description: Two teenaged boys were sentenced yesterday in Family Court to remove graffiti they had sprayed on subway walls.

title: Hooton, Cubs NoHit Pitcher, Faces Seaver at Shea Today
description: The Mets, who have not even been able to take batting practice since Tuesday in Montreal, will attempt to sharpen their batting eyes this afternoon in the opener of a threegame series against the Chicago Cubs at Shea Stadium.

title: MSGR.CARLO MONTINI, COUSIN OF POPE PAUL
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, April 20Msgr. Carlo Montini, a cousin of Pope Paul VI, died here this morning. He was 68 years old and for the last 12 years had been provicar general of the Pontiff's hometown of Brescia.

title: Sample Files for Mistrial
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 20 (UPI)Johnny Sample, former pro football defensive back, filed a motion today for a new trial on his conviction of cashing $7,400 in stolen Government checks. He claims that on one particular day the Government said he was cashing 12 of the checks, he actually was at Aqueduct Race Track in New York, and that the District Court judge had erred in excluding documentary evidence.

title: 2 Food Concerns Plan New Ventures In the Same Field
description: Two large food organizations announced plans yesterday to enter other branches of the business. The Kroger Company, a Cincinnatibased retailing and food manufacturing company, said it was going into the franchised convenience store business.

title: Brooklyn Man Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (UPI)The Defense Department today announced that Warrant Officer Robert A. Stern of Brookyn had been killed in fighting in Southeast Asia.

title: Chinese Go Easy on U.S., Win in Table Tennis, 41
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., April 20 China's touring tabletennis team brought its Ping Pang diplomacy to the Nassau Coliseum today in a pleasant exchange of smiles, gifts and slams.

title: Candidates Day
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., April 20 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey stepped up his attacks today on, Gov. Milton J. Shapp, on Philadelphia's Democratic chairman, Peter J. Camiel, and on the party organizations they lead.

title: Text of Statement by North Vietnam on 1968 Talks That Led to U.S. Bombing Halt
description: PARIS, April 20Following is the text of a statement issued in English here today by the North Vietnamese Government, giving their version of the 1968 negotiations with the United States that led to a halt in American bombing of the North.

title: Paper Bars Political Ads
description: GREENVILLE, Miss., April 20 (UPI)Officials of the Greenville Delta DemocratTimes said said today that the newspaper would not accept advertisements from candidates for Federal office this year because of the 1971 Federal Election Campaign Act. They said that restrictions placed by Congress on rates which newspapers may charge for advertising on behalf of such candidates are clearly unconstitutional.

title: Davidovici Proves Expertise on Violin In Rendering Bach
description: The question to be asked about Robert Davidovici is not whether he is a good violinist, but what kind of good violinist he is. Mr. Davidovici, a 24yearold native of Rumania, won this year's Naumburg String Competition and as a result made his New York recital debut on Wednesday night at Alice Tully Hall.

title: MAGDALEN FLEXNER, FORMER U.S. CONSUL
description: WASHINGTON, April 20Mrs. Magdalen G. H. Flexner, a retired Foreign Service officer, died Tuesday of cancer in Doctors Hospital. She was 64 years old and lived at 3221 Volta Place, N.W.

title: 35 Injured in Bus Plunge
description: MARKTHEIDENFELD, West Germany, April 20 (UPI)At least 35 persons were injured, 10 of them seriously, when a bus filled with 52 members of a pensioners club went down an embankment and overturned, the police said today.

title: The Talk of Arlington, Tex.
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., April 20Arlington, goes the saying, is like the smallbusiness man who, finding his store between two huge ones, put up a large sign that said, Main Entrance. In the middle of the 30mile stretch between Dallas and Fort Worth, Arlington has been overshadowed by its wellknown neighbors. But tomorrow night, this town of 100,000 people comes of age. Its own major league baseball team, the Texas Rangers, plays it first home game against the California Angels.

title: GIANTS BEAT PADRES FOR M'DOWELL BY 21
description: SAN DIEGO, April 20 (AP)Bobby Bonds singled home the second of two San Francisco runs in the fifth inning tonight and the Giants held on to beat the San Diego Padres, 21.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 Brig. Gen. Brent Scowcroft, the head of the advance party in Moscow preparing for President Nixon's trip there, is described as a very quiet and very forceful man who has specialized in Russian affairs during his Air Force career.

title: POETS GROUP HERE ASSAILS NERUDA
description: The Poetry Society of America, an organization not noted for its militancy, took time out from its 62d annual dinner at the Plaza last evening to condemn the recent statement by Pablo Neruda, a Nobel laureate in literature, that the controversy surrounding the award of the Nobel Prize to Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn was a big bore.

title: Mayor Names 19 to CLICK
description: Nineteen business and community leaders were appointed yesterday by Mayor Lindsay to the board of directors of CLICK (Commerce, Labor and Industry Corporation of Kings), established to develop the former Brooklyn Navy Yard as an urban industrial park. Steven Korsen, vice president of the Philip Morris Corporation, will serve as chairman of the board. CLICK will prepare and execute a master development plan for the yard.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1 No Title

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH, DRINK. DEWAR'S. William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord Ltd, Syosset. N. Y.Advt.

title: Units of Last Division Left in North Said to Move South
description: WASHINGTON, April 20Advance elements of the last North Vietnamese combat division remaining on northern soil were reported tonight to be entering the demilitarized zone toward the battle in South Vietnam.

title: U.S. Denounced by Many at U.N. Parley
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 20  China brouhgt the Vietnam issue to it United Nations conference here today, condeminng what she called criminal acts of war expansion by the Nixon Administration.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 20Harry K. Schwartz, who is on the ballot as a candidate for delegate to the Democratic National Convention pledged to Senator Muskie, defected today to Senator McGovern.

title: Dining: Don't Try to Order in French
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Jersey Fire Halts Evening Service at Penn Station
description: Train service in and out of Penn Station here was delayed as much as two hours through the peak of the rush hour last night after a fire in a New Jersey solvent plant forced the Penn Central to shut off all its electrical power in the area.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Head Boats
description: MONTAUK, L. I.There are some who look down their noses at head boat fishing, but they are making a mistake.

title: RICKEY CONQUERS COX, 16, 63, 61
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., April 20 (UPI)Cliff Richey, making his debut on the World Championship Tennis circuit, today ousted Mark Cox of Britain in the third round of the North Carolina National Bank classic.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BALTIMORE, April 20 (AP) The Baltimore Orioles announced last night that last Saturday's postponed game against the Yankees would be made up as part of a twilightnight doubleheader on Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day.

title: Cosmic Ray Satellite Is Studied in Russia
description: MOSCOW, April 20The Soviet Union announced today it had recovered a cosmic/ray satellite for study. The satellite, named Intercosmos 6, was launched April 7 as part of a joint space exploration effort by nations of the Soviet bloc.

title: Candidates Day
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) Representative Shirley Chisholm of Brooklyn, a Democratic Presidential candidate, said today that two of her rivals, Senators Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota and Edmund S. Muskie of Maine, were tired, irrelevant and mediocre.

title: Nice Tourney Postponed
description: NICE, France, April 20 (Reuters)Rain forced postponement of all matches today in the Nice international tennis championships.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The Vietnam war has illustrated once more the limitations of political leadership and the unpredictability of human conduct. Nothing is more tragic in this seemingly endless story of human weakness than the consistent misjudgments on both sides of the enemy on the other side. Time and again, by misconceiving the leaders and people they were fighting against, both have failed to serve their own best interests. It is happening again in Hanoi.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASIMIGTON, April 20 The Commerce Department today estimated last week's department store sales at $773million, up 2 per cent from the yearearlier $759million. Last week's total retail store sales were about $8,031,000,000.

title: BOARD APPROVES SKYSCRAPER PLAN
description: The Board of Estimate approved a zoning provision yesterday designed to stimulate the construction of skyscrapers with apartments atop offices in Manhattan's central business district.

title: Music: Solti's Mahler
description: Sir Georg Solti brought the Chicago Symphony to Carnegie Hall Wednesday evening, and events followed a predictable course. The house was sold out and the audience sat there simply oozing worship.

title: Bretons Back Bigger Marketfor Their Cauliflower
description: ST.POL  DE  LEON, France April 20In this region of Brittany, which expects big things from Briton's entry into the Common Market, it is hard to tell, except by a few posters, that in three days France is to hold a referendum on whether the Six shall become the Ten.

title: COLUMBIA SENATE DRAWS CRITICISM
description: Since the Columbia University Senate was formed out of the campus turbulence of 1968, with the goal of providing students and faculty members a voice in the university administration, it has often served as a safety valve to student dissent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times
description: Because the New York Mets coveted the pink and ivory torso of Rusty Staub, they traded Ken Singleton, Tim Foli and Mike Jorgensen to Montreal on the day the baseball season didn't open. At their first opportunity thereafter, Singleton, Foli and Jorgensen sprang upon their former playmates and struck them repeated blows.

title: SHOP TALK
description: There have been Howard Hughes Tshirts (a lawsuit's worth); trompe Foeil Tshirts; and Tshirts bearing oversized bagels for Zabar fans partial to the West Side delicatessen. For the soberminded, there are message Tshirts bearing warnings (Smog Kills) or injunctions (Save Our Sons). And for the politically inclined, there are Chairman Mao Tshirts complete with quotations.

title: MANUEL GOMEZ MORIN
description: MEXICO CITY, April 20 (AP)  Manuel Gomez Morin, a founder of the National Action Party, Mexico's leading opposition group, died of pneumonia yesterday at the age of 75. He leaves his wife and four children.

title: Notes on People
description: Barbara W. Newell, a labor economist and educator, will become the 10th president of Wellesley College. She succeeds Ruth M. Adams, who has resigned to become the first woman to be a vice president of Dartmouth College.

title: Mrs. Durst Wed to Ronald Phillips
description: Mrs. Fresia Hager Durst, director of Consular Corps affairs at the New York City Commission for the United Nations and for the Consular Corps, was married here yesterday afternoon to Ronald Hart Phillips, a vice president of the Independent Television Corporation.

title: Oath
description: When kings were thought to rule by divine right, an oath of allegiance to the monarch had religious force and sanction. In this secular age, relatively few persons are scrupulous enough to be troubled by the exact wording of a sworn pledge, while the great majority of citizens seem to accept these formulas with shrugging indifference. For the traitor or the thief, of course, no oath was, is or ever will be a barrier.

title: Jack Case Jury Sent Back After Reporting Deadlock
description: A jury of seven men and five women yesterday began deliberating the fate of Assemblyman Hulan E. Jack and five codefendants charged with conspiring in a labor management scheme that allegedly sought to profit illegally from food distributors in Harlem.

title: ERWIN FELDMAN, LABOR LAWYER, 67
description: Erwin Feldman, a lawyer for labor organizations in the entertainment field and for industrial associations in the textile and apparel business, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home in East Hampton, L. I. He was 67 years old and had an office at 60 Park Avenue here.

title: Hospital Workers Call Off Stoppage; Face Docking of Pax
description: The 3,500 hospital workers who staged a sick  out Wednesday in 15 municipal hospitals were back at work yesterday.

title: Quake Jars Flagstaff, Ariz.
description: FLAGSTAFF, Ariz., April 20 (AP)A mild earthquake jolted this northern Arizona city at dawn today, rattling windows and dishes but apparently causing no damage. The California Institute of Technology said the earthquake was recorded at 5:28 A.M. mountain standard time and measured 4.6 on the Ricter scale.

title: Mansfield and Scott See Chinese Premier
description: HONG KONG, April 20 (UPI)Premier Chou Enlai met today with Senators Mike Mansfield and Hugh Scott, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, reported.

title: FUTURES IN SUGAR DECLINE SLIGHTLY
description: Trade news in the world sugar market yesterday involved China, Yugoslavia and Cuba.

title: Antiwar Coalition Calls for Moratorium on May 4
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 A coalition of antiwar leaders and groups, backed by more than 20 Senators and Congressmen, called today for a nationwide moratorium May 4 to protest the escalation of the war.

title: Hanoi Claims 5 Planes
description: SAIGON, Friday, April 21 (Reuters)The Hanoi radio reported today that five American warplanes were shot down over North Vietnam yesterday.

title: PROFIT DECLINES AT COAST UTILITY
description: Net income of the Southern California Edison Company in the first quarter fell to $26.3million, or 48 cents a share, from the yearearlier $30.6million, the company announced yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: MY NAME IS ASHER LEV. By Chains Potoh. 369 pages. Knopf. $7.95.

title: Abrams Calls for a Task Force To End Gang Reign of Terror
description: Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams said yesterday that youth gangs had spread a reign of terror In the borough, threatening the safety of citizens on the streets, in subways and buses and in the schools.

title: DOW INDEX UP 1.51; MOST STOCKS OFF
description: The stock market, shrugging off the intensified fighting in Vietnam, gave a good account of itself yesterday. Although a majority of Issues declined on the New York Stock Exchange, the DowJones industrial average overcame a loss of nearly 5 points at 11 A.M. to finish at 966.29 with a gain of 1.51.

title: Suffolk Jobless Disaster Cited; U.S. to Pour Funds Into County
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., April 20 Suffolk County was designated an employment disaster area today by the Federal Government, making it eligible for hundreds of thousands of dollars in emergency relief funds and loans to private industry.

title: Nissalke Leaves Chaps to Become Coach of Sonics
description: SEATTLE, April 20 (UPI) Tom Nissalke, coach of the Dallas Chaparrals of the American Basketball Association, was named coach today of the Seattle SuperSonics of the National Basketball Association.

title: DR. FRANK KNIGHT, ECONOMIST, DIES
description: CHICAGO, April 20  Dr. Frank H. Knight, prqfessor of economics emeritus at the University of Chicago, died on Saturday. He was 86 years old.

title: An Omelet for the Weekend
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Catholic Is Slain in Belfast as Violence Goes On
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 20A Roman Catholic was slain here last night and two women engaged to British soldiers had paint poured over them and their hair cut off.

title: CUBS DEFEATED BY PIRATES, 75
description: PITTSBURGH, April 20 (AP)  Manny Sanguillen drove in two runs with his fifth and sixth straight hits, extending over three games, as the Pittsburgh Pirates defeated the Chicago Cubs, 75, tonight.

title: U.S. FIGHTS IMMUNITY IN INQUIRY ON GRAVEL
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (UPI)Solicitor General Irwin N. Griswold urged the Supreme Court today not to provide an umbrella of senatorial immunity for persons connected with Senator Mike Gravel's publication of the secret Pentagon papers.

title: Publisher's Revenues Show 5% Increase
description: Time, Inc., informed stockholders yesterday of gains in its firstquarter profit and revenues, along with the starting of a new monthly magazine, Money.

title: COURT BACKS USE OF DAVIS LETTERS
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., April 20 The prosecution in the trial of Angela Davis was granted the right today to use her personal letters to show the extent of her love for George Jackson.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Activities. The President met with Clarence Walton, chairman of the Panel on Nonpublic Education of the President's commission on school finance, to receive report. The President also saw newly elected Representative Clifford Carlson, RIll. The President sent a message to the International Development Conference meeting here. Later the President gave a reception for the American Society of Newspaper Editors.

title: Prince Richard to Wed July 8; Royal Rank Expected for Bride
description: LONDON, April 20 (UPI)Prince Richard of Gloucester, cousin of Queen Elizabeth II, and 10th in line to the throne, and his fiance, Miss Birgitte van Deurs, a Danish secretary, will be married July 8 in a quiet country wedding, it was announced today at Kensington Palace.

title: Advertising:
description: The first new magazine from Time Inc. since Sports Illustrated was started in 1954 is due in the fall.

title: Flanigan Limits His Testimony On I.T.T. Before Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, April 20Peter M. Flanigan declined today to answer the questions of Senators about contacts he might have had with Richard G. Kleindienst or officials of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation about the settlement of three Government antitrust cases against I.T.T.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A group of real estate operators and building owners sued in State Supreme Court yesterday to force the city to modify its requirements for obtaining funds under the Municipal Loan Program and to collect $436,761 the group said was owed its members for work already done.

title: Barr Gets Sandy Art Award
description: The culture world's newest achievement award, already known as the Sandy, was bestowed last evening on Alfred H. Barr Jr., the noted art historian and founding father of the Museum of Modern Art.

title: GangStyle Slaying in Brooklyn Is 9th Here in the Last 3 Weeks
description: The ninth victim of a ganglandstyle killing in three weeks was found yesterday in a car parked near Prospect Park in Brooklyn.

title: Plan for South Richmond
description: Hope for sound and orderly development in the entire southern third of Staten Island depends on passage in Albany of legislation that State Senator John J. Marchi has now moved out of committee.

title: KNICKS, CELTICS LOOK TO CENTERS
description: The spotlight will be on the center position tonight when the New York Knicks and Boston Celtics square off in the fourth game of the second round of the National Basketball Association playoffs at Madison Square Garden. The game, scheduled for 8 o'clock. will be televised nationally and locally by the American Broadcasting Company (Channel 7).

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., April 20 (UPI)American political leaders today are of a higher caliber morally and religiously than in any other time in recent history, the Rev. Billy Graham says.

title: Alaska Pipeline
description: Probably the most documented case, as, far as the environment is concerned, ever made against the proposed TransAlaska oil pipeline is contained in the Interior Department's sixvolume Environmental Impact Statement. Yet an accompanying threevolume analysis of Its economic and security aspects makes it clear that the department thinks the project should be built as soon as possible on the ground that the national economy needs the oil and the national security demands it.

title: DirtyBook Store Run by Police Gains Indictment of 18 Here on Pornography
description: The police and District Attorney Frank S. Hogan announced the completion yesterday of a coordinated investigation into major pornography suppliers in the city that included the briefand unprofitableoperation by undercover policemen of a dirtybook store on Eighth Avenue.

title: House Democrats, 14458, Uphold EndtheWar Move
description: WASHINGTON, April 20House Democrats, denouncing both the Nixon Administration for its dangerous escalation of the war and North Vietnam for its invasion of South Vietnam, voted overwhelmingly today to support legislation that would set a termination date for the American military involvement.

title: Armco's and Anaconda's Results ImprovedKennecott in Drop
description: The Aluminum Company of America, the Armco Steel Corporation and the Anaconda Company reported yesterday improved results for the first quarter. However, the Kennecott Copper Corporation disclosed that earnings were almost cut in half despite higher sales.

title: Conversation in Space
description: APOLLO CONTROL. The lunar module Orion has been advised of the possibility of a waveoff for landing on this revolution. It seems that the circularization burn on the command module Casper was unsuccessful.

title: Price Unit Retracts Fare Rise Granted To the New Haven
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 The Price Commission discovered an administrative error today in allowing a railroad, fare increase for the New Haven line two days ago and withdrew the decision.

title: Orioles, Held to Two Hits, Top Tigers, 10, on Homer by Blair
description: BALTIMORE, April 20 (AP)Paul Blair's fourthinning home run, one of two Baltimore hits, provided the winning margin as Pat Dobson hurled the Orioles to a 10 victory over the Detroit Tigers tonight. Dobson allowed only three safeties.

title: Fashions of Israel, Along With Bonds, A Luncheon Smash
description: Without slighting the fashions, the hit of the annual State of Israel bonddrive luncheon yesterday was obviously the flock of models. There were Mrs. Richard Aurelio (what a nice face), Mrs. Harry Belafonte (what a good shape), Mrs. Vidal Sassoon (I didn't know he was married) and Mrs. David Susskind (she's much younger than he is).

title: Fed Blocks Bank America On RealEstate Syndicate
description: The Federal Reserve Board has rebuffed an attempt by the Bank America Corporation, the parent company of the nation's largest bank, to get into the realestate syndicationbusiness. In so doing, the Board tightened somewhat its definition of the scope of activities allowed to bank holding companies.

title: Rockefeller Submits Court Reform Bills
description: ALBANY, April 20Governor Rockefeller today sent to the Legislature a package of courtreform bills that included a plan for the state gradually to finance all costs of courts in the state except for federal courts, town and village courts and city courts outside New York City.

title: Protest at Columbia Brings Suspension Of Classes Today
description: Demonstrators swarmed into a closed meeting of the Columbia University Senate yesterday, forcing its suspension, after the university had summoned the police to take action against picketing students.

title: GROWTH OF MONEY IS ACCELERATED
description: The pace of monetary expansion accelerated over the last four weeks, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday.

title: WALK IS PUT OFF
description: HOUSTON, Friday, April 21 After hours of uncertainty and concern, the astronauts of Apollo 16 finally get the goahead and descended to a delayed but successful landing yesterday in the mountains of the moon at 9:23 P.M., Eastern standard time.

title: Merger News
description: A spokesman for the Newfoundland Government an nounced in St. John's yesterday that it would not introduce legislation for the takeover of the linerboard mill of Canadian Javelin, Ltd., until some time in June.

title: Bridge: Defenders Bidding Is a Factor In Evaluating Chances for Slam
description: Many contracts that seem satisfactory on the basis of the declarer's hand and the dummy become unattractive when the opposing bidding is taken into account.

title: Panel Urges U.S. Act Quickly To Rescue Nonpublic Education
description: WASHINGTON, April 20A Presidential panel recommended today that the Federal Government act quickly and on a variety of fronts to rescue the nation's private and parochial schools.

title: Blacks at Harvard Protest Gulf Stock By Seizing Building
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., April 20  Two dozen black students broke into and occupied a Harvard administration building at dawn today to protest the university's decision not to sell its 671.876 shares of stock in the Gulf Oil Corporation.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHICAGO, April 20Daniel T. Walker the independent Democrat who upset the organization's candidate in the governorship primary last month, announced today that he would not endorse State's Attorney Edward V. Hanrahan for reelection, even if the indictment against Mr. Hanrahan was dismissed.

title: Soviet Says West Is Stalling On Chemical Weapon Ban
description: GENEVA, April 20The Soviet Union accused the United States and other Western powers at the disarmament conference here today of stalling on the issue of banning chemical arms.

title: GUARD IS ORDERED TO U. OF MARYLAND
description: Gov. Marvin Mandel declared a state of emergency at the University of Maryland last night and sent National Guardsmen onto the College Park campus with orders to enforce an overnight curfew and bring an end to three days of antiwar disturbances and violence.

title: MEANY ASKS NIXON TO ACT ON PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, April 20George Meany called on the Government today to control all prices effectively  including food pricesor else to drop wage and price controls entirely.

title: Screen: Movie on Movie
description: In 1905 somebody made a brief movie called Tom, Tom, the Piper's Son. The movie, which has been preserved by way of a copyright print in the Library of Congress, consists of a series of remarkably vivid stageset scenes through which Tom leads an almost inexhaustible following of mischievous kids and angry adults into doorways, out chimneys, up ladders, and down haystacks until he is finally caught in the bucket of a well. Of course the camera does not move, but everything in front of the camera moves like crazy; including a crowded smalltown carnival and a barnyard full of waddling, sometimes flying.

title: Champion Spark Plug
description: R. A. Stranahan Jr., chairman of the Champion Spark Plug Company, said yesterday that it would seek part of the business of supplying spark plugs to the Ford Motor Company in wake of the Supreme Court decision requiring Ford to divest itself of its Autolite Spark Plug operations.

title: BOYCOTT POSSIBLE FOR WIMBLEDON
description: The Wimbledon championships, already threatened with the absence of top men contract professionals, may lose some of the top names in women's tennis for this year's tournament.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: TEL AVIV, April 20 (AP)Israel reduced Iran's lead to 21 in a Davis Cup European Zone A preliminary tennis playofftoday when Yair Werdheimer and Yosef Stabholz defeated Azat Nemati and Hussein Aghari, 62, 63, 26, 63, in men's doubles play.

title: Athens Warns U.S. on Prisoner Flight
description: ATHENS, April 20The circumstances of a political prisoner's recent departure from Greece brought a warning to Washington today from the Athens Government.

title: Jersey Library Designated
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (UPI) Representative Robert A. Roe, Democrat of New Jersey, announced today the designation of the Wayne Township Public Library in Wayne, N. J., as a Federal documents depository library to receive Government publications for public use.

title: Somebody Hollered MIG! Gunner's Mate Recalls
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, April 20 (UPI)Somebody hollered MIG! and before we could swivel our gun around, the bombs went off and flames started corning through the hatches.

title: ABDUCTION OF GIRL LINKED TO EXTORTION
description: The abduction of the 19yearold daughter of a Brooklyn bank manager last Aug. 3 came to light with the arrest yesterday of a truck driver on charges of plotting to extort $150,000 of the bank's money for her release.

title: Exhaustive Ground Tests Find Trouble Not Critical
description: Hello, Houston. This is Casper now. We did not do circ. And I'd like to talk about the TVC servo loops. Those words, at about 3 P.M. yesterday from Lieut. Comdr. Thomas K. Mattingly 2d in the command ship Casper he orbited the moon, were the first indication to the world that the Apollo 16 mission had run into significant difficulties.

title: Unlawful Character
description: The rise in the number of law school applicants the last few years can be interpreted as evidence that college graduates regard the courts as a forum for justice and working within the system. It therefore comes as a surprise, to say the least, to find a special committee of the American Bar Association proposing that firstyear law students be subjected to some sort of character test that would brand them in advance as moral and predict their possible misconduct as future members of the bar.

title: Dodgers Rout Braves, 111
description: ATLANTA, April 20 (AP)Los Angeles exploded for six runs on seven consecutive secondinning singles and Claude Osteen hurled a sevenhitter as the Dodgers routed the Atlanta Braves, 111, tonight to sweep their fourgame series.

title: Books of The Times
description: ARRIVING WHERE WE STARTED. By Barbara Probst Solomon. 261 pages. Harper & Row. $6.95.

title: Candidates Day
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 Senator Henry M. Jackson and Governor George C. Wallace, hardliners on Vietnam among the Democratic Presidential candidates, both declined today to defend the Nixon Administration's new bombing policy in Vietnam.

title: P. B. Stephens, an ExManager Of The Daily News, Dies at 71
description: Philip B. Stephens, who retired as general manager of The New York Daily News on June 1, 1962, died yesterday at Bellevue Medical Center after a long illness. He was 71 years old.

title: CZECHOSLOVAK SIX WINS WORLD TITLE
description: PRAGUE, April 20 (UPI)  A hard  fighting Czechoslovak hockey team captured the world amateur title today by beating the Soviet Union, 32. It is the first team since 1962 to take the title away from the Russians.

title: Rain Falls on Hinton's Debut as Yanks Fifth Starter
description: Rich Hinton, whose spring training was cut short by mononucleosis, was struck down again yesterday. This time he suffered the fate that rain brings to a pitcher who is the fifth man in a fourman rotation.

title: BILLY BURKE, GOLFER WHO WON OPEN IN 31
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., April 20 (UPI)Billy Burke, the professional golfer, died here yesterday after a long illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Pierre Lazareff, 65, Publisher Of FranceSoir and Elle, Dies
description: PARIS, Friday, April 21 (UPI) Pierre Lazareff, publisher and director of FranceSoir, the largest circulation newspaper in Paris, died early today at the American Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., April 20  Senator George McGovern scored a surprising victory in Vermont last night when his supporters at local Democratic caucuses gained a majority of the delegates chosen for the state Democratic convention.

title: Italian NeoFascists Appear to Lose Momentum
description: ROME, April 20The neoFascist party, which had begun its campaign for the general elections next month with ostentatious confidence, seems worried now.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GREEN, DICKINSON LEAD BY 2 SHOTS
description: RANCHO LA COSTA, Calif., April 20Hubert Green, who applauded himself on occasion, and Gardner Dickinson, who almost missed a shot when a bee alighted on his ball, shared the firstround lead today in the Tournament of Champions with 68's.

title: JohnsManville to Expand
description: The JohnsManville Corporation announced yesterday a $10million program to increase its polyvinyl chloride production capacity. Three plants will be built, in Arizona, Colorado and North Carolina.

title: Weyerhaeuser
description: Firstquarter earnings of the Weyerhaeuser Company totaled $32.2million, or 45 cents a share, compared with $20.7million, or 30 cents a share a year earlier, the annual meeting was told in Tacoma, Wash., yesterday.

title: Botany Announcement Is Awaited by Traders
description: Botany Industries, Inc., which said early yesterday that it would make an announcement later in the day, has postponed its announcement until today or next week, Michael Daroff, president and chairman, said yesterday. Botany, listed on the American Stock Exchange, is a producer and retailer of men's wear and it manufactures luggage and highpile fabrics.

title: Credit Markets
description: Bond prices continued to advance yesterday and interest rates throughout the money and capital markets kept moving lower yesterday despite news that inflation had worsened in the first quarter of the year.

title: Move Over, Guy Lombardo
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 20 (AP)The Sugar Bowl football game will be televised by the American Broadcasting Company on New Year's Eve in 1972, 1973 and 1974, Boone Arledge, president of A.B.C. Sports, announced today.

title: Casey, Williams Clash on Institutions
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, described today in emotional terms the harm he thought would come from permitting brokers who are affiliated with financial institutions to become stock exchange members and do business only or mainly for their affiliates.

title: BLUES TROUNCED BY BRUINS, 10 TO 2
description: BOSTON, April 20The St. Louis Blues should take up music. At the Boston Garden tonight, before the usual sellout crowd of 14,995 fans, the Blues were routed by the Bruins, 102, in the second game of their semifinal Stanley Cup playoff series.

title: HANOI AGAIN ASKS RESTART OF TALKS
description: PARIS, April 20North Vietnam and the Vietcong today formally proposed resuming the stalled peace conference next Thursday and indicated that they would agree to meet whether the United States halted its bombing attacks or not.

title: Dance: Dreams in Prison
description: In theater dance, particularly in ballet but also in modern dance, we expect effortlessness from the performers. The greatest dancers have been those who have gone beyond technique, whose virtuosity or dramatic power has concealed and minimized the physical difficulties of their dancing and transformed it into art.

title: Royal Dutch Shell Group
description: The Royal Dutch Shell Group of Companies expects 1972 to be a very disappointing year with no early return to former high rates of growth, G. A. Wagner, president of Royal Dutch Petroleum, told the annual meeting yesterday in the Hague. The executive said that because of the poor outlook, the group's capital spending plans are being subjected to renewed vigorous control. Royal Dutch Petroleum is a holding company that owns 60 per cent of the group.

title: Pandas Make Themselves at Home in National ZooVisitors Welcome
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The capital's newest celebrities were at home and receiving today, but were so busy gobbling up the refreshments that they didn't have time to notice the guests.

title: Chesapeake & Ohio
description: CLEVELAND, April 20 (AP) A promising outlook is in store for the Chesapeake & OhioBaltimore & Ohio Railroads this year, Hays T. Watkins, president and chief exlecutive officer, told C.&O. shareholders at their annual meeting today.

title: RCA AND ZENITH SEEK BETTER TV PRODUCTS
description: The nation's two major television set makers, the RCA Corporation and the Zenith Radio Corporation, took separate steps yesterday to improve their products.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: TUCSON, Ariz., April 20 (AP) Mrs. Billie Jean King, the No. 1seeded player in the $18,000 Virginia Slims Conquistadores tennis tournament, moved easily into the quarterfinals today with a 61, 60 victory over Pam Austin of Rolling Hills, Calif.

title: HOUSE VOTES FUND ON SPACE SHUTTLE
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The space program's supporters scored a major victory today when the House overwhelmingly approved funds for the space agency's multibilliondollar shuttle program.

title: Food Processor Elects New Chairman
description: The Kraftco Corporation, one of the world's largest food processors, had sales in the first quarter of this year of $779,818,000, an increase of 5.7 per cent over the corresponding quarter of 1971.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In reply to Frank J. Landers (letter April 14), who is worried about abortions destroying potential geniuses such as Einstein, Bach or Rembrandt, why not be happy that abortions could he destroying such abominations to the human race as Hitler, Jack the Ripper and Rasputin?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Let 1972 Be Different
description: Only through sheer abdication of responsibility could the Democratic nominee this summer not assail the President's renewal of a Vietnam victory through air power. It would be equally strange if either the White House, Hanoi or Moscow chose its moves in this latest round unmindful of next November's election.

title: B. F. Skinner's. Philosophy Fascist? Depends on How It's Used, He Says
description: NEW HAVEN, April 20A very common comment on my book is that it might be basically fascistthat it gives aid and comfort to fascism. Maybe it does in a sense, but whether it gives advantage to fascism depends entirely on whether other ways of life are able to take advantage of what we are learning about human behavior. This is a warning.

title: 5th Ave. Group Opposing OTB Parlor
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation is embroiled in a controversy with Fifth Avenue merchants and a community planning board over a proposal to open a betting parlor half a block from Tiffany's, across the street from Henri Bendel's and a few doors away from Bergdorf Goodman.

title: Mine Union Official Pleads Not Guilty in Yablonski Case
description: PITTSBURGH, April 20 (AP) A United Mine Workers organizer has pleaded not guilty to Federal conspiracy charges stemming from the slaying of Joseph Yablonski, a leading union insurgent, and his wife and daughter.

title: Telephone Deal Signed
description: Companhia Telefonica Brasileira, the largest telephone company in Brazil, announced yesterday it has signed a contract with Ericsson do Brasil, a subsidiary of the L. M. Ericsson Telephone Company of Sweden, covering delivery and installation of telephone equipment valued at $40million.

title: NEW RAIL SERVICE TO JERSEY URGED
description: Direct rail service to midtown Manhattan for New Jersey commuters who now make one or two changes for the same trip, an expanded and betterutilized Penn Station here and the use of at least part of the old Madison Square Garden site for a new commuter rail terminal were among preliminary recommendations made by a bistate task force yesterday.

title: A STATE ELECTION EXCITES GERMANS
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, April 18Large and lively crowds, vigorous efforts by independent voter groups, insinuations by conservatives that Chancellor Willy Brandt has sold out West Germany to the Russians in secret negotiationsthese have been among the highlights of the campaigning for the state election Sunday in BadenWiirttemberg.

title: DETECTIVE HEARD AT HOLDER TRIAL
description: MINEOLA, L.I., April 20 (AP) Howard Holder, a former Brooklyn school principal, said that his problem was to do away with his wife but that he never said he planned to kill her, a Nassau County detective testified today.

title: BRITISH RAIL CHIEFS CALL OFF SLOWDOWN
description: LONDON, April 20Britain's railroad unions decided tonight to obey an order of the new National Industrial Relations Court and end their fourday work slowdown, which has disrupted passenger and freight traffic throughout the country.

title: Lefkowitz Acts to Shut Building On 58th St. Linked to Crimes
description: In an exceptional case of law enforcement cooperation, the State Attorney General began court action yesterday to close a West 58th Street apartment building that the New York City Police Department said it had been unable to move against despite the presence there of prostitutes, narcotics peddlers and other despicable characters.

title: N.B.G. Grants Free TV Time To Reply to Schirra's Plea
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (UPI)The National Broadcasting Company has agreed to provide free television time for rebuttals to the railroads commercials that feature Walter M. Schirra Jr., the former astronaut, backing a bill to subsidize railroads, Senator Fred. R. Harris, Democrat of Oklahoma, said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rail TonMileage Gains
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 The Association of American Railroads reported freight traf?? United States railroads in the week ended April 15 totaled an estimated 15 billion tonmiles, 0.7 per cent above the corresponding week last year.

title: ERIE OPPOSED TO KLEINDIENST
description: PHILADELPHIA,. April 20Senator Edmund S. Muskie, in a stinging attack on special privilege for big business, called on President Nixon today to withdraw the nomination of Richard G. Kleindienst for Attorney General.

title: Audit Reaction Asked
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that its board of governors would ask the exchange membership, the Securities and Exchange Commission, the accounting profession and other interested parties to comment on a series of proposed changes in auditing and accounting for brokerage firms.

title: A Bullish Indicator
description: Short interest on the New York Stock Exchange, a widely watched technical indicator of stockmarket trends, rose sharply in the latest monthly reporting period to the highest level in more than a year.

title: BESIEGED ANLOC IS SAID TO REPEL ANOTHER ASSAULT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, April 21North Vietnamese tanks attacked the besieged town of Anloc again yesterday after a heavy artillery barrage, but they were beaten back with the loss of six of the heavy Sovietmade tanks, allied military commanders here said.

title: Nixon Goes to Camp David
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) President Nixon flew to Camp David in Maryland's Catoctin Mountains tonight for a long weekend of private talks with key advisers. Awaiting Mr. Nixon's arrival at the President's retreat near Thurmont, Md., were Dr. Henry A. Kissinger, assistant for national security affairs; John D. Ehrlichman, principal domestic policy aide, and H. R. Haldeman, chief of the White House staff. The President is expected to return to the White House Sunday.

title: 3 HISTORIANS FETED FOR BOOKS IN 1971
description: Three historians, Carl N. Degler, Robert Middlekauff and Samuel Eliot Morison, were awarded the 1972 Bancroft Prizes last night for books of exceptional merit and distinction in American history, American diplomacy and the international relations of the United States published in 1971.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 21, 1972

title: Analysis of Cells of Fetus Settles a Paternity Dispute
description: By analyzing the cells of an unborn child early in pregnancy, Swedish doctors settled a paternity dispute and established the husband as the child's probable father. The analysis spared the couple an abortion and a divorce because they had applied for both unless it could be shown likely that the husband was the father of the fetus, the doctors said.

title: Patrolman, 31, Shot In Harlem Mosque, Dies of His Wounds
description: Patrolman Philip W. Cardillo, who was shot twice in the chest last Friday in a Black Muslim mosque in Harlem, died last night at St. Luke's Hospital.

title: Beirut Police Fight Students
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 20 (UPI)  Some 1,000 students, protesting poor educational facilities, tried to storm the Ministry of Education building here today but were beaten back by security forces, who fired over the students heads and used tear gas. Eight policemen were wounded and 20 students were arrested.

title: MESKILL STARTS ANTISPILL DRIVE
description: HARTFORD, April 20  A comprehensive program to protect Long Island Sound and Connecticut's coastline from oil spills was announced today by Gov. Thomas J. Meskill.

title: 2 Candidates Are Vying to Inherit Powell's Mantle
description: Who is Adam Clayton Powell's political heir?

title: State Senate Passes Bill On Sex Equality in Schools
description: ALBANY, April 20  The Senate approved today a bill to promote sex equality in public schools, including the increased mixing of girls and young men in sports.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: FARGO, N.D., April 20Senator George McGovern has made a strong showing in precinct caucuses in North Dakota. The caucuses were held primarily in the larger cities Monday night. Almost all the precincts in the smaller towns and rural areas will meet in May.

title: Under the Colonels
description: TORONTOThere is an extremist group in Greece. It has captured arms purchased by the Greeks and functions through violence and terror. It is a small group and has no support from the population so it cannot be called a movement. It kidnaps victims from their homes, incarcerates them in Athens, and brutalizes through torture. This gang has received recognition by all Western governments and is supported and given weapons by the United States. It calls itself a revolution, but even the governments that support it refer to it as the junta, or the Papadopoulos dictatorship.

title: Market Place: How Not to Buy A Mutual Fund
description: We talked to Martin Hale yesterday, the portfolio manager of the aggressive Voyager Fund of Boston, a Putnam Management company vehicle.

title: Letter by Lincoln's Widow Sold for $6,000 at Auction
description: A bitter letter by Mary Todd Lincoln written in March of 186611 months after the assassination of her husband, Abraham Lincolnwas auctioned last night for $6,000, record price for a letter by First Lady.

title: U.S. Welfare Aid to Addicts in Doubt
description: WASHINGTON, April 20Senator Russell B. Long said today that the Senate Finance Committee appeared to have reached a consensus to cut off welfare payments to drug addicts and alcoholics.

title: Lead and Cadmium Levels Bring Dinnerware's Recall
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration announced today the nationwide recal of nearly 13,000 dozen pieces of imported dinnerware that it said contained dangerous amounts of lead and cadmium.

title: BRYDGES TO PRESS SCHOOLAID BILLS
description: ALBANY, April 20  Senate Majority Leader Earl W. Brydges said today that he would press for quick legislative action next week on a package of bills he proposed today to avert fiscal catastrophe in the state's nonpublic schools.

title: Rangers Triumph, 32, For 30 Lead in Series
description: While Walt Tkaczuk was manhandling the Chicago Black Hawks three of his lesserknown teammates took care of the scoring last night as the Rangers gained a commanding 30 lead in their Stanley Cup series with a 3.2 victory at Madison Square Garden.

title: Town of Hoaian Fell to Enemy Even Before It Was Attacked
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, April 20Hoaian, a district capital, was yielded to North Vietnamese forces yesterday before they had even attacked it, a witness to the operation disclosed today, and the defending troops fled in disorder.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TWO ROOKIES LEAD IN FLORIDA GOLF
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 20 (AP)Two rookies, Leonard Thompson and John Mahaffey, shot sixunderpar 66's today to share the firstround lead in the $75,000 Tallahassee, open.

title: Bears Passer Gets 15 Days
description: CHICAGO, April 21 (UP) Dick Gordon, passcatching flanker for the Chicago Bears was sentenced today to 15 days in jail and fined $5,000 after pleading guilty to failing to file an income tax return for 1969. Federal Judge Richard W. Mc laren placed Gordon, 28, years old, on five years probation after the jail sentence.

title: Rep. Widnall to Run Again
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (UPI) Representative William B. Widnall of New Jersey, ranking Republican on the House Bank ing and Currency Committee, announced today his candidacy for reelection to a 13th term. Mr. Widnall, 66 years old, rep resents western Bergen County, in northern New Jersey.

title: Airline's Deficit Hits $30.9Million as Expenses Rise
description: Pan American World Air ways, Inc., lost $30,914,000 in the first quarter this year, com pared with a $23,876,000 defi cit in the initial three months last year, the preliminary un audited report disclosed yester day.

title: New Chemical Plant Set
description: Air Products and Chemicals, Inc., said yesterday that its polymer chemicals division would invest more than $10 million for a major new plant for the production of its Air flex line of vinylethylene pres sure emulsions. The plant is to be built in New Jersey at a yettobedetermined site.

title: Philharmonic, Led By Maazel, Plays Carter's Variations
description: Listening to certain modern music is like observing the traffic in a heavily populated fishbowl. There is a great deal of action and while some of it is interesting enough, one is hard put to make out mean ingful patterns. Elliott Carter's 17yearold Variations for Or chestra, which made an appear ance on a New York Phil harmonic program Thursday night, is certainly not of the fishbowl variety.

title: Irving J. Reuter, 87, Dies; A Retired G.M. Executive
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C., April 21 (AP)Irving J. Reuter, a retired vice president of the General Motors Corporation, died today. He was 87 years old.

title: DOROTHY HARTMAN, LAWYER IN ALBANY
description: Mrs. Dorothy Silberman Hart man, widow of Jesse Hartman, a realestate executive, died yesterday of cancer at her home, 912 Fifth Avenue. She was 72 years old.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX LITTLE CHANGED
description: The American Stock Ex change index went nowhere, yesterday, probably because of some good news and bad offset ting each other. The index closed at 28.30, the same as the previous day.

title: Union Sickness
description: The oneday sick strike that disrupted patient care at some municipal hospitals this week represented an unconscionable spillover at the expense of the genuinely sick of a longfestering interunion feud  one that threatens escalating turmoil in both the municipal and voluntary hospitals in the next two months.

title: Theater: Arrabal's Handcuffs Shouts With Anger and Anguish
description: The Spanish playwright Ar rabal has said that he would like his play And They Put Handcuffs on the Flowers to be thought of as a shout. This is what it isa shout of anger, a shout of anguish, shout of frantic wonder ment at the continuance of fascist tyranny in his home land.

title: Brown of Rockets Named Coach of A.B.A. Cougars
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., April 21 (AP)The Carolina Cougars of the American Basketball Association today named Larry Brown, backcourt star of the Denver Rockets, as their head coach.

title: FOOD TALK
description: Faced with the prospect of a big rent increase on the premises it had occupied for 27 years, Balducci's produce market decided to move catercorner across the street 424 Avenue of the Americas (between 9th and 10th Streets), quadruple its space and expand into a fullrange specialty grocery store.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Science Aide Quits
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP) Louis Levin has resigned as assistant to the director of the National Science Foundation, the White House said yesterday. Mr. Levin was appointed to the post by President Nixon in June, 1970. In his letter to Mr. Nixon, he said the foundation's insti tutional program that he headed had been substantially phased out and that he thought it was proper he resign.

title: TAXI DRIVER IS SLAIN BY ULSTER GUNMAN
description: BELFAST. Northern Ireland. April 21 (UPI)  Roving bands of gunmen killed a taxi driver and wounded three British sol diers and two teenagers today.

title: Miss Palmer Leads by I
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., April 21 (AP)Sandra Palmer, a former cheerleader and homecoming queen at North Texas State University, shot a fourunder par 68 today to take a one stroke lead in the $30,000 Ladies Professional Golf Asso ciation Birmingham Centennial classic.

title: The Opera:
description: Almost 25 years have passed since Virgil Thomson's last opera. But for the last few years he has been work ing on a new one, and Lord Byron finally had its pre miere, Thursday night at the Juilliard Theater.

title: March Increase in Prices Lowest Since the Freeze
description: WASINGTON, April 21  ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? March than in any month since ?? end of the ?? ?? ?? ?? the Labor ?? meet reported today.

title: Rep. Gallagher Pleads Not Guilty in Jersey
description: NEWARK, April 21 (AP) Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher pleaded not guilty today to Federal charges of perjury, conspiracy and in cometax evasion, and was freed on $25,000 personal recognizance bond.

title: Area of Suburbs Grew by a Third In Decade but Density Dropped
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 The land eaten up by sprawling American suburbs increased by onethird during the nineteen sixties, according to a new Cen sus Bureau report.

title: Eurobond Dealers Discuss Facilities On Clearing Issues
description: GENEVA, April 21  Ma neuvering between the Euro bond market's two clearing systems today marked the third annual meeting of the Associa tion of International Bond Deal ers.

title: B52'S BOMB AREA TO SOUTH OF HANOI; PHANTOM IS LOST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, April 22United States B52 bombers and Air Force and Navy fighterbombers struck yesterday at targets in North Vietnam around Thanhhoa, about 80 miles south of Hanoi, the United States command an nounced.

title: Notes On Metropolitan Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 An effort by some New York City Representatives to get the Federal Government to give a square block of Man hattan to the city for hous ing failed disastrously this week on the House floor.

title: Martin Backs S.E.C. Plan On Brokers Own Trades
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 William McChesney Martin, for mer chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, lent his support today to the plan of the Secu rities and Exchange Commis sion to impose stricter rules on stockbrokers purchases and sales of stock for their own in vestment.

title: Merger News
description: Columbia Cable Systems, Inc., announced yesterday it had ter minated its planned merger into Viacom International, Inc., because of the antitrust action brought by the Department of Justice against Viacom and the three major television networks.

title: EXCHANGE SUSPENDS EXBRANCH MANAGER
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that it had imposed a fiveyear sugpension against Stephen E. Rose of Dallas, forbidding his employment with any member firm in any supervisory posi tion.

title: FRANK B. GARTENBERG
description: STAMFORD, Conn., April 21 Frank B. Gartenberg, general manager of the City News Printing Corporation of New York, died today of a heart ailment in Stamford Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 92 Den Road.

title: F.P.C. Report Optimistic On Electricity in Summer
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (UPI)Some areas of the Unit ed States may fall short of electricity in emergencies this summer, but as a whole the nation's utilities are better able to meet peak demand than they were a year ago, the Federal Power Commission said today.

title: Methodists Back Theological Pluralism
description: ATLANTA, April 21  The General Conference of the United Methodist Church adopt ed today what were described as landmark doctrinal guide lines, designed to help people understand their religion in, contemporary society.

title: Port Notes
description: American Export Indus tries, after almost two and a half years of delay, hopes to have its new container ship terminal at Howland Hook in operation around the first of next month.

title: The Talk of Bratsk
description: BRATSK. U.S.S.R.  More than any other city, Bratsk rep resents the Soviet blueprint for the new Siberiaa huge hydro electric project feeding a clus ter of new industries, a brand new city hacked out of the pine forests of the Taiga by sheer enthusiasm and will pow er in a region that lies 750 miles farther north, than Montreal. The era of muscular enthusiasm is over for Bratsk. Now 18 years old, the city of 165,000 has enterer the sec and generation of development, more complex and less glamor ous than the raw days of youth.

title: Chile Leads Brazil, 20
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 21 (UPI)Jaime Pinto Bravo de feated Tomaz Koch of Brazil, 75, 61, 60, today, gaining a 20 lead for Chile in Davis Cup Zone competition.

title: 121 Bombings or Attempts Listed by F.B.I. for March
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation reported today that 121, actual or attempted bombing incidents occurred in March, bringing the yearly to tal to 423 throughout the na tion and Puerto Rico.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WINSTON  SALEM, N. C., April 21 (AP)Neil Johnston, a former Wake Forest assistant basketball coach, has been named assistant coach of the Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Associa tion.

title: Sports of The Times
description: On the scoreboard, the seconds of the final minute were flashing. Behind the New York Rangers bench, Emile Francis, his fists clenched, his small face contorted with tension, was harking, Bruce, Bruce, get hack, at Bruce MacGregor, a right wing who was responsible for staying with Bobby Hull, whose goals for the Chicago Black Hawks had eliminated the Rangers from the Stanley Cup playoffs a year ago. And on the milkwhite ice of Madison Square Garden was the beauty of the gamethe hockeyplayers whirling like so many eagles on skates, the sleeves of their uniform sweaters flapping in their own breeze, the perspira tion glistening on their scarred faces. But moments later, the Black Hawks were swooping toward Gilles Villemure, the Ranger goaltender. With only two seconds remaining, there would be a faceoff to the left of the goal. Bobby Hull glided in small circles, prompting the memory of how his two goals on direct passes from the faceoff had won two playoff games a year ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 500 at Fordham Protest Against the War
description: The rhetoric was late nine teen sixties at Fordham Univer sity yesterday. So was the long hair and the studiously scruffy garb. But the old radical spirit. many students agreed, was gone.

title: PRICE INDEX HERE UP 0.4% IN MONTH
description: Primarily because of higher prices for clothing, food and home furnishings, the Con sumer Price Index for the New York metropolitan area rose fourtenths of 1 per cent in March the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: Down in the Dumps
description: ST. PAUL, Minn.We are rapidly approaching the point where our cities are running out of dump space. New York, for example, will have exhausted its dumps by 1975, it is estimated.

title: Muskie Repeats Views
description: GREENSBURG, Pa., April 21 Senator Muskie said here to day that his criticism of the American bombing campaign over North Vietnam was based on President Nixon's assess ment that the South Vietnamese were capable of defending themselves in the war in South east Asia.

title: HealthFood Plant Here Is Fined as Unsanitary
description: The Good Shepherd Cereal Company, a manufacturer of health foods, paid 5400 in penal ties last month for having an allegedly unsanitary plant, the state's Department of Agricul ture and Market's said yesterday But Good Shepherd's president, Rod Swenson, said in an inter view that his company was be ing harassed by inspectors who don't appreciate what we're trying to do and who inspect for things that dont protect the consumer.

title: MISSING REPORTER WINS AWARD HERE
description: Nicholas W. Stroh, a 33year old foreign correspondent for The Washington Post who dis appeared while on assignment in Uganda during 1971 and is presumed dead, was awarded the Overseas Press Club of America's annual George Polk Memorial Award yesterday for reporting requiring exception al courage arid enterprise.

title: Air Drops of Pesticide
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (UPI)The Agriculture Depart ment said today that it was using air drops of bait treated with a pesticide to control the fire ant in the South on twice the acreage treated last year. Officials said they planned to treat about 7.1 million acres this Spring and about 7 to 8 million additional acres this Fall.

title: W. R. Grace Earnings Showed a Gain in First Quarter
HEATH AND BRANDT REACH AGREEMENT
description: LONDON, April 21  Prime Minister Heath and Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany ended talks today after reach ing general agreement on many issues facing an enlarged Euro pean community.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SAN DIEGO April 21Local party leaders talked angrily to day about a doublecross, but the prospect of losing this summer's Republican conven tion produced very little gloom and considerable rejoicing among San Diego's 718,000 cit izens.

title: BOYS HIGH SNAPS 2 RELAYS MARKS
description: Boys High opened the two day QueensIona Relay Carni val yesterday at Downing Sta dium with two outstanding meetrecord performances and an individual stint by Bill Dab ney that thrilled the sparse crowd on hand for the school boy program.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: WASHINGTON  The beauty of spring in Washington is even more intense than remembered. The sudden heat, the blossoms, the parks set out with flowers, the acres of marble and granite gleaming in the sun: It all suggests, as it was intended to, the freshness and promise of a new country.

title: Fans Given Reminder Of Friday Night Fights
description: The merry month of May will get off to a good start for boxing fans

title: Yugoslav Smallpox Ending
description: ROME, April 21 (AP)Yugo slavia's first smallpox outbreak in 42 years appears to have ended after 173 reported cases and 34 deaths, the World Health Organization said today. Only one new case was reported during the week of April 9 to 15, indicating the outbreak is now under complete control, the organization said.

title: Trade of Forest Land for Montana Resort Approved
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 One of the last obstacles to the completion of Chet Huntley's 820million Big Sky ski and golf resort in Montana was removed today when the Under Secretary of Agricul ture, J. Phil Campbell, ap proved two exchanges of land by the United States Forest Service and the Burlington Northern Railway.

title: Four Canadian Loans Set
description: TORONTO, April 21 (AP) The Ontario government to day announced four loans total ing $855,300 to Canadian pub lishers to protect the industry from foreign domination.

title: Panel Rejects Plea Allegations By Tombs Inmates in '70 Riots
description: A special committee of law yers yesterday rejected one of the major allegations made by inmates during the 1970 Tombs riotsthat Legal Aid Society lawyers tried to talk defend. ants into pleading guilty with out bothering to determine if they were in face guilty.

title: Greek Regime, Grip Firm, Is 5 Years Old
description: ATHENS, April 21Greece's militarybacked Government, stronger than ever, celebrated its fifth anniversary in power today and pointedly omitted the customary pledges of democra cy. At the same time the oppo sition stepped up its activity, culminating in the first illegal student demonstration in Ath ens since the military takeover in 1967.

title: Austria Continues Negotiations On Terms for Free Trade Zone
description: VIENNA  Austria's long struggle to find an accommoda tion with the European Eco nomic Community without en dangering the neutrality that was a precondition for the re moval of Soviet troops from her soil in 1955 is finally draw ing to a close.

title: Attica Panel Told Accord on Amnesty Was a Possibility
description: William M. Kunstier said yes terday that shortly before state troopers assaulted B Yard at the Attica Correctional Facility last September an inmate leader told him that the rebel prison ers were willing to yield on two key points they had previously held as nonnegotiable.

title: Harry Gold, a Heart Specialist And Digitalis Pioneer, Is Dead
description: Dr. Harry Gold, an eminent clinical pharmacologist and heart specialist, who pioneered in developing and standardiz ing modern potent forms of digitalis for heart disease, died yesterday of a stroke at his home, 7 East 82d Street. He was 72 years old.

title: Pompidou Appeals In RadioTV Talk For Yes on Market
description: PARIS, April 21President Pompidou made a last appeal tonight for support Sunday for his European policy as reports told of widespread indifference.

title: Iran Ousts Israel
description: TEL AVIV, April 21  Iran defeated Israel today in their elimination match in the Davis Cup zone competition, thus advertising an ArabIsraeli con frontation in the next round.

title: U.S. and Soviet Reach an Accord to Improve Shipping
description: MOSCOW, April 21Dele gations of the Soviet Union and the United States an nounced today that they had reached an understanding on improving maritime shipping links between the two coun tries.

title: Shark Bite on Arm
description: BRISBANE, Australia, April 22 (UPI)  Guests on Hayman Island, a tiny, coralfringed holiday island 30 miles off Queensland, watched in disbe lief as today as the 35foot row boat of John Fairfax and Sylvia Cook washed across the Hay man reef into the safety of the lagoon.

title: Rockefeller Appoints Lawyer
description: ALBANY, April 21Governor Rockefeller today appointed Melvin H. Osterman Jr., a New York City lawyer, as the state's director of the Office of Em ploye Relations, effective May 15. Mr. Osterman, 37 years old, will succeed Abe Lavine in the $42,475ayear post. Mr. Lavine will become Commissioner of the Department of Social Serv ices on May 1.

title: DRUG MAY REDUCE METHADONE ABUSE
description: WASHINGTON, April 21Rep resentatives of leading Ameri can drug manufacturers said today that they may soon be able to prevent certain abuses of methadone by addicts by adding tiny quantities of a narcotic antagonist called nal oxone to the prescribed drugs.

title: Relief on Recovery Ship
description: Aboard U.S.S. Ticonderoga, in the Pacific, April 21 (UPI) The 1,631member crew aboard this primary Apollo 16 recov ery ship received the news of lunar landing with sighs of re lief. It meant they would have time to go through with three more simulated recovery exer cises before the scheduled splashdown next Thursday 1,000 miles south of Pearl Harbor.

title: 3 TIED FOR LEAD IN GOLF WITH 135
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 21 (AP)  Larry Hinson, Jimmy Colbert and Allen Miller led the field today in the $75,000 Tallahassee golf tournament with nineunderpar 135's mid way through the 72hole event.

title: The Opera:
description: Alvin Ailey was given a tough assignment as chore ographer for Virgil Thom son's new opera, Lord By ron. Scene Two of the third act consists entirely of a ballet. This is very different from your usual opera di vertissement or slavegirl number.

title: No Derry Whitewash
description: The Lord Chief Justice of England has absolved the British Army of primary blame for Londonderry's Bloody Sunday, but his exhaustive report is far from total exculpation. Lord Widgery questions the wisdom of sending in paratroops to arrest demonstrators before the fatal shootings and adds: It may well be that if the army had maintained its lowkey attitude the rest of the day would have passed off without further serious incident.

title: Ryan Retires From P.S.C. After 40 Years With Unit
description: ALBANY, April 21Deputy Chairman John T. Ryan Sr. of the Public Service Commission has retired after more than 40 years with the commission, the P.S.C. announced today.

title: REDEMPTIONS UP FOR MUTUAL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP)  Redemptions of mu tual funds exceeded sales by $193.7million in March, the sharpest dollar difference since last September, the Investment Company Institute reported to day.

title: Candidates Day
description: CLEVELAND, April 21 (UPI) Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, campaigning here for the Ohio Democratic Pres idential primary on May 2, ac cused Senator George McGov ern today of grandstanding on the issue of campaign fi nances.

title: Eban, in U.S., Explains Rumanian Role
