description: WASHINGTON, April 21 Foreign Minister Alba Eban of Israel said today that Rumania had advised his country that she intended to use her posi tion of mutual confidence in Cairo and Jerusalem to clarify the positions of the two Gov ernments to each other.

title: Astronauts Strength Was Like That of Six
description: HOUSTON, April 21 (UPI)  Lieut. Col. Charles M. Duke Jr. found today that he had the strength of six men when he inadvertently picked up the 457pound lunar rover while pulling on a cable at tached to it.

title: March Jobless Rate Drops in City and the State
description: Unemployment in the city and the state as a whole dropped last month, according to figures reported yesterday by Louis L. Levine, the state's Industrial Commissioner.

title: Agnew Assails 5 Democratic Senators
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 Vice President Agnew today ac cused five Democratic Senators including three Presidential candidates, of staking their credibility and some of them their political future on the failure of Nixon Administration policies in Vietnam.

title: Supreme Court Suspends New Mexico Filing Law
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP)The Supreme Court granted today a temporary reprieve to candidates in New Mexico who have not paid their election filng fee.

title: Anloc Relief Force Abandons Effort To Lift the Siege
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, April 22  A 10,000 man South Vietnamese relief force has given up efforts to break through to the be leaguered garrison of Anloc and now has the mission of de fending its own flanks, military officers disclosed yesterday.

title: Raid Warnings in Hanoi
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, April 21 (Agence FrancePresse) Several times in the last 24 hours the prealert signal has sounded here, warning the pop ulace to remain near airraid shelters.

title: Policeman Shot in Mosque To Get Inspector's Funeral
description: Patrolman Philip W. Cardillo, 31 years old, who was shot twice April 14 in a Black Mus lim mosque in Harlem and died in St. Luke's Hospital Thursday night, will be given an inspec tor's funeral, police headquar ters announced yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE PASSIONATE PAST OF GLORIA GAYE. By Bernard Kops. 192 pages. Norton. $6.95.

title: The Target Area: In Brief
description: Thanhhoa, in the target area struck yesterday by American bombers, is situated in the Ma River delta about seven miles from the coast of the Gulf of Tonkin and has a population of about 60,000.

title: FREDERICK V. HUNT OF HARVARD DEAD
description: BUFFALO, April 21  Fred erick V. Hunt, retired Gordon McKay Professor of Applied Physics and Rumford Professor of Physics at Harvard Univer sity, died of a heart attack today while attending a meeting of the Acoustical Society of America. He was 67 years old.

title: Rosewall Beats Riessen
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C. April 21 (AP)Ken Rosewall of Aus tralia took only 47 minutes to defeat Marty Riessen of Evan ston. Ill., today, 62, 60, for a semifinal berth in the $50,000 North Carolina National Bank tennis classic.

title: Market Place: Cutting a Coat After the Cloth
description: You'll remember that a while back we talked to a broker who said, Don't call us, we'll call you.

title: Six Saigon Publications Seized by Government
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, April 22Five Sai gon newspapers and a weekly magazine were seized yester day, the Government an nounced today.

title: Labs Study the Whys of Drug Dependence
description: In rows of steel cages in a pharmacology laboratory at the University of Michigan live 48 rhesus monkeys that are dependent on a variety of habitforming drugs, from caffeine to heroin and co caine.

title: Roundup: Rangers Down Angels in Texas Debut
description: Texas is the best, Bob Short is the best and Texas deserves the best. So spoke Tom Vandergrieff; the Mayor of Arlington, Tex., before the Texas Rangers (formerly the Washington Senators) opened their new $7.3mil lion stadium with the $650, 000 scoreboard last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Downtown: Vicente's Art
description: Although the are of Este ban Vicente is usually asso ciated with American ab stract expressionism, its con nection with that style is tenuous. His oils and collages are very personal statements marked by a seductively in timate lyricism that one rarely finds in abstract ex pressionist canvases. If any thing, his art bears a stronger kinship with the esthetics of the School of Paris in its refinement, sub tlely and elegance and in its extraordinary control of composition and splendid harmony of color.

title: Candidates Day
description: NEW EAGLE, Pa., April 21 Senator Edmund S. Muskie took his Presidential candidacy down a hole here today 315 feet underground in the Mathies Mine southeast of Pittsburghto dramatize his accusation that the Nixon Ad ministration was callous about coal mine safety.

title: TOOL AUCTION SALE YIELDS $3MILLION
description: A fiveday auction sale of the machine tools used by the bankrupt R. Hoe & Co. to pro duce printing presses concluded yesterday, and it brought in about $3million, according to a spokesman for the auction eers, Max Rouse & Sons, Bev erly Hills, Calif.

title: Bridge: Declarer's Attention to Bids By Defenders Often Pays Off
description: A declarer who pays atten tion to the bidding, or even to the lack of bidding, will often know the strength of one of the defenders hands within certain limits. This knowledge may enable him to make a winning decision at a crucial moment in the play, and did so on the dia gramed deal. It was played Sunday in the final of the Central American Team Championships between Ja maica and Panama.

title: Pupils Here Delighted by Chinese Team
description: The Chinese table tennis team paid a surprise visit to Public School 75 on the West Side yes terday morning, delighting the pupils and being delighted by them.definitely until Thursday night that the Chinese were coming. At 11:30 P.M. Luis Mercado, the principal, and Mrs. Doris Rosenblihn, a parent, went to a nearby tabletennis parlor to borrow a table.

title: Contrpact Is Awarded
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 21 (UPI)The Ground Data Corporation has obtained a $212,000 contract from Rowe International, Inc., to make 1,200 sets of electronic assem blies for an unidentified pro prietary product.

title: Beirut and Arafat Reported In Pact on U.N.'s Observers
description: BEIRUT Lebanon, April 21  Palestinian guerrillas have promised not to interefere with United Nations observers who will be stationed along Lebanon's armistice lines with Israel.

title: BOLDING BREAKS MARK IN HURDLES
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., April 21 (UPI)  Jim Bolding of Okla homa State captured the 440 yard hurdles today at the Kan sas Relays in 50.4 seconds for a meet record.

title: Foe Attacks in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, April 21 (UPI)Communist forces, launched a ground attack today on Government positions north of the besieged provincial capi tal of Svayrieng.

title: C.P.C. International Expects 25% Gain In Its '72 Earnings
description: DALLAS, April 21C.P.C. In ternational, Inc., expects 1972 to be a turnaround year with earnings reaching record levels, stockholders of the multina tional food company were told at the company's annual meet ing here today.

title: More Student Aid Urged
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP) Senator Clifford P. Case, Republican of New Jersey, and Senator Ernest F. Hollings, Democrat of South Carolina, proposed today making avail able $294.6million more to provide financial help for stu dents planning to attend college in the autumn. They proposed amendments to an appropria tions bill providing an extra $130.2million for educational opportunity grants, $75.4mil lion for college workstudy grants and $89million for the National Defense Student Loan program.

title: JUDGE EUGENE HUDSON
description: WEST HARWICH, Mass., April 21 (AP)Superior Court Judge Eugene A. Hudson died Thursday at his home here. He was 70 years old.

title: Wisconsin's Governor Endorses McGovern
description: MADISON, Wis., April 21 Gov. Patrick J. Lucey, who remained neutral in Wis consin's recent Presidential primary, today announced his endorsement of Senator George McGovern and said he would go to Massachu setts this weekend to cam paign for him.

title: Ugandan Expulsion Is a Setback for Israel
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, April 15for Israel, Africa is a ma jor diplomatic battleground. Premier Golda Meir has said that since Israel could not be friends with her Arab neigh bors, she would try to be friends with our neighbors neighbors.

title: Revisions in Highlights Of Apollo 16 Flight Plan
description: Following are some high lights of the revised Apollo 16 schedule and flight plan The mission is to end one day earlier than originally planned. The times are East ern standard.

title: Loss of Appetite
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (UPI)A spokesman for the mutualfund industry said to day that the latest figures on fund redemptions and sales re flected an incredible loss of appetite for funds by the in vesting public.

title: Public Penance?
description: Spiro T. Agnew has again overreached himself in his eagerness to defame The Times, a favorite target of his ever since we stated in the 1968 campaign that he was unfit to be Vice President of the United Statesan opinion we have never had reason to revise. In his ag gressive defense of President Nixon's Vietnam policy before the American Society of Newspaper Editors yes terday, the Vice President could not refrain from making the kind of slyly misleading statement about The Times that, behind his characteristic facade of frank and brutal honesty, totally distorts the truth.

title: Majority Of Week's New Issues Show Gains of Varying Levels
description: A mixed assortment of new issues came out during the week ended yesterday. Brokers specializing in such issues re ported a slackening in the pace and volume of trading from the previous week.

title: PENTAGON GRANT REBUFFED IN OHIO
description: CINCINNATI, April 21 Warren D. Bennis, president of the University of Cincinnati, a nounced today that the institu tion would not accept a new financial grant from the Depart ment of Defense for a research project in wholebody radiation of advanced cancer patients.

title: JORGE MISTRAL
description: MEXICO CITY, April 21 (AP) Jorge Mistral, a Spanish film and television actor, died yes terday of what the police said was a selfinflicted gunshot wound. He was 49 years old.

title: SEC. MAY STUDY NEWISSUE CLIMB
description: The hot newissue boom cur rently under way in the stock market may force the Securi ties and Exchange Commission to take speedy action to pro tect investors against trading abuses, according to William J. Casey, the S.E.C.'s chair man.

title: Mitchell Gains 4Shot Edge With 65 for 136 on Coast
description: RANCHO LA COSTA, Calif., April 21Bobby Mitchell, a 29 yearold golf professional from Danville, Va., took a surprising fourstroke lead today after 36 holes in the Tournament of Champions and described him self as the game's Invisible Man.

title: 170 Years of Fashion, Set to Music and Slides
description: Strauss waltzes and Beatles rock. The burning of Richmond and the storming of Iwo Jima. A factory mak ing hoop skirts and a suf fragette being carried off to jail.

title: Times Reporter Pleads Not Guilty in California
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., April 21 (AP)Earl Caldwell, a reporter for The New York Times, pleaded not guilty today to a reduced charge of misdemeanor possession of marijuana.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, April 21The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended April 18;

title: JAMES V. SULLIVAN
description: BALTIMORE, April 21James V. Sullivan, assistant executive secretary for the Maryland Po lice and Correctional Training Commissions, died today after a long illness. He was 62 years old.

title: Notes on People
description: Yesterday was the 46th birthday of Queen Elizabeth II, but aside from gun salutes fired in London, there was no official observance. That'll come in June, when the mon arch's birthday is always of fially celebrated, on the theory the weather is better then.

title: Cut in Savings and Loan Yields Urged
description: Gordon W. McKinley, the im mediate past chairman and a director of the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York, called on savings and loan associa tions yesterday to reduce the interest rates they pay on sav ings accounts.

title: NE WIN TO GOVERN BURMA AS CIVILIAN
description: RANGOON, Burma, April 21 (Reuters)The Burmese leader Gen. Ne Win has quit the army to become Premier of the coun try's first civilian Government for 10 years in a move seen as a prelude to promulgation of a new constitution. An official announcement yesterday said that most of the army members in the Cabinet had also resigned from the armed forces.

title: Two Britons Land in Australia After Rowing Across the Pacific
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Satur day, April 22John Fairfax, a 33yearold Briton, and his 31 yearold companion, Sylvia Cook, landed at Hayman Island off the Queensland coast today, becoming the first persons to row across the Pacific Ocean.

title: Three Arrested by Police In Lower East Side Raid
description: The police arrested three men and confiscated an array of keys, keycutting machines and eavesdropping equipment yes terday morning in a raid on a Lower East Side apartment that had been under surveillance for a month.

title: Antiwar Suit Dismissed
description: BALTIMORE, April 21 (AP) Judge James R. Miller today dis missed a suit in United States District Court here seeking to enjoin the use of Federal taxes to support the war in Vietnam. Judge Miller called the injunc tion, requested by seven Mary land residents, an improper in terference with executive and legislative responsibilities in foreign affairs.

title: CAMPUS PROTESTS ON WAR CONTINUE
description: Although most campuses were quiet, thousands of stu dents and other groups across the nation demonstrated yes terday against the Vietnam war, in some places violently.

title: Miss Newman Wed To R. J. Theryoung
description: EMERSON, N. L. April 21  The marriage of Miss Patricia Katherine Newman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George W. Newman of West wood and Palm Beach, Fla., to Richard Joseph Theryoung took place here this after noon. The ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Assumption was per formed by the Rev. Caesar G. Orrico. Mr. Theryoung, a member of the administration staff at Montclair State Col lege, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Theryoung of Cincinnati.

title: Art:
description: When Irwin Hollander set up shop here in 1964 as a mas ter printer, after training at the famed Tamarind Lithog raphy Workshop in Los An geles, painters and sculptors were not doing much in the way of printmakingexcept for a handful who worked at Tatania Grossman's lively Universal Limited Art Edi tions atelier in West Islip, L.I.

title: Jack Verdict Still Lacking
description: A Federal court jury was sent home for the weekend at 4:15 P.M. yesterday after it failed in seven hours of con tinuous deliberation to reach a verdict in the trial of Assemblyman Huian E. Jack and five other defendants charged with conspiracy and conflict of in terest in violation of the Taft Hartley Act. The jury began deliberations at noon on Thurs day. It is to resume them at 9:30 A.M. Monday.

title: Red Sox Conquer Yanks, 54
description: BOSTON, April 21  Mel Stottlemyre gave up nine hits in 7 innings, and the New York Yankees left 11 men on base tonight as they lost a 54 de cision to the Boston Red Sox before a chilled crowd of 14,895, in Fenway Park.

title: 12 HORSES TO RUN IN $118,400 WOOD
description: An even dozen horses have been named for the Wood Me morial today at Aqueduct. The race is one of the more popular ones on the local spring calen dar, and this renewal promises to be even more attractive than any other in the last decade. The 118mile race for 3year olds will have a gross value of $118,400, the winner earning $71,040.

title: WLLLIAM J. DECHERT, EXPFIZER OFFICIAL
description: OLD LYME, Conn., April 21 William J. Dechert, a retired vice president and a director of Pfizer International, pharma ceutical and chemicals manu facturer, was found dead on Monday at his home here. He was 68 years old.

title: Jersey Patrolman, Sought in Robbery, Commits Suicide
description: CAMDEN, N. J., April 21 (AP) The police said a Camden patrolman shot and killed him self at his home today as two fellow policemen knocked on his front door to arrest him on armedrobbery charges.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City Jail Inmates Rise 18%

title: Suffolk Appoints Task Force To Study Projects for U.S. Aid
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., April 21  Suffolk County Executive John V. N. Klein appointed a task force today to review all potential projects that could be presented to the Federal Gov ernment for financing under the Economic Development Act. The county was designated yes terday as an employment dis aster area under terms of the act.

title: Candidates Day
description: STATESVILLE, N. C., April 21Gov. George C. Wallace kept nearly 600 people waiting an hour and a half in a driz zling rain today. It was his first campaign stop in this state, but none of those who came to hear him seemed to mind the delay.

title: Peace Marches Today Here and on the Coast
description: Today has been proclaimed Peace Action Day by a number of antiwar groups, and demonstrations are ex pected here, in California and in Washington.

title: Profit of Oil Company Dips 5.1% Though Revenues Climb
description: Net income of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), the world's largest petroleum cor poration, fell 5.1 per cent in the first quarter of 1972, the con cern announced yesterday.

title: East Germany Is Easing its Attitude Toward Bonn
description: BLRLIN April 21 East Garmany appears to he relax ing its terms for ?? re lations with West Germany, presumably in response to So viet wishes.

title: New Assault Is Reported By Gay Activist Member
description: A member of the Gay Ac tivists Alliance who said he was assaulted at a political report ers dinner last Saturday re ported that he was beaten again last night by two men who de manded pictures they thought he had taken of the political dinner.

title: Abortion Ruling Opposed
description: HARTFORD, April 21 (UPI) Gov. Thomas J. Meskill and At torney General Robert K. Kil lian announced today that the state would appeal a Federal court ruling Tuesday invalidat ing the state's abortion law. Mr. Killian, a Roman Catholic like Mr. Meskill also cautioned the General Assembly against the adoption of a new abortion statute, saying it might invali date the appeal to the Supreme Court.

title: Appeal Made for Prisoners
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 21Amnesty Interna tional has appealed to the Greek Government to free 336 politi cal prisoners, many of them stu dents serving terms of up to 20 years.

title: Orders of Durable Goods Gained Slightly in March
description: WASHINGTON, April 21  New orders for durable goods in March rose slightly from the high February level, the Com merce Department reported to day.

title: News Analysis
description: One of the difficulties with campus strikes and other dem onstrations is that they tend to focus attention on the be havior of the protesters insteadof the substance of the protest. Be low is a compila tion of the kind of questions that the Administrationand its supporters are posing to their critics, at least rhetori cally, and an effort to distill from Congressional debates and other discussion the responses of those critics.

title: METS BEAT CUBS ON A FOURHITTER BY SEAVER, 2 TO 0
description: Tom Seaver and Burt (No Hit) Hooton pitched as stingily as expected, but it was the un expected as performed by Bud Harrelson that was the differ ence in the Mets 20 victory over the Chicago Cubs yester day at Shea Stadium.

title: Landry Signed by Lions For $400,000 Contract
description: DETROIT, April 21 (UPI) Greg Landry, who gambled by not signing a contract with the Detroit Lions last season, won today when the quarterback signed a three year pact estimated to be worth $400,000.

title: Antiques: Popular TurnofCentury Pyrography
description: Illustrations of the art of pyrography  decorative wooden pieces with linear patterns burnt into the wood are evidence of a turnof thecentury fad that really captures the spirit of the popular art of the time.

title: RCA Alaska Plans Station
description: RCA Alaska Communications, Inc., has filed an application with the Federal Communica tions Commission for permis sion to establish and operate a $1.2million satellite communi cations earth station at Adak, Alaska. The earth station would be part of an overall program to use satellites to provide long distance communications serv ice for the state.

title: McCarthy, ExManager Of Yankees, Tauns 85
description: AMHERST, N.Y., April 21 (AP)Joe McCarthy, former manager of the New York Yankees, quietly observed his 85th birthday today and said that major league baseball players lost face in their recent strike.

title: 7 Americans Die in Rescue of 2 Behind Enemy Lines
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 21 (AP)  An Allied commando team snatched two United States airmen from the middle of a North Vietnamese invasion force, but the opera tion cost the lives of seven other Americans, United States sources disclosed today.

title: 3 Rebuked in G.I. Deaths
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP)  Secretary of the Army Robert F. Froehlke today ad monished or reprimanded a major general and two other veteran officers for sub standard performance of duty in connection with an enemyattack that killed 33 United States soldiers in Vietnam last year. One of the officers lost a promotion to brigadier general.

title: Boy 18, Gets 10Year Term For Bombing a U.N. Mission
description: It's only because of a quirk of fate and a matter of inches you are not standing before me charged with murder, Supreme Court Justice Harold Birns said yesterday as he sentenced a high school student who bombed the Congolese Mission to the United Nations to 10 years in jail.

title: Visitors Change Life Behind Berlin Wall
description: BERLIN, April 19  For many East Germans the world behind the Berlin Wall to which they had become ac customed has suddenly changed this spring, and some of the changes are disturbing their sense of the order of things.

title: Biaggi Meets With Leaders of Bronx Street Gangs
description: A dozen teenaged youths, some of them sporting such re galia of street gangs as brass knuckles, shoes with steel toe caps and insignia proclaiming their affiliation, conferred for several hours yesterday with Representative Mario Biaggi, Bronx DemocratConservative. in an effort to resolve some of their own problems and to tell him that they meant their com munities well.

title: Witness Says She Saw Holder Enter Apartment With Teacher
description: MINEOLA, L. I., April 21 (AP)Howard Holder, a Brook lyn school principal, and Lyn nor Gershenson, one of his teachers, were seen entering his fatherinlaw's apartment together before his wife's mur der, a neighbor testified today.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP) A California filmmaker said today that he had sued Senator Edmund S. Muskie's Presiden tial campaign to get payment for television campaign films. Herbert Decker, president of Medion, Inc., of San Francisco, said suits were filed here and in Philadelphia for $45,000. He said attachments had been served against banks in both cities holding Muskie campaign funds.

title: Man, Berserk, Kills, Two, Wounds 4 in Missouri Town
description: HARRISONVILLE, Mo., April 21 (AP)A young man armed with a carbine went berserk this evening, shot two police men to death, wounded a sher iff and three other persons, then killed himself on the town square, the police said.

title: Badillo Backs McGovern's Candidacy as Best Hope to Aid Slum Dwellers
description: Representative Herman Ba dillo endorsed George McGov ern's candidacy for the Demo cratic Presidential nomination yesterday after taking the South Dakota Senator on a twohour tour through a rubble strewn section in the South Bronx.

title: OTB Opens Drive Against Litterers and Loiterers in Betting Parlors Here
description: Ralph Bozella worked steadily yesterday, ignoring the lunchhour horseplayers, as he swept the floor of the Offtrack Betting Corpora tion's branch office at 888 Seventh Avenue, at 56th Street.

title: Boy, Are Those Suburbs Simple!
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I.One hears a lot these days about city dwellers who move to quaint little villages in Vermont to satisfy their longing for a simpler but happier life. Actually, there's no need to travel that far. Just across the New York City line they can find all the sim plicity they need.

title: SMITH AND KODES REACH SEMIFINALS
description: NICE, France, April 21 (AP) Stan Smith, the United States open champion, reached the semifinals today in the Nice in ternational tennis tournament. He defeated Barry Phillips Moore of Australia, 64, 63, and will meet Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia in the round of four. Kodes defeated Dick Crealy of Australia, 62, 16, 60.

title: Miss Hogan Gains Final
description: LONDON, April 21 (UPI)  Patti Ann Hogan of LaJolla, Calif., recovered from a ragged start today and defeated Ver onica Burton of England, 75, 60, and gained the final at the Radiant tennis tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: An Assassin's Film Guide To Surprising Amsterdam
description: The real star attraction of Geoffrey Reeve's Puppet on a Chain isn't anybody; its a thing, an event, a suicidal outboard motorboat chase through the canals of Am sterdam which has been ex citing comment ever since the film opened last year in Eng land. I first read of it in that excellent British enthusiasts magazine  not Sight and Sound or Films and Filming, but Yachting Monthly.

title: Teachers Robbed at School
description: A knifewielding youth yes terday robbed two teachers at Public School 110 in the Bronx and fled with more than $1,200 in cash and personal effects, in cluding rings and watches, the police said. The youth, about 19 years old, forced the teachers, both women, to disrobe par tially while he robbed them in a thirdfloor teachers lounge during the lunch break, accord ing to the police.

title: Bhutto Ends Martial Law in Pakistan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, April 21Martial law was lift ed in Pakistan today and Zulfi kar All Bhutto was sworn in as President under an interim Constitution approved four days ago by the National Assembly.

title: Ankhe, Now a Highlands Ghost. Town, Remains an Important Battlefield
description: ANKHE, South Vietnam, April 21With the Ameri cans nearly all gone and the Communists confidently mov ing their forces ever closer, Vietnamization is turning Ankhe into a ghost town.

title: Brydges, in Shift, Opposes Runoff Bill
description: ALBANY, April 21  Senate Majority Leader Earl W. Bryd ges, apparently reneging on a promise he was said to have made to Democratic leaders in the Legislature, moved today to kill a bill that would set up a twocandidate runoff election in New York City primaries for citywide office.

title: New Ole Miss
description: James H. Meredith, whose name some youthful civil rights enthusiasts will not even recognize, was a guest lecturer this week at the University of Mississippi. Mr. Meredith's enrollment as the first black at that institution caused rioting and bloodshed only ten years ago. Now it is scarcely a news item that he is invited to speak at Ole Miss, that his subject is Mississippi history and that he could keep the engagement only by taking time out of his campaign for the Republican nomination to replace James Eastland in the United States Senate.

title: SUPERFECTA PAYS $111,912 AT TROTS
description: YONKERS, April 21A rec ord Superfecta payoff of $111, 912 came as a result of Aka Eden's onelength victory to night in the ninth race at Yonkers Raceway before 19, 859 fans.

title: Mrs. Dalton Triumphs
description: Tucson, Ariz., April 21 (UPI) Mrs. Judy Dalton of Australia moved into the semifinal today with a 64, 63 victory over Valerie Ziegenfuss of San Diego, in the $18,000 Virginia Slims women's professional ten nis tournament.

title: Wright Weighs a Race Against Rooney
description: Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright said yesterday that he was seriously considering seek ing the Democratic Congres sional nomination in Brooklyn's 14th District.

title: Japanese Auto Concern Is Optimistic on Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, April 21(AP) A Japanese auto manufac turer voiced optimistism today that it could meet United States antipollution standards in 1975.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: PITTSBURGH, April 21To the puzzling decline in Senator Edmund S. Muskie's Presi dential hopes may now be added another mystery: What, if anything, has happened to John F. English?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Candidates Day
description: SCRANTON, Pa., April 21 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey said today that he would refuse to withdraw American troops from Western Europe unless the Soviet Union agreed to re move some of its men from Eastern Europe.

title: Top U.M.W. Officials Give Boyle a Vote of Confidence
description: PITTSBURGH, April 21 (UPI)The executive board of the United Mine Workers Dis trict 5 has given a unanimous vote of confidence to the union's president, W. A. Boyle. However, a dissident miners group has asked the Justice Department for Boyle's re moval from office.

title: Orion on the Moon
description: For the fifth time in all history men are working on the moon this weekend. The superb television pictures sent back by the crew of Orion, astronauts Young and Duke, were sharper and clearer than any previous tele vised views of the lunar surface. And the austere, crater pocked, rockstrewn landscape of the Descartes area seen yesterday was also different in quality from the earlier vistas of other lunar regions visited by Orion's predecessors.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 Three native New Yorkers who met in 1960 while at tending Harvard University were awarded a patent this week for a handheld instrument enabling surgeons to fas ten sutures with ultrasonic vibra tion. In suturing, the edges of a wound are joined with thread or other fibers, which are usually tied in square knots. The vibration produced by the instrument described in Patent 3,657,056 can bond thread ends together or solid ify a knot.

title: Conversations Between Houston and Men on the Moon
description: Following are excerpts from a transcript of announce ments from Mission Control in Houston and conversations between Mission Control and Capt. John W. Young and Lieut. Col. Charles M. Duke Jr. on the moon.

title: Senate Approves a Bill Barring StudentActivity Fee at State U.
description: ALBANY, April 21After more than two hours of debate today, the Senate narrowly ap proved a measure to prohibit mandatory studentactivity fees at the 32 campuses of the State University.

title: CONFIDENCE RISE BY BUSINESS SEEN
description: A substantial improvement in business confidence has oc curred in recent weeks, Alfred Hayes, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, said yesterday.

title: Hell of a Price to Pay
description: MANILA, April 21 (AP)It was a hell of a price of pay for one life. I'm very sorry, said Colonel Hambleton, referring to the loss of seven other Ameri can lives in the rescue opera tion.

title: TV From Moon Improved in Lab
description: The space agency has a $46,008 contract with a three monthold California company to process signals from the moon and improve the quality of Apollo television reception.

title: COTTON FUTURES SHOW INCREASES
description: Cotton futures No. 2 closed 75 cents to $4.65 a bale higher yesterday on the New York Cotton Exchange, reflecting a strong demand for the nearby May contracts and the scarcity of cotton supplies in the United States.

title: HANOI DISTORTION IS CHARGED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 21  The United States charged to day that Hanoi was trying to rewrite history in denying that there was an understanding that it would show military re straint in return for an end to American bombing of North Vietnam in 1968.

title: Ruskin to Quit Investigation Post By July to Enter Law Practice
description: Robert K. Ruskin, the city's Commissioner of Investigation for the last three and a half years, said yesterday that he intended to leave his post in the next few months to return to a morelucrative private law practice.

title: Detroit Editor Elected
description: WASHINGTON, April 21, (UPI)J. Edward Murray, as sociate editor of The Detroit Free Press, was elected presi dent of the American Society of Newspaper Editors today. He succeeds C. A. McKnight of The Charlotte (N.C.) Observer.

title: MUTUAL FUND DATA HALT MARKET RISE
description: A recurring nemesis of the current bull marketrecord net redemptions of mutual fund sharesjolted prices yesterday and transformed a winning session into a loser.

title: Women in the Universities: They Don't Rate
description: People who can remember when questions of race, religion or national ity still appeared as surviving vestiges on application blanks are perhaps not unnaturally dismayed to find that the offending categorizations are being re vivedvia the compilation of data for affirmative action programs in univer sities and Government agencies.

title: For Graffiti, DWR Is a Dirty Symbol
description: For graffiti artists, the handwriting may be on the wall.

title: Weekly Auto Output Up a Bit
description: DETROIT, April 21 (AP)A heavy overtime schedule tomor row caused a slight rise in United States auto production this week, the trade journal Automotive News reported yes terday.

title: ALARIUS ENSEMBLE PERFORMS BAROQUE
description: The Alarius Ensemble, a quar tet of instrumentalists devoted to the performance of old mu sic, played a program of works by French baroque composers at Carnegie Recital Hall on Thursday night. The members are Janine Rubinlicht, violin; Sigiswald Juijken, violin and bass viol; Wieland Kuijken, bass violin, and Robert Kohnen, harpsichord. The instruments they used were made during the 17th and 18th centuries.

title: Key Hughes Aide Charged in Canadian Stock Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 21 An attempt will be made to ex tradite one of Howard Hughes's top aides to Canada to answer a charge that he conspired in a stock manipulation scheme to fleece Canadian investors, a Montreal lawyer said today.

title: GUSTAVE I. TOLSON
description: Gustave I. Tolson, a retired partner in the cotton brokerage firm of Geo. H. McFadden & Bro., 140 Cedar Street, died Thursday at Roosevelt Hospi tal after a long illness. He was 78 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street and in Sagap onack, L.I.

title: Two in Soviet Doomed In FruitJuice Scandal
description: MOSCOW, April 21 (AP) The head of an Azerbaijani fruitjuice plant and his deputy have been sentenced to death by firing squad for pocketing money the state gave them to buy fruit, and making juice out of sugar, water and citric acid.

title: PAIN KILLER TEST IS LED BY ASPIRIN
description: Aspirin has once again been shown to be a powerful pain killer, this time outranking such supposedly potent prescription drugs as codeine, Darvon and Talwin in a test at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn.

title: STATION IS SET UP
description: HOUSTON, April 21Apollo 16's two moon explorers, ex uberant and seemingly tireless, conducted today the first scout ing expedition over the rugged, rocky surface of the lunar highlands.

title: Executive Changes
description: The OwensCorning Fiberglas Corporation has elect ed Carl F. Scarbrough to the post of senior vice presi dentcorporate administration, and Thurman W. Bretz to vice presidentfinance and treasurer.

title: Credit Is Arranged
description: MESA, April 21 (UPI)Talley Industries, Inc., has arranged a $40million threeyear revolv ing credit from a group of major banks. Proceeds will be used to retire existing debt and for extra working capital. In terest rates on the new credit run from onequarter to three quarters of a point over the prime rate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor

title: CONVENTION MOVE IS HELD UP BY G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 Republican party leaders de ferred today a decision on switching their national conven tion from San Diego to Miami Beach pending resolution of legal problems that would arise if the date of the conven tion were advanced from Aug. 21 to Aug. 14.

title: Bertram Lebhar Jr. (Bert Lee), Bridge Star, Sportscaster, Dead
description: Bertram Lebhar Jr., a retired radio and television station op erator, who formerly broad cast sports here under the name of Bert Lee and who was long a leading tournament bridge player, died Thursday in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 65 years old and lived in Lake Park, Fla.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: BOSTON, April 21  For the second time in 30 years, Massachusetts is trying to cope with fundamental eco nomic and social change. The result has been described as loosely controlled re bellion.

title: Bank Holding Unit Cleared
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (Reuters)The Federal Reserve Board approved today the ap plication of First State Banking Corporation, Miami, Fla., to form a bank holding company, composed of the First State Bank of Miami, HialeahMiami Springs First State Bank, North Hialeah First State Bank, Air port First State Bank, and Mi ami Lakes First State Bank.

title: Moon Observatory Set Up To Study Galaxy Mystery
description: HOUSTON, April 21Instruments set up today on the moon by two delighted astronauts initiated the earth's first astronomical observations from a place other than the earth, as well as a variety of other experiments.

title: TIREMAN INDICTED IN HEROIN DEALING
description: Vincent Papa, identified by Federal authorities as one of the nation's biggest importers of heroin, was indicted yester day on charges that he and three other men conspired to buy, sell and transport the drug.

title: U. S. Rejects Attacks in Chile as Cliches
description: SANTIAGO Chile. April 21 (UPI)The United States last night attacked the shotgun po litical charges of Cuba, China and Albania in the United Na tions Conference on Trade and Development.

title: Changing P.T.A.: No Longer Concerned Only With School
description: For many of its 75 years, the image of the P.T.A. has been that of a group of stodgy but wellmeaning mothers whose major proj ects of the year ran to bak ing brownies for the school open house, or planning the traditional Welcome, New Teachers picnic.

title: Big Brother and Broadcasting
description: Dr. Dennis Gabor, whose work in holography won a Nobel Prize, once told me: The future cannot be pre dicted but it can be invented. I agree. Prediction is a highrisk business; pre diction in television is prohibitively high.

title: 7 Danbury Inmates Protest War From Tower
description: DANBURY, Conn., April 21 Seven inmates were perched atop a 175foot water tower today at the Federal Correc tional Institution here, to pro test the war in Vietnam.

title: Humphrey Against Invasion
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 21 Senator Humphrey said in an interview tonight that he had spoken out vigorously against the invasion and that Vice Pres ident Agnew was only trying to justify escalation of the war.

title: Art:
description: It would take a bit of forc ing, but in a pinch you could pair the exhibitions of Jack Tworkov's new work at French & Co., 980 Madison Avenue at 76th Street, with Gregory Gillespie's at the Forum Gallery, 1018 Madison at 79th, as a thumbnail sum mary of what's going on in painting in New York today. Mr. Tworkov would represent those members of the old guard, especially the New York School, who are refin ing and developing abstract painting at a time when it has lost momentum and much of its audience, while Mr. Gillespie would stand for those young realists  not members of any school or movement  who have never lost faith in figurative art and instead of making any kind of return to it are going forward as if the figurative tradition had never been in terrupted.

title: Harvard Lets Negroes Stay in Seized Building
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., April 21 (UPI)Harvard Univer sity was armed today with a court injunction againstbut made no move to oust campus Negroes who seized the administration building to protest university holdings in Gulf Oil Company.

title: Smallcraft Warning Merely, Precaution
description: Many boatmen have mistaken ideas about the meaning of smallcraft warnings, according to the National Weather Services of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: Georgia Called Leader In Aid to Birth Control
description: ATLANTA, April 22 (UPI)  Georgia's familyplanning program is the most popular in the country, the Department of Health, Education and Welfare said this week.

title: SANFORD STUMPS NORTH CAROLINA
description: DURHAM, N.C., April 22North Carolina's first Presidential preference primary is a bare two weeks away, but the state's approximately two million voters have received scant attention from all but one of the candidatesand he is a late entry running hard to be the national Democrats second choice.

title: In Name of Charity, Dancing All NightAnd Next Day, Too
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I.How can you have a charity benefit without (a) at least one socialite in a dress labeled Norell or Galanos, (b) a tycoon in black tie to dance with her, (c) a societycircuit band to play for them  not too loud, please, and (d) lots of donated champagne to keep them in a dancing mood? Those aching legs. Theresa Lattela, of couple number four, is massaged by her seconds during rest period between dancing sessions. At end of the marathon, students gave a rousing cheer for Ben Gay, the rubbing liniment that kept dancers on feet.

title: CANADA POPULATION NEARING 22 MILLION
description: OTTAWA, April 22Canada's population has risen to nearly 22 million, but the rate of increase is declining.

title: U.S. POLISH CHURCH IS FACING CHANGES
description: SCRANTON, Pa., April 22The Polish National Catholic Church, which was organized in this city 75 years ago, is weighing some radical changes that include admitting other religiousethnic groups and authorizing more English masses.

title: Ardell Curtis Is Bride Here
description: Miss Ardell Susan Curtis, a teacher in the New York City school system, was married here yesterday to Wilfred Henry Holland, a financial analyst with the Columbia Broadcasting System.

title: Iran 41 Victor
description: TEL AVIV, April 22 (AP)Iran completed a 41 victory over Israel in the European Zone Davis Cup series today by taking the last singles match.

title: A Carolina Family Flies Over to Bonn For Its Dental Care
description: BONN, April 22Mrs. Louise Shaw lives in WinstonSalem, N. C. Her dentist, Dr. Manfred Freise, lives here. Since 1970 she has been flying to Bonn for treatment because, she says, it is cheaper and better than dental service in her home town.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The antiwar student movement has readied another critical point in its turbulent history. Some of its leaders are advocating violence again and some are holding back, while the majority of the university students seems apathetic or frustrated, so this may be a good time to look at the problem.

title: 8 Primaries in 2 Weeks Aim at BlueCollar Voter
description: PITTSBURGH. April 22The most intensive period of Presidential primary activity in American political history will take placeduring the next two weeks.

title: Who Speaks for Nature?
description: Mineral King Valley is a beautiful, secluded stretch land, once intensively mined but now returned to near wilderness, in the Sierra Nevada of California. The valley is protected as both a national game refuge in its own right and as part of Sequoia National Forest. But the United States Forest Service in the Department Agriculture has proved a faithless protector of this defenseless valley.

title: TEACHERS GROUP APPROVES MERGER
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., April 22 The house of delegates of the New York State Teachers Association voted by an overwhelming margin today to approve a merger with the United Teachers of New York.

title: Young and Old Interact in Brooklyn Film Class
description: White Is always good and black always bad in these old films, and the heroines are always blondes, too, a darkhaired15yearold girl commented after watching The City, an educational film made in the 1930's.

title: San Quentin Praises Family Visiting Plan As First Year Ends
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., April 15 (UPI)The family visiting project at San Quentin Prison has passed the oneyear mark without a single instance of trouble.

title: Reeording Is the New Windiness a Return to Wagnerism?
description: WE probably have Wagner to thank for the deification of length in music, for the strange tendency of later composers to equate duration with importance. The Webern reaction to that notion, which not long ago seemed to have driven Wagnerism back into its dark, mystic caves, now appears to have lost much of its power. As we swing frantically from extreme to extreme in 20th Century music, Webernile anhorism and epigram have retreated and the timedefying filibuster has come back into the forefront. No doubt, the New Windiness will run its course in Lime, too, but in the meantime composers are enjoying a new license to spin out modest materials to neoWagnerian lengths. We really do not know yet what, if anything, may come of it. All we can do is listen and not to doze.

title: BOSTON.
description: FOR several years in Boston, a school busing operation has been employed to increase racial integration. A small number of black students from Boston's inner city are transported each school day to rather opulent suburban high schools, some of them as many as 25 miles away. Not all the suburban school systems have accepted the busing program, and hence allwhite schools, or schools with less than 1 per cent nonwhite populations, still exist.

title: FUNDS CANCELED FOR DRUG CENTERS
description: The city's Addiction Services Agency, which is under political pressure to get tough in evaluating the performance of drug programs, has canceled financing for six treatment centers since the beginning of the year and plans to let contracts lapse for several others this summer.

title: Magnetism at Lunar Site Called Strongest Yet Found on Moon
description: HOUSTON, April 22Measurements of magnetism at the Apollo 16 site on the moon have produced readings more than six times stronger than the original measurement conducted in 1969 at the Apollo 12 site in the Ocean of Storms.

title: Miss Stratton Fiancee
description: WESTWOOD, N. J., April 22Mr. and Mrs. Leslie C. Stratton have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Lee Stratton, to James Hamilton Marshall, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Marshall Jr.

title: Summer in the Caribbean a Saving Grace
description: Summer in the Caribbean? Why not?

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S
description: MADISONA contingent of mathematics researchers, sent to a series of seminars in La Jolla, Calif., from the Bell Lab in Murray Hill a few years ago included Benjamin Logan, who has been doing mathematics research at Bell for 16 years.

title: Majority Of Boats Not Costly
description: If there ever was an untruth, it's that you have to have money to buy a boat. Sure, if you want to sail around in a 50foot yacht or zip along in a luxurious cabin cruiser, it's going to cost plenty of bread.

title: Cat Bitten by Bird Turns Turtle
description: David B. Jordan of Wantagh, L.I., parked his Aqua Cat on his lawn recently, between sailing weekends, with the mast up.

title: U.S. Relief Aid to Laos Reported to Be Diverted
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The General Accounting Office has reported that United States refugee relief programs in Laos are being used in part to support paramilitary forces there. These forces, it was said, include Meo tribesmen who serve in the clandestine army operated by the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: PENN CAPTURES CHILDS REGATTA
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 22Pennsylvania's three heavyweight crews swept the Childs Cup regatta from Princeton and Columbia today on cold, rainy Lake Carnegie.

title: In Haiti, Things on the Surface Seem the Same, but Many Changes Are Emerging
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, April 22 For hours the Haitians waited in a wretchedly hot sun. They bought ices and thankfully accepted glasses and pails of cool water offered by householders who live across the street from the whitewalled cemetery where President Francois Duvalier was interred year ago.

title: Hamptons Cruller Man Takes Cake
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I.What do Van Johnson, Jerome Robbins and Gloria Vanderbilt have in common? The answer to that riddle, if it is one, is Crutchley's Crullers, for those people, along with thousands of others in eastern Long Island, are devoted dunkers of. Fenton E. Crutchley's taste delights. Indeed, the circle of admirers of these handmade fried cakes extends to all 50 states and to American military bases around the world, to which boxes of the goodies are shipped every week.

title: FEMINIST RATES SENATORS VOTES
description: WASHINGTON. April 22Senator George McGovern of South Dakota has received a 100 per cent rating from a feminist newsletter that analyzed Senators voting records on issues of interest to women.

title: Medicine
description: Perhaps the majority receive adequate care, Senator Abraham Ribicoff said recently. He emphasized the word perhaps. Then he went on: But thousands of others spend their waning days in neglect, despair, filth, boredom and unsafe conditions.

title: On the Ore Run in Great Lakes
description: ABOARD THE S.S. CALLAWAY, April 19  Archie Minor passed within six miles of his wife, Mary, and their home on Beaver Island early this morning. But he didn't see them.

title: A Family of 16 Copes With Problems by Working Together
description: NORTHVALERoll call in the Claire household in this North Jersey community takes a little while.

title: Entry Into U.S. Being Sought For 20,000 Cubans in Spain
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The Republican National Committee, White House aides and Republican and Democratic members of Congress are trying to have 20,000 antiCastro Cuban refugees now in Spain admitted permanently to the United States.

title: Jersey's Relief Rolls Rose 2 Times From'66 to 71
description: New Jersey's welfare rolls increased by more than two andl a half times over the fiveyear period ended in 1971, a rate of growth matching that of New York City.

title: The Nation
description: Several thousand strong, they marched down Fifth Avenue last Sunday. It was Right to Life Sundayso designated by New York's Cardinal Cookeand the marchers carried such signs as Stop the War Against Babies. Then on Wednesday, a dozen women stormed the floor of the Assembly in Albany, demanding an end to legalized abortions. We're not going to move, one said, insisting that an antiabortion bill be let out of committee. But eventually, she and her colleagues were led out of the chamber by Assembly attendants. Legislative observers said there was little chance that the move to repeal the twoyearold abortion statutethe most liberal in the nationwould succeed.

title: News of the Rialto
description: ALAN BATES has finally said yes, and let no male chauvinist pig ever again say that only women can't make up their minds. After months of driving competing Broadway producers up the wall with his refusal to decide on a finn commitment, he now has agreed to give us the pleasure of seeing him in the title role of Butley. That's Simon Gray's play which won the London Evening Standard's award as the best of last season in England and in it Bates, according to the peripatetic Clive Barnes, gave one of the greatest acting performances I have ever seen.

title: New & ovel
description: Elizabeth Taylor is a pastel stylist, a celebrant of delicatelydrawn losers. The heroes and heroines in her new book of short stories are likely to come croppers when just within reach of their heart's desire. A frustrated widower, on holiday in Malta, checks into a hotel with the lady of his choice, and finds himself handicapped by gout. A childlike heiress meets her true love at last, then falls off a mountain. A honeymoon couple is made aware of their emotional insufficiency by the clearlyheard rapture in the next room.

title: Trinity's Crew Triumphs
description: EAST HARTFORD, Conn., April 22 (AP)Trinity College's heavyweight crew today defeated Ithaca College, Marist College and the United States Merchant Marine Academy in a regatta on the Connecticut River.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: I am a great admirer of the United States, which contains in great abundance splendors unsurpassed or unknown in Europe. But Europe offers something which is, alas, rare here. A friend and I arrived in Zermatt, Switzerland, on a Saturday evening in the height of the winter season. We did not have hotel reservations and it was said that there was not a bed available. At the hotel opposite the railroad station we described our predicament to the assistant manager. He immediately walked with us to another hotel, which he knew to have a lastminute cancellation. A porter was sent to the station to fetch our luggage. Next day, as our skis had not arrived and the rental stores were closed, our hotel arranged for us to be loaned skis and had their bindings adjusted. Everything was done in a friendly way, which was not dependent on tipping. It is for this kind of treatment that one goes to Europe.

title: Boatmen Find Some Friends in Pollution Muddle
description: Still hanging over the heads of New York boatmen is the problem ofwell, the head. But somewhat less menacingly, for a court has ruled in their favor in their fight against the state's antipollution standards and the state Senate has passed a bill to suspend enforcement until July 1, 1973.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The impending crackdown on billboards disfiguring our highways is good news. However, considering the nature and power of the opposition to this antipollution move and the propensity of the present Government in Washington to become limp at the first sign of business lobbying, we will not believe its promise before the promise becomes accomplished fact. [Editorial April 3.]

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  When President Nixon sent his antibusing legislation to Congress on March 24, the political fervor against busing schoolchildren to achieve desegregation was so strong that the proposals seemed assured of a receptive audience. Instead, they have undergone a severe battering before Congressional committees and elsewhere, and less than one month after submission their prospects of passage seem slim.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The controversy between Senator Fulbright and Frank Shakespeare regarding the domestic showing of the U.S.I.A. film about Czechoslovakia on James L. Buckley's television program Senator Buckley Reports, and the subsequent approval and showing of the film, accompanied by the further remarks of Bruce Herschensohn, the agency's television and motion picture director, have run according to fairly predictable patterns.

title: Symphony Sid Playing His Tuna on Double SS
description: About a year ago, for the first time in his life, Sid Torin found trouble in fishing waters.

title: Shoemaker Rides Quack to 2Length Triumph in $119,400 California Derby
description: ALBANY, Calif., April 22 (AP)  Bill Shoemaker rode Quack to a twolength victory today in the $119,400 California Derby at Golden Gate Fields, leaving Solar Salute and Royal Owl far behind in the West Coast's final tuneup for the May Kentucky Derby.

title: Art
description: NEVER having attended a wake, I cannot vouch for the accuracy of my impression that the James Rosenquist retrospective at the Whitney Museum resembles one: But if a wake is an occasion for viewing a corpse laid out in full regalia, for reflecting upon the character of the deceased, and perhaps for conjecturing the course that led to his death when this course has been unusual if that is what a wake is, then this retrospective is a wake indeed. Many a memorial or centenary exhibition has more life in it than this collection of work covering the brief career to datehardly a dozen yearsof an artist only 39 years old.

title: Memoirs of an ExProm Queen
description: Sasha Davis might well be a female cousin of Alexander Portnoy, germinated in the same ethnic peat moss that has served at least two decades of American literary elite  another secondgeneration Jewish intellectual, flailing against bourgeois constraints and succumbing in sexual conflict. Until now, such fictional warriors have been mostly male. In Memoirs of an ExProm Queen, the familiar, bouncy voyage from mattress to mattress takes place through the looking glass where grudges are reckoned in female terms.

title: Iowa Grounds Guard's Planes In Dispute Over Crash Damage
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, April 22 Gov. Robert D. Ray has grounded 95 planes and 1,625 vehicles assigned to the Iowa Air and Army National Guards until the Federal Government pays damages suffered by two farm families in military jet plane crashes that destroyed their homes in 1968.

title: Volunteer System Hailed In Englewood's Schools
description: ENGLEWOOD  A broad range of volunteers is working to help pupils here in what the school system believes is the most systematic and comprehensive program of its type in the state.

title: Fishing Movie Now Available For Sport Clubs
description: The World's Biggest Fish Bowl, a motion picture on the establishment of a game fishery in Lake Michigan, is available for showing without cost to members of boat, outdoor and rodandgun clubs. The movie illustrates the manner in which wellconceived conservation programs can succeed in developing new recreation facilities.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: In fiction, fantasy and essay, former students of Charles A. Reich at Yale talk about Life. Reich claims in his introduction that these greeners are telling about a transformation that is more permanent than mere counter  culture trips. The reader will have to decide for himself whether this is authentic greening or just reports on how some youngsters spent their summer vacations.

title: Miss Durr Gains Final
description: TUCSON, Ariz., April 22 (AP) Francoise Durr of France moved into the finale of the $18,000 Virginia Slims women's tennis tournament today.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: What the writer of the letter about Europe misses, as do many guidebooks and tour operators, is that the important part of traveling is meeting people from the country one happens to be touring. It is people who make up the culture and history of their land. If one's reason for going to Europe is to eat at a fancy restaurant or look at a river, it might be better to stay home. On the other hand, if the traveler is drawn by something new and strange, wants to step out of his own culture, regards communication not as a barrier but as a challenge, and goes to meet the European people, then he will have invested his time and money wisely.

title: Salvation by seduction
description: Each year of the past four a novel has come from the criminally young D. Keith Mano; The Proselytizer, on schedule, is his fifth. Mr. Mano's signature is characterized by an unfashionable partiality toward the grand moral conundrum (What does it all mean?) and prose that is sometimes mannered, sometimes strained beyond its inherent strength, always fullywritten, bold, inventive. He is one of the few selfconfessed Christian novelists among us, a man willing to collide with The Good Book on matters of grace, immortality, the Fall and salvation.

title: The only exit led to Siberia
description: Doublethink and pirozhki, work permits and a young girl's passion to be prima ballerina: Russia, in George Feifer's The Girl From Petrovka, splits neatly between its passions and the grim police mind that controls it. Twisting through Moscow from an ominous police headquarters toward a market where people lustily fight to buy sausage, panties, pencils, anything before supplies are exhausted, Petrovka is a street that embodies the Soviet divide: the surging, seeking Russian spirit set against the dour bureaucratic mind. In Feifer's simplistic view, the real Russia is soul writ large. Everything else is fake.

title: Harried Commuters Get Chance to Learn Why They're Harried
description: MATAWAN  To the harrid commuter who rushes to the train station with a hasty breakfast behind him and a wearisome day at work ahead, there is hope, finally.

title: Allison D. Jennings, Fiancee Of Henry Ferguson McCance
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., April 22Miss Allison Diana Jennings, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George W. Jennings, plans to be married late next month to Henry Ferguson McCance, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas McCance of Mount Kisco and Fishers Island, N. Y.

title: Travel Notes: Craft Show, Salem Date
description: TEENAGE artisans will demonstrate a variety of early American crafts to young visitors during the Junior High Craft Festival at Old Economy Village in Ambridge, Pa., May 10 and 11. Approximately 30 crafts, including churning, weaving, spinning, strawhat making and woodworking, will be demonstrated from 10 A.M. to 2 P.M. each day. The program is free, but only students in grades 7 to 9 will be admitted; their parents will be able to occupy themselves elsewhere in the 140yearold preserved village, which was built in the 1820's by the Harmony Society, a group of German Separatists. The young craftsmenteachers, called TADs (TeenAge Docents), also, act as guides in the Old Economy museum.

title: One Day Trips For Horticultural or Nature Learning
description: Thomas Henry Huxley said it well, To a person uninstructed in natural history, his country seaside stroll is a walk through a gallery filled with wonderful works of art, ninetenths of which have their faces turned to the wall.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor So deeply did Rosalyn Drexler, sink her fangs in John Gruen that  anesthetized by her own venomshe quite forgot to tell us what he was up to.

title: Bing Says Farewell to the Met
description: Twentytwo years after he grasped the silken threads of power over the Metropolitan Opera, Sir Rudolf Bing yesterday said farewell to the premier opera company of the world.

title: Duke Takes Sleeping Pills for 3 Nights
description: HOUSTON, April 22Lieut. Col. Charles M. Duke Jr. of the Air Force has taken barbiturate sleeping pills to help overcome his insomnia during the last three nights in space and on the moon.

title: MARIETTA EIGHTS GAIN 2 VICTORIES
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Marietta College's varsity heavyweight and lightweight crews scored easy victories on the Potomac River today.

title: God, Godspell And South Africa
description: Should American playwrights permit their works to be staged in apartheid South Africa? Like many writers during the past decade, Stephen Schwartz, author of Godspell, faced this question recently when a South African theatrical agent, Bob Courtney, wrote to Schvvartz's agent, Shirley Bernstein, applying for the rights to the popular musical. Here is the correspondence, starting with Mr. Courtney's letter from South Africa.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: John Canaday's column on Norman Rockwell saddened me more than any art commentary I've read since Andrew Wyeth was quoted as saying I stand for something discarded in the American country in 1970.

title: Braves Rout Reds, 117
description: ATLANTA, April 22 (AP)The Atlanta Braves hit five home runs, including two by Earl Williams and the 640th of Henry Aaron's career, and broke a sixgame losing streak with an 117 triumph over the Cincinnati Reds tonight.

title: Five Westchester Links Post New Public Rates
description: The five public Westchester golf courses will post new rates, Commissioner Charles E. Pound has announced.

title: Television
description: THREE young Davids named Greg, Richard and Henry, all in their 20's, are doing battle against the Goliath of public television, Just over a year ago they formed a research, andaction collective which they call the Network Project. (It's a hangloose outfit. Totally disorganized. Nobody knows which end is up. No membership cards, no dues.) Their aim, among other things, is the elimination of censorship over the mass media by both government and those who sit astride the means of communication, and the decentralization of control over the content, schedule and other facets of broadcast programing. No less.

title: JAZZROCK IS PLAYED BY WEATHER REPORT
description: Weather Report, like John McLaughlin's Mahavishnu Orchestra and Miles Davis's various groups, brings the electric energies of rock music to the freewheeling improvisations of contemporary jazz, The difference among the various groups, in fact, is more one of proportionsmore jazz or less rockand expertise rather than style or manner.

title: Talk Between Texas and Moon
description: ORION (11:38 A.M.). O.K. Houston we're going to get out.

title: G.O.P. Rebel In Nassau Has an Eye On Albany
description: MINEOLA, L. I.Edward S. Cabot, a young Port Washington lawyer, is betting his $22,000ayear job with Nassau County that he can defeat the county Republican organization in a primary fight for a seat in the Assembly.

title: Alicia Di Napoli Wed
description: Miss Alicia Pauline Di Napoli, daughter of Dr. Raphael J. Di Napoli of Brooklyn and the late Mrs. Di Napoli, was married yesterday morning to Robert Norman Williams, son of Norman W. R. Williams of Garden City, L. I. and the late Mrs. Williams. The ceremony was performed in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Francis Xavier in Brooklyn by the Rev. Ernest Rudloff, cousin of the bride.

title: Their love was a thing apart
description: In an age when Lesbianism has become a political rallying cry, it sometimes requires conscious reminders that it is essentially a private affair. Isabel Miller's novel, Patience and Sarah comes as such reminder, a love story between two early 19thcentury women Who, however strongminded, gloried in their womanhood.

title: White Sox Win Twin Bill
description: CHICAGO, April 22 (AP) Carlos May's second home run of the season, a line shot into the rightfield stand leading off the eighth inning, gave the Chicago White Sox a 32 victory over Kansas City today and a doubleheader sweep against the Royals.

title: Rainout at Charlotte
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., April 22 (AP)Rain washed out the semifinals of the $50,000 North Carolina National Bank tennis tournament today.

title: UNIONS ORDER END TO STRIKE IN QUEBEC
description: MONTREAL, April 22After attempting to defy emergency backtowork legislation, union leaders for public service workers today ordered some 210,000 employes to report for duty in hospitals, schools, retail liquor outlets and provincial courts. The workers have been on strike in Quebec Province for 11 days.

title: Rudolf Bing to Teach at Brooklyn College
description: Sir Rudolf Bing, a man who can say of himself, I am a dropout who is barely able to read or write, will teach two courses next fall when he becomes Brooklyn College's Distinguished Visiting Professor of Music.

title: Rutgers Heavyweight Crew Tops Syracuse by HalfLength
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., April 22 Rutgers varsity heavyweight crew posted its first victory of the season today when it beat Syracuse by less than half a length in an exciting 2,000meter race on the Raritan River.

title: Mail:
description: To the Editor: I am a Dartmouth College senior and, along with a few of my friends, would like to know what the world's record is for the longest game of beerpong. Maybe a word of explanation is necessary.

title: FLOW LEVELS SET ON RIVER ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES. April 22A new decision in the allocation of water rights in this waterscarce state has prompted a reassessment of a Federal master plan to transport water from the northern part of the state down to the Central Valley.

title: 2 Counties Pondering Container Problem
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I.Both Nassau and Suffolk Counties are debating a weighty problem: what to do about nonreturnable bottles and cars.

title: POLES ENCOURAGE MINORITY FAITHS
description: GRABARKA, Poland, April 16  This little village, with its small church perched on a hill, surrounded by tall, leaning pines that seem ready to topple over it, is the heart of the 800,000member Polish Orthodox Autocephalic Church, the largest religious minority in this predominantly Roman Catholic country.

title: Miss Whidden Wed To James Bonner
description: WESTPORT, Conn., April 22Miss Susan G. Whidden and James Christopher Bonner were married here this afternoon in the Christ and Holy Trinity Episcopal Church. The Rev. Dana F. Kennedy, an Episcopal priest, and the Rev. Cornelius J. Loony, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Barry Is Main Catalyst in Nets Transformation
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., April 22His coach says, He is always thinking, his mind is so active, he must even sleep with his eyes open. He is a perfectionist and a worrier.

title: Miss Danuta Olizarowski Is Married
description: ST. LOUIS, April 22Miss Danuta Liliana Olizarowski and Nicholas Tivy Carton were married here this noon in the Priory Church on the campus of St. Louis Priory School. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Anatol Olizarowski of suburban Crestwood.

title: TRUE KNIGHT IS 2D
description: Taking kindly to the heavy going at cold and rainy Aqueduct yesterday, Upper Case of the Meadow Stable inscribed his name in capital letters in winning the 48th running of the Wood Memorial. The formidable son of Round Table beat 11 rivals in the 1 test for 3yearolds, a race that had a gross value of $118,400, and the achievement was popular with the crowd of 37,451.

title: METHADONE PLANS SCORED IN HARLEM
description: Methadone maintenance programs and the proposal that the city experiment with heroin maintenance were sharply debated yesterday at a conference on community needs held by Community Board 11 at Intermediate School 117, 240 East 109th Street.

title: SHOP TALK
description: WANTAGH, L.I.  Outsiders might or might not be very interested in the fact that this community, formerly known as Jerusalem and Ridgewood, was settled in 1664. But its residents certainly don't sit back and treat their history lightly.

title: Space
description: HOUSTONThe flight of Apollo 16 began as a sleeper. The most exciting thing about the launch of the moonbound spacecraft last Sunday was not the thunder of its Saturn 5 booster or the trail of fire it drew across the blue Florida sky, but the enthusiasm Of Yevtushenko, the Soviet poet, who witnessed it. It was beautiful, he said. It was poetry.

title: Lack of Funds Halts Cancer Research
description: PRINCETON  Mothballing is a process people normally associate with aging warships, but at Princeton University the term applies as well to expensive highenergy nuclear particle accelerators.

title: Pacers Top Stars, 118108, Tie Series
description: BLOOMINGTON, Incl., April 22The Indiana Pacers stormed to a big fourth quarter in the Indiana University Assembly Hall tonight to beat the Utah. Stars, 118108, and even their fourofsevengame A merican basketball Association Western Division championship series at two victories apiece.

title: Letters
description: Dr. Chesen's lack of knowledge in matters religious is surpassed only by my lack of knowledge in matters of medicine.

title: Huge Siberian Gas Field Opens; May Someday Supply U.S. East
description: MOSCOW, April 22The Soviet Union announced today the start of production in a gigantic and remote Siberian gas Held.

title: Nyack Club Spawning Nationally
description: The Nyack Boat Club is starting its 64th season. The members are getting ready not only for their own races, beginning May 7, but also to playing host Aug. 2124 for the national championship of the Highlander Class.

title: Love and Hate
description: Any account, however perfunctory, of ethology must take note of the circumstance that this lively and comparatively youthful discipline is at the present moment quite prosperously situated. Regarding itself as the biology of behavior, it is still at that early stage in the development of science  as that development has been described by Thomas S. Kuhnin which factcollecting and datagathering, the recording and juxtaposition of observations and descriptions among a virtually limitless range of phenomena, remain primary activities. One of the many consequences of this relatively undifferentiated state of the study is that the writings of ethologists continue to be accessible to the generally educated reading public. The field has not yet become so specialized, the great divide of quantification has not yet been crossed, as to render ethology as remote to the nonspecialist reader as quantum mechanics or recursive function theory.

title: Black Policemen Walk Delicate Beat
description: DETROIT, April 22  Lee Adams, a young black policeman here, treads a fine line each day between sympathy for his people and the demands of his job.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: The letters of F. Scott Fitzgerald and his editor at Scribner's, Maxwell E. Perkins. Much of the deadwood that is part of any correspondence has been removed; what remains is full of energy and life, to use Perkins's description of the first Fitzgerald manuscript he saw. The stages of a writer's development are revealed with a marvelous clarity; and, like raisins in a cake, the letters are full of telling comments on Hemingway, Thomas Wolfe, Ring Lardner, Edmund Wilson, Willa Gather, Edith Wharton, Carl Van Vechten and other contemporaries.

title: Remains of Dom Pedro I Are Returned to Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 22 (AP)  The remains of Dom Pedro I, Brazil's first emperor, were returned today to the land he proclaimed independent from Portugal nearly 150 years ago.

title: Ideal of Unity Stirs Appalachian Poor
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., April 22In other parts of the country, the pop wall posters feature Dennis Hopper on his Easy Rider motorcycle or Che Guevara staring moodily into the future. But here in a storefront office in Appalachia, the pop poster features Mother Jones, a prim old lady who looks like everybody's grandmother.

title: Nagurski, Football Legend, Finds Game Dull Now
description: INTERNATIONAL FALLS, Minn., April 22The hands are the same, large meaty paws that totally envelop a visitor's handshake fimly. The arms are muscular logs leading up to shoulders that virtually fill the doorway and a neck that measures over 19 inches around.

title: London Trains Are Slowed
description: LONDON, April 22 (UPI)Railwaymen, defying court orders for a twoweek coolingoff period in their pay dispute, continued a rulebook sloivdown that crippled train service in and around London today. Other regions reported that services were hack to nearly normal after a week of chaos.

title: Public Hearings Listed By City Council Groups
description: Following are public hearings and open meetings scheduled for this week at City Hall by committees of the City Council:

title: EUGENE F. GILLIES
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., April 22 Eugene F. Gillies, New York district sales manager for Dun & Bradstreet, Inc., died Wednesday in St. Barnabas Hospital, Livingston. He was 60 years old.

title: Yale Wins in Lacrosse, 76, From Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 22Tom Fagan scored unassisted from 12 feet out midway through the fourth period today to snap a tie and give the Yale lacrosse team a 76 victory over Princeton.

title: Bangladesh Acts to Curb Crime Wave
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, April 22 Bangladesh authorities have deployed police and military forces on a wide front to curb a wave of crime that has followed the war of independence.

title: Some Diplomats Send Families From Hanoi Because of Raids
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, April 22 (Agence FrancePresse)Diplomats have begun to send their families out of North Vietnam because of the new wave of American attacks.

title: ChildrenAid Unit Formed
description: NEWARK  A Citizens Committee for Children of New Jersey has been formed to seek protection for children affected by housing, educational and economic problems. Dr. Leontine Young, executive director of the Child Service Association, has been elected chairman of the group, which has offices at 284 Broadway here.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: I agree with Charles C. Tillinghast Jr., T.W.A. chairman, that most persons traveling abroad this summer will fly on scheduled airlines (''Trust Only the Skeds, April 16). That was exactly the point of my article in the same issuenamely, that far from skimming the cream off their business, the charter airlines have actually helped build scheduled carrier traffic by introducing new classes of people to air travel.

title: If You Go
description: to Timbuktu and other points in Mali, brace yourself for a hot time. The average daytime temperature is between 100 and 120 degrees, but it's dry heat, so you won't wilt. And at night the temperature can drop 50 degrees.

title: McKinney Errs 4 Times; 9 Boston Runs Unearned
description: BOSTON, April 22Rich McKinney, who started his New York career with mixed emotions about the traditional lucky numbers, 7 and 11, might have reconfirmed his doubts today as he committed four errors at third base, tying an American League record. He allowed six unearned runs to score in Boston's 117 victory over the Yankees.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In your April 16 editorial Tax Deadline you noted that Representa tive Les Aspin of Wisconsin disclosed a study by the Vocational Reading Power Project which showed that vast numbers of taxpayers cannot understand the incometax forms and even college graduates have trouble understanding them.

title: MRS. MURRAY LEVISON
description: Mrs. Prudence Burns Levison, wife of Murray Levison, vice president of the New York Stock Exchange firm of Haas Securities Corporation, died yesterday of cancer in Stamford, Conn., where she lived. Her age was 45.

title: Gold Puts Career on Line
description: ALBANY State Senator Emanuel R. Gold may have begun the end of his political career last week when he fought, angrily and vainly, a bill designed to kill the controversial plan for three towers of public housing in his home district of Forest Hills.

title: DODGERS WIN, 10, FOR 6TH STRAIGHT
description: LOS ANGELES, April 22 (AP) Jim Lefebvre slammed his second home run of the year and Bill Singer scattered seven hits tonight as the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the San Diego Padres, 10, for their sixth straight victory.

title: New Assault Is Reported By Gay Activist Member
